original: de ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig la ci'i phyir mi 'gal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig la ci'i phyir mi 'gal zhes pa'o //
translated: Why is it contradictory for a single nature to be a result?

original: gal te yod pa dang med pa ni gcig la cig car 'gal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te yod pa dang med pa ni gcig la cig car 'gal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If existence and nonexistence were contradictory in a single thing,

original: rim gyis ni mi 'gal te /
analyzed: rim gyis ni mi 'gal te /
translated: then they would be contradictory in sequence.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu 'ga' zhig sngar rgyu'i dus la sogs par ni med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu 'ga' zhig sngar rgyu'i dus la sogs par ni med la /
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory for some results to not exist at the time of their cause and so on,

original: phyis yod par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: phyis yod par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: and then to exist later.

original: mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi 'thad de /
translated: That is untenable.

original: dngos po yod pa ni med pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas sngar med ces pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ni med pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas sngar med ces pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since existence is contradictory with the universal of nonexistence, it would also be contradictory with the distinction ‚Äúit did not exist previously.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang yod pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas phyis yod ces pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang yod pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas phyis yod ces pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, since nonexistence is contradictory with the universal of existence, it would also be contradictory with the distinction ‚Äúit exists later.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i spyi dang khyad par 'gal bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i spyi dang khyad par 'gal bar 'gyur ba de lta na yang /
translated: Even if the universal of existence and nonexistence and the distinctions ‚Äúit did not exist previously‚Äù and ‚Äúit exists later‚Äù were contradictory,

original: sngar med ces med pa'i khyad par dang / phyis yod ces yod pa'i khyad par ni 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: sngar med ces med pa'i khyad par dang / phyis yod ces yod pa'i khyad par ni 'gal ba med de /
translated: the distinction ‚Äúit did not exist previously‚Äù of nonexistence and the distinction ‚Äúit exists later‚Äù of existence would not be contradictory.

original: ji ltar bum pa lta bu'i rdzas kyi dngos po khang bzangs kyi phyi rol na ni med la nang na ni yod do zhes yod pa dang / med pa'i khyad par mi 'gal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa lta bu'i rdzas kyi dngos po khang bzangs kyi phyi rol na ni med la nang na ni yod do zhes yod pa dang / med pa'i khyad par mi 'gal ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is not contradictory to say that a vase, a substantial thing, is present outside the house but absent inside the house.

original: gzhan du na bde @84a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na bde @84a * //
translated: Otherwise, when theüîΩMadhyamikas are asked whether the present experience of pleasure and so

original: ba la sogs pa da ltar nyams su myong ba 'di nyid sngar gyi dus na yod dam med ces dbu ma pa rnams la dris shing brtsad pa na /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa da ltar nyams su myong ba 'di nyid sngar gyi dus na yod dam med ces dbu ma pa rnams la dris shing brtsad pa na /
translated: forth existed in the past,

original: sngar nas yod ces ni brjod par mi nus la /
analyzed: sngar nas yod ces ni brjod par mi nus la /
translated: one cannot say that it did.üîΩTherefore, since it is taught that this very thing that exists now did not existüîΩpreviously, why would it not be the case that existence and nonexistence are

original: de'i phyir da ltar yod pa 'di nyid sngar med ces ston pas yod pa dang med pa dus snga phyi la ltos te mi 'gal ba nyid du ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar yod pa 'di nyid sngar med ces ston pas yod pa dang med pa dus snga phyi la ltos te mi 'gal ba nyid du ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: not contradictory in terms of the earlier and later times?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it would not.

original: sngar med ces dgag pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngar med ces dgag pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the negation ‚Äúdid not exist previously‚Äù is twofold.

original: yod pa bkag pa tsam gyi med dgag ri bong gi rva lta bu dang / ma yin par dgag pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa bkag pa tsam gyi med dgag ri bong gi rva lta bu dang / ma yin par dgag pa'o //
translated: It is either a nonimplicative negation, which is the mere negation of existence, like the horn of a donkey, or an implicative negation.

original: de la ri bong gi rva lta bu'i med par dgag pa ni yod pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas da ltar yod ces pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal la /
analyzed: de la ri bong gi rva lta bu'i med par dgag pa ni yod pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas da ltar yod ces pa'i khyad par dang yang 'gal la /
translated: In that regard, since the negation of something that is like the horn of a rabbit is contradictory with the universal of existence, it is also contradictory with the distinction ‚Äúnow exists.‚Äù

original: khyad par de yang med pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas sngar med ces pa'i med dgag gi khyad par dang 'gal bar ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par de yang med pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas sngar med ces pa'i med dgag gi khyad par dang 'gal bar ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: Since that distinction is contradictory with the universal of nonexistence, why would it not be contradictory with the distinction of the negation of something that is ‚Äúdid not exist previously‚Äù?

original: yang ma yin par dgag pa yang gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ma yin par dgag pa yang gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the negation of something that is not is also twofold:

original: sngar med ces sngar gyi dus bsdus pa dang / da ltar yod pa 'di nyid sngar gyi med pa yin zhes da ltar ba'i chos su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: sngar med ces sngar gyi dus bsdus pa dang / da ltar yod pa 'di nyid sngar gyi med pa yin zhes da ltar ba'i chos su bskor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDid not exist previously‚Äù includes the prior time, and ‚ÄúThis now existing did not exist previously‚Äù is turned into a phenomenon of the present.

original: de la snga ma ltar na snga phyi dus 'gal bar dus de dag gis bsdus pa'i yod pa dang med pa yang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la snga ma ltar na snga phyi dus 'gal bar dus de dag gis bsdus pa'i yod pa dang med pa yang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that regard, if it is the former, then since the prior and subsequent times are contradictory, existence that is included in those times is also contradictory.

original: yod med rang bzhin 'gal ba la dus 'gal ba bsnan pas ni 'gal ba snga ma spong bar mi 'gyur zhing ches shin tu 'gal ba nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur ba soms shig /
analyzed: yod med rang bzhin 'gal ba la dus 'gal ba bsnan pas ni 'gal ba snga ma spong bar mi 'gyur zhing ches shin tu 'gal ba nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur ba soms shig /
translated: Since the contradiction of existence and nonexistence is contradictory with the contradiction of the times, the former contradiction is not eliminated. Think about how it is that it is not the case that it is just a very great contradiction!

original: gzhan yang gnyis pa ltar na da ltar yod pa 'di nyid sngar med pa'o zhes sngar med pa da ltar yod pa'i chos su bsdus pa ni mi 'gal mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis pa ltar na da ltar yod pa 'di nyid sngar med pa'o zhes sngar med pa da ltar yod pa'i chos su bsdus pa ni mi 'gal mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, if it is as in the second case, it is not contradictory to include the present existence in the category of a phenomenon that did not exist previously and now does exist, saying, ‚ÄúThis present existence did not exist previously.‚Äù

original: de ni med pa'i ming gis brjod kyang yod pa nyid yin pas de 'dra ba rgyu las skye bar 'dod pa ni 'bras bu yod pa skye ba'i phyogs la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i ming gis brjod kyang yod pa nyid yin pas de 'dra ba rgyu las skye bar 'dod pa ni 'bras bu yod pa skye ba'i phyogs la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, although it is expressed by the name of nonexistence, it is still existent. Therefore, asserting that such a thing arises from a cause is to rely on the position that an existent effect arises.

original: yul gyi dpe yang phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: yul gyi dpe yang phyogs kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The example of the object is also not established because it is included in the category of direction.

original: ji ltar phyi rol na med pa nyid nang na yod pa'i bdag nyid do zhes yod pa'i chos su bskor ba ni med pa'i ming gis brjod kyang don byed nus pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol na med pa nyid nang na yod pa'i bdag nyid do zhes yod pa'i chos su bskor ba ni med pa'i ming gis brjod kyang don byed nus pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin la /
translated: Just as external nonexistence is included in the category of an internal existent, although it is expressed by the name of nonexistence, it is still an entity because it is able to perform a function.

original: gzhan yang yod pa dang med pa phyi dang nang gi yul gyi chos su bsdus pa ni yul 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa dang med pa phyi dang nang gi yul gyi chos su bsdus pa ni yul 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Moreover, the inclusion of existence and nonexistence in the category of external and internal objects is contradictory because the object is contradictory.

original: snga ma ltar yod med rang bzhin 'gal ba la /
analyzed: snga ma ltar yod med rang bzhin 'gal ba la /
translated: As in the previous case, existence and nonexistence are contradictory by nature.

original: yul 'gal ba bsnan pas phyir zhing shin tu 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul 'gal ba bsnan pas phyir zhing shin tu 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And by adding the contradictory object, the contradiction becomes even stronger.

original: yang phyi rol @84b na med ces pa'i med dgag gi khyad par ri bong gi rva lta bu ni yod pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas yod pa'i khyad par nang na yod pa dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o
analyzed: yang phyi rol @84b na med ces pa'i med dgag gi khyad par ri bong gi rva lta bu ni yod pa'i spyi dang 'gal bas yod pa'i khyad par nang na yod pa dang yang 'gal bar 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o
translated: Moreover, the particular of nonexistence, which is a nonimplicative negation, as in ‚Äúexternal reality does not exist,‚Äù is contradictory to the universal of existence. Therefore it is contradictory to the particular of existence, which is internal. This should be understood as explained above.üîΩHaving thus refuted the position that nonexistent effects arise, the second position will now be refuted.

original: // de ltar med pa skye ba'i phyogs bkag nas phyogs gnyis pa dgag pa ni 'bras bu snga nas yod pa ni /
analyzed: // de ltar med pa skye ba'i phyogs bkag nas phyogs gnyis pa dgag pa ni 'bras bu snga nas yod pa ni /
translated: An effect that exists prior to its arisingüîΩcannot be produced,

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis rdzogs zin pas skye bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis rdzogs zin pas skye bar mi 'thad de /
translated: because it already exists in its entirety.

original: skye zhes pa'i don ni grub zin pa ma yin pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: skye zhes pa'i don ni grub zin pa ma yin pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarising‚Äù is that which has not yet come into existence comes into existence.

original: yod pa ni grub zin pa yin pas yod pa skye zhes pa yang ci'i phyir na 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ni grub zin pa yin pas yod pa skye zhes pa yang ci'i phyir na 'gal bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Since an existent is that which has already come into existence, why would it not be contradictory to say ‚Äúan existent arises‚Äù?

original: gal te mngon par gsal ba'i bdag nyid sngar ma grub pa rgyu'i byed pa'i rjes su byung bas rgyu las skye ba 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon par gsal ba'i bdag nyid sngar ma grub pa rgyu'i byed pa'i rjes su byung bas rgyu las skye ba 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is tenable that the self-existence of manifestation arises from a cause because it occurs subsequent to the activity of the cause,

original: de ltar na gsal ba nyid 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gsal ba nyid 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: then manifestation would be the effect,

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the characteristics of an effect.

original: de ltar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that,

original: de sngar med pas yod pa skye ba'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sngar med pas yod pa skye ba'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the position that what did not previously exist comes to exist is undermined.

original: gzhan yang gsal ba dang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gcig par khas len na ni bum pa sngar nas yod pa bzhin du gsal ba yang sngar nas yod par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsal ba dang bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid gcig par khas len na ni bum pa sngar nas yod pa bzhin du gsal ba yang sngar nas yod par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that the self-existence of manifestation and the self-existence of a pot, etc., are identical, then just as the pot existed previously, so too manifestation would have existed previously.

original: gsal ba'i bdag nyid sngar med pa ltar bum pa yang sngar med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i bdag nyid sngar med pa ltar bum pa yang sngar med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, just as the self-existence of manifestation did not exist previously, so too the pot would not have existed previously.

original: gal te de dag tha dad par 'dod na rgyu'i byed pa gsal ba nyid la sbyor bas bum pa'i dngos po rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag tha dad par 'dod na rgyu'i byed pa gsal ba nyid la sbyor bas bum pa'i dngos po rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that they are different, then since the activity of the cause would be applied to manifestation, the entity of the pot would be causeless.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu sngar nas yod pa'i skye ba'i phyogs kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu sngar nas yod pa'i skye ba'i phyogs kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, the position that the effect is produced from that which already exists is also untenable.

original: don 'di nyid mdo sde gzhan las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid mdo sde gzhan las kyang gsungs te /
translated: This very point is stated in another s≈´tra:

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lha mo phung po lnga la chos kyi dbyings ji ltar gdags she na /
analyzed: lha mo phung po lnga la chos kyi dbyings ji ltar gdags she na /
translated: ‚ÄúGoddess, how is the dharmadhƒÅtu designated in the five aggregates?‚Äù

original: phung po lnga po de ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga po de ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose five aggregates are not produced by causes and conditions.

original: de yang gal te rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: de yang gal te rgyu dang rkyen las skye ba zhig yin na ni /
translated: Moreover, if they were produced by causes and conditions,

original: skyes zin la skye'am ma skyes pa skye zhes bya /
analyzed: skyes zin la skye'am ma skyes pa skye zhes bya /
translated: then that which has arisen would arise or that which has not arisen would arise.

original: gal te skyes zin pa skye na ni rgyu dang rkyen kyang mi dgos par rigs so //
analyzed: gal te skyes zin pa skye na ni rgyu dang rkyen kyang mi dgos par rigs so //
translated: If that which has arisen arises, it would be logical that it does not require causes and conditions.

original: gal te ma skyes pa skyen ni skye ba dmigs su med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa skyen ni skye ba dmigs su med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that which has not arisen arises, arising would not be observed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang ma skyes pa'i chos rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid pas ming med pa /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa'i chos rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid pas ming med pa /
translated: Because those phenomena that have not arisen do not exist, they are nameless,

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /
translated: signless,

original: gzhal ba dang / dpag pa dang / dper bya bas mi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhal ba dang / dpag pa dang / dper bya bas mi brjod pa ste /
translated: and inexpressible by means of a known object, an inference, or an example.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: It is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: @85a * // de ltar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid sngar med pa ni yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @85a * // de ltar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid sngar med pa ni yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the non-existent prior to the effect will not become existent.

original: rtag tu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po gang dang yang rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa grub pa med de /
analyzed: rtag tu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po gang dang yang rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog pa grub pa med de /
translated: Because it would be eternally non-existent, it cannot be established as either concomitant with or the reverse of any entity.

original: dper na ri bong gi rab bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rab bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas rtogs bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i sgo nas rtogs bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, cause and effect are to be understood by way of concomitance and reversal.

original: de lta na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam par grub pa med do //
analyzed: de lta na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam par grub pa med do //
translated: Thus, by way of inference and so on, the entity of cause and effect is not ultimately established.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa ste /üîΩdes dben de yi rnam pa can //üîΩmngon sum rnam pa gnyis kyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa ste / des dben de yi rnam pa can // mngon sum rnam pa gnyis kyis ni //
translated: Moreover, direct perception and non-apprehensionüîΩare the means of valid cognition for establishing the entity of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub //
translated: By those two, the entity of cause and effect is established.

original: ces pa yang don 'di la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ces pa yang don 'di la mi 'thad de /
translated: This is also not tenable in this context.

original: 'di ltar mi dmigs pa sngon du song ba'i mngon sum rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dmigs pa sngon du song ba'i mngon sum rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, there are two types of perception that are preceded by non-apprehension.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu 'bras bu snang du rung ba las mi dmigs pa las /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu 'bras bu snang du rung ba las mi dmigs pa las /
translated: In some cases, an effect is suitable to appear in the absence of a cause, and it is not apprehended.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig dmigs la /
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig dmigs la /
translated: In some cases, that which is asserted to be the cause is apprehended.

original: de'i mjug thogs su 'bras bu dmigs pa la brten nas de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su 'bras bu dmigs pa la brten nas de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs pa yin na /
translated: Subsequently, based on the apprehension of the effect, one understands that they are the cause and effect.

original: sngar bshad pa ltar rtag tu med pa la ni sngar snang du rung ba'i mi dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs na dmigs zhes pa'i rgyun gyi thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar rtag tu med pa la ni sngar snang du rung ba'i mi dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs na dmigs zhes pa'i rgyun gyi thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir mi 'thad do //
translated: However, as previously explained, it is untenable that that which is permanent and nonexistent is seen at the beginning of the continuum of the apprehension of that which is suitable to appear, because it is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa ste /üîΩgnyis ka dmigs pa las rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa ste / gnyis ka dmigs pa las rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig mi dmigs na /
translated: Similarly, non-apprehension is preceded by perception.üîΩIn some cases, that which is asserted to be the cause is apprehended, and then that which is asserted to be the effect is not apprehended.

original: de'i rjes su 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig kyang mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa 'ga' zhig kyang mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Subsequently, that which is asserted to be the effect is not apprehended.

original: de lta bu yang rtag tu med pa la 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu yang rtag tu med pa la 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that such a thing is always nonexistent,

original: gnyis ka dmigs pa dang deng phyin chad mi dmigs zhes pa'i mi dmigs pa'i thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka dmigs pa dang deng phyin chad mi dmigs zhes pa'i mi dmigs pa'i thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the beginning of nonapprehension‚Äîthat is, the apprehension of both and the nonapprehension of the present‚Äîis not seen.

original: de bzhin du yod pa yang sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su med par 'gal bas rtag tu yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa yang sngon dang phyi ma'i dus su med par 'gal bas rtag tu yod pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it is contradictory that what exists previously and later does not exist, and therefore it would always exist.

original: dngos po gang dang yang rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog par rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po gang dang yang rjes su 'gro ba'am ldog par rtogs pa med de /
translated: There is no comprehension of the existence or nonexistence of any thing.

original: dper na ri po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a mountain, etc.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas grub pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas grub pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that it is established by means of perception and nonapprehension,

original: gang dag dmigs na dmigs zhes pa'i rgyun gyi thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag dmigs na dmigs zhes pa'i rgyun gyi thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the beginning of the continuum‚Äîthat is, the apprehension of the apprehension of the object‚Äîis not seen.

original: mngon sum sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du song ba'i mi dmigs pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also not tenable that nonapprehension is preceded by perception.

original: de dag las gcig mi dmigs na mi @85b dmigs zhes pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang med pa yod par 'gyur ba 'gal bas med pa skye zhes pa ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag las gcig mi dmigs na mi @85b dmigs zhes pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i thog ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang med pa yod par 'gyur ba 'gal bas med pa skye zhes pa ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the beginning of nonobservation is not seen.

original: skye ba dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since it is contradictory for a nonexistent to exist, it would be contradictory to say that a nonexistent arises, because arising is a property of things.

original: de bzhin du yod pa ni grub zin pa yin la /üîΩskye ba ni 'grub par 'gyur ba da ltar ma grub pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yod pa skye zhes gzhi gcig la bsdu ba yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa ni grub zin pa yin la / skye ba ni 'grub par 'gyur ba da ltar ma grub pa'i bdag nyid yin pas yod pa skye zhes gzhi gcig la bsdu ba yang /
translated: And similarly, since an existent is already established,

original: rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: and since arising is the future, which is not yet established, to say that an existent arises is also contradictory, because it is a contradiction in terms to combine them into a single basis.

original: de ltar na phyogs gnyi ga ltar na yang dam bcas pa las nyams pa dang / gzhan yang ji ltar rgyu'i dus na myu gu med pa dang / du ba med pa dang / ri bong gi rva med ces pa la sogs pa'i med pa rnams la khyad par du gyur pa'i chos 'ga' zhig khas len na ni dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na phyogs gnyi ga ltar na yang dam bcas pa las nyams pa dang / gzhan yang ji ltar rgyu'i dus na myu gu med pa dang / du ba med pa dang / ri bong gi rva med ces pa la sogs pa'i med pa rnams la khyad par du gyur pa'i chos 'ga' zhig khas len na ni dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, according to both positions, you would violate your own thesis, and moreover, if you accept that nonexistents such as the nonexistence of a sprout, the nonexistence of smoke, and the nonexistence of a rabbit‚Äôs horns have some attribute that is a qualifier, then they would become things.

original: khyad par dngos po'i chos kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dngos po'i chos kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because only things can be qualifiers.

original: khyad par med na yang sngar gyi dus na du ba med pa me dang shing gi tshogs pa las skye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: khyad par med na yang sngar gyi dus na du ba med pa me dang shing gi tshogs pa las skye ba bzhin du /
translated: If they are not qualifiers, then just as the nonexistence of smoke arises from the assembly of fire and fuel,

original: myu gu med pa yang de las skye ba nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: myu gu med pa yang de las skye ba nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: the nonexistence of a sprout would also arise from that assembly.

original: skye bar 'dod pa'i med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa'i med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nonexistence that you assert as arising is not different from the nonexistence of a sprout.

original: de bzhin du myu gu med pas dang sa bon gyi tshogs pa las skye ba bzhin du du ba med pa yang de las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du myu gu med pas dang sa bon gyi tshogs pa las skye ba bzhin du du ba med pa yang de las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, just as the nonexistence of a sprout arises from the assembly of a seed and so on, the nonexistence of smoke would also arise from that assembly.

original: skye bar 'dod pa'i med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa'i med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be no different from the non-existence that is asserted to be produced.

original: gzhan yang ri bong gi rva med pa la sogs pa yang rgyu de dag las skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ri bong gi rva med pa la sogs pa yang rgyu de dag las skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the non-existence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on would also arise from those causes,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because, as previously explained, the reason is the same.

original: gal te ri bong gi rva med pa ni sa bon la sogs pa'i byed pa'i rjes thogs su byung ba'i myu gu la sogs par 'gyur ba 'gal bas /
analyzed: gal te ri bong gi rva med pa ni sa bon la sogs pa'i byed pa'i rjes thogs su byung ba'i myu gu la sogs par 'gyur ba 'gal bas /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe non-existence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns is incompatible with being a sprout and so on that arises after the activity of the seed and so on,

original: de dag las skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: so it does not arise from those,‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar myu gu la sogs pa med pa yang phyis kyi yod par 'gyur ba 'gal bas de dag las skye bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar myu gu la sogs pa med pa yang phyis kyi yod par 'gyur ba 'gal bas de dag las skye bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Because, as previously explained, the non-existence of the sprout and so on is incompatible with later existence, it is not tenable that it arises from those.

original: de'i phyir myu gu med pa ni sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa kho na las skye'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu med pa ni sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa kho na las skye'i /
translated: Therefore the non-existence of the sprout arises from the mere assembly of the seed and so on.

original: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las mi skye'o zhes pa'i nges pa dang / ri bong gi rva med pa yang de dag las mi skye zhes pa dang yang rgyu rnams kyi dbang du byas te sa bon la sogs pas med pa'i myu gu skyed par nus kyi /
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las mi skye'o zhes pa'i nges pa dang / ri bong gi rva med pa yang de dag las mi skye zhes pa dang yang rgyu rnams kyi dbang du byas te sa bon la sogs pas med pa'i myu gu skyed par nus kyi /
translated: and the certainty that a sprout is not produced from a combination of fire and so on, and the certainty that a rabbit‚Äôs horns, which do not exist, are not produced from those, and the certainty that seeds and so on, which are causes, are able to produce sprouts, which do not exist,

original: du ba la sogs pa skyed par mi nus la /
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa skyed par mi nus la /
translated: but are not able to produce smoke and so on,

original: me dang shing gi tshogs pas kyang med pa'i du bskyed @86a * //
analyzed: me dang shing gi tshogs pas kyang med pa'i du bskyed @86a * //
translated: and the certainty that a combination of fire and wood is able to produce smoke, which does not exist,

original: par nus kyi myu bu la sogs pa skyed par mi nus zhes pa'i nges pa las kyang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par nus kyi myu bu la sogs pa skyed par mi nus zhes pa'i nges pa las kyang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but is not able to produce a sprout and so on.

original: gzhan yang med par khyad par med pa'i phyir rus sbal gyi rgyab las spu dang / bye ma las kyang 'bru mar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang med par khyad par med pa'i phyir rus sbal gyi rgyab las spu dang / bye ma las kyang 'bru mar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because nonexistence is not differentiated, it would follow that hair would grow from the back of a tortoise and oil would be produced from sand.

original: gal te med pa nyid du khyad par med kyang bye ma dang / rus sbal gyi rgyab las spu dang 'bru mar skyed pa'i nus pa med pas 'byung bar mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gal te med pa nyid du khyad par med kyang bye ma dang / rus sbal gyi rgyab las spu dang 'bru mar skyed pa'i nus pa med pas 'byung bar mi 'thad la /
translated: If you say that although nonexistence is not differentiated, sand and the back of a tortoise are not able to produce hair and oil, and therefore it is not tenable that they arise,

original: me la sogs pa la ni med pa'i du ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod pas mi mtshungs so zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa la ni med pa'i du ba la sogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod pas mi mtshungs so zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: But it is not similar to fire and so on, because they have the ability to produce nonexistent smoke and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar med pa yod par 'gyur ba ni 'gal bas de 'dra ba'i don mi srid la /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar med pa yod par 'gyur ba ni 'gal bas de 'dra ba'i don mi srid la /
translated: That is not so, because, as previously explained, it is contradictory for a nonexistent thing to exist, and such an object is impossible.

original: gal te mi srid pa'i don la nus na rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir na mi nus te nus pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mi srid pa'i don la nus na rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir na mi nus te nus pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If you are able to posit an impossible object, then why are you not able to posit the hair of a tortoise and so on?

original: gzhan yang don dam par gang gis rjes thogs su 'ga' zhig kho na 'byung bar nges pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi 'thad pas khyad par du phyi rol pa la sogs pas byed pa sta ri lta bu dang / de la yod pa'i bya ba gyen du lding ba dang thur du 'bab pa ste byed pa las don gzhan du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang don dam par gang gis rjes thogs su 'ga' zhig kho na 'byung bar nges pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi 'thad pas khyad par du phyi rol pa la sogs pas byed pa sta ri lta bu dang / de la yod pa'i bya ba gyen du lding ba dang thur du 'bab pa ste byed pa las don gzhan du gyur pa dang /
translated: Moreover, since it is untenable that something is dependent on another in the sense that something definitely arises after another, it is untenable that the axe and so on is the agent that cuts the tree and so forth, and that the action of rising and falling is different from the agent.

original: de nyid byed pa po'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / las su bya ba shing dum bu byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid byed pa po'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa dang / las su bya ba shing dum bu byed pa ste /
translated: and that it is controlled by another, the agent, and that it is the object of the action of being cut into pieces.

original: chos kyi bye brag du mar btags pa thams cad kyang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi bye brag du mar btags pa thams cad kyang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: All the various designations of phenomena would be meaningless.

original: gzhi ma grub pa'i khyad par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa'i khyad par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a nonexistent basis has attributes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngon gyi slob dpon dag phyi rol pas brtags pa'i byed pa dang byed pa bo la sogs pa ni mi 'thad cing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngon gyi slob dpon dag phyi rol pas brtags pa'i byed pa dang byed pa bo la sogs pa ni mi 'thad cing /
translated: Therefore, the former masters say: ‚ÄúIt is untenable that external objects are imputed to be agents, actions, and so on by non-Buddhists.

original: gang gi tshe na rgyu'i skad cig yod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu'i skad cig ma med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rgyu'i skad cig yod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu'i skad cig ma med de /
translated: When the moment of the cause exists, the moment of the effect does not exist.

original: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'brel pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'brel pa med mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is certainly the case that things and nonthings are not related.

original: 'on kyang snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba so sor nges pa nyid ni yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes brten cing 'brel par 'byung ba so sor nges pa nyid ni yod de /
translated: However, it is certain that dependent origination is individually ascertained in the statement ‚ÄòIf this exists, that arises.‚Äô

original: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa la ni skur pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyi dbang don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa la ni skur pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyi dbang don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the relationship between karma and its effects, which is included in the completely afflicted and the completely pure, is not denied.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i rigs pa'i rnam grangs 'di dag la sogs pas rgyang ring du spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i rigs pa'i rnam grangs 'di dag la sogs pas rgyang ring du spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who assert that the dependent nature is an ultimate entity are far removed from the teachings of the Transcendent Conqueror by means of these and other forms of reasoning.

original: mdo'i don dang mi mthun pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: mdo'i don dang mi mthun pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: It is clear that they do not accord with the meaning of the scriptures.

original: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan de nyid kyis gzhan @86b dag sngar ni med la phyis yod pa ste /üîΩyod med gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan de nyid kyis gzhan @86b dag sngar ni med la phyis yod pa ste / yod med gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa 'am /
translated: Moreover, the very reasons that were presented above also refute the following assertions: that an effect that did not exist previously arises later;üîΩthat an effect that is both existent and nonexistent arises;

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skye bar 'dod pa yang bsal ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skye bar 'dod pa yang bsal ba ste /
translated: or that an effect that is neither arises.

original: de ltar 'bras bu skye ba'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid don dam par yod pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu skye ba'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid don dam par yod pa mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Since effects are free from these four alternative types of arising, it is untenable to say that the dependent nature exists ultimately.

original: ma skyes pa'i dngos por yod pa ni shin tu dgag par sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i dngos por yod pa ni shin tu dgag par sla ba nyid do //
translated: It is very easy to refute the existence of an unarisen entity.

original: gtan tshigs 'di'i chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di'i chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The subject, the object of refutation, and so on of this argument should be understood in accordance with what was explained earlier.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni sngar ma byung ba'i 'bras bu rgyu las byung ba dang / bum pa dang zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sngar nas yod pa 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyu las mngon pa dang zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni sngar ma byung ba'i 'bras bu rgyu las byung ba dang / bum pa dang zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sngar nas yod pa 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyu las mngon pa dang zhes pa ste /
translated: Here the meaning of the words is as follows: An unarisen effect arises from a cause, and an effect such as a pot or yogurt that already exists manifests from a cause such as milk.

original: rgyu'i byed pa las mngon par gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa las mngon par gsal ba ste /
translated: Manifestation is from the activity of the cause.

original: grangs can pa kha cig 'dod do //
analyzed: grangs can pa kha cig 'dod do //
translated: This is what some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag kyang phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis yun du gnas pa ste rtag par gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag kyang phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis yun du gnas pa ste rtag par gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: Those causes and effects endure for a long time in the manner of mutual dependence, that is, they endure permanently.

original: yang rang gi sde pa nyan thos gnas ma bu ba 'ga' zhig las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams thog mar skye ba dang / de nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar la gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas 'jig par 'dod do ;
analyzed: yang rang gi sde pa nyan thos gnas ma bu ba 'ga' zhig las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams thog mar skye ba dang / de nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar la gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas 'jig par 'dod do ;
translated: Also, some of our own schools, the Sravaka Vatsiputriyas, assert that the sources such as karma and affliction first arise, they endure as long as they have not met the cause of their destruction and they are destroyed when they meet the cause of their destruction.

original: / gzhan yang 'ga' zhig gi lugs kyis ma byung ba'i skye ba dang / skye ba rang gi dus las gzhan du mi gnas par 'dod de /
analyzed: / gzhan yang 'ga' zhig gi lugs kyis ma byung ba'i skye ba dang / skye ba rang gi dus las gzhan du mi gnas par 'dod de /
translated: Also, according to the system of some, arising does not occur in the future and that which has arisen does not endure beyond its time.

original: 'dir phung po zhes pa'i don ni spungs pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dir phung po zhes pa'i don ni spungs pa'i don te /
translated: Here the meaning of aggregate skandha is a heap,

original: rdul phra rab bam skad cig ma du ma 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bam skad cig ma du ma 'dus pa'o //
translated: because many subtle particles or moments are gathered.

original: khams zhes pa ni rigs kyi don nam byed pa med pa la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: khams zhes pa ni rigs kyi don nam byed pa med pa la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis te /
translated: The meaning of element dhatu is type or the meaning of holding its own characteristics without function.

original: phal cher phung po nyid kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phal cher phung po nyid kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: For the most part, they should be understood to be included in the aggregates.

original: skye mched ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo byed pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: skye mched ni rnam par shes pa skye ba'i sgo byed pa'i don gyis te /
translated: The meaning of source ayatana is the door through which consciousness arises.

original: phyi dang nang gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the external and the internal.

original: de la gzugs can gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched ni kun rdzob tsam du yang sems las tha dad pa'i ngo bor grub pa med de /
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched ni kun rdzob tsam du yang sems las tha dad pa'i ngo bor grub pa med de /
translated: Among these, the form aggregates, elements, and sense bases are not established as having a nature that is different from the mind, even as mere convention.

original: sems kyi snang ba nyid la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems kyi snang ba nyid la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are posited as the appearances of the mind.

original: 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa cung zad ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur la /üîΩgrangs dang go rims la sogs pa'i spros pa zhib tu ni chos mngon pa'i mdo dang bstan bcos dag @87a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba la sogs pa cung zad ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur la / grangs dang go rims la sogs pa'i spros pa zhib tu ni chos mngon pa'i mdo dang bstan bcos dag @87a * //
translated: Some of their divisions will be taught below.

original: las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: las shes par bya ste /
translated: The details of their enumeration, order, and so forth should be understood from the Abhidharma sutras and treatises.

original: 'dir ni don gtso bor gtan la 'bebs pas mi spro'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni don gtso bor gtan la 'bebs pas mi spro'o //
translated: Here, since the main point is to determine the meaning, I will not elaborate.

original: blo gros chen po de ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid du bden pa 'ga' zhig don dam par rgyu dang rkyen las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi rgyun dang bya ba dang skye ba ste rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ltar 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid du bden pa 'ga' zhig don dam par rgyu dang rkyen las skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi rgyun dang bya ba dang skye ba ste rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras
translated: Mahamati, those who assert that some truth has a nature that is either existent or nonexistent as an effect ultimately arises from causes and conditions, their continuity, activity, and arising belong to their own continuum of causes and effects.

original: bu'i skad cig du mar 'brel ba dang / sngar bstan pa ltar phyi rol ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i bya ba dang rgyu 'di las skye zhes pa'i rgyu'i chos su gyur pa dang / 'bras bu 'di skye zhes pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: bu'i skad cig du mar 'brel ba dang / sngar bstan pa ltar phyi rol ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i bya ba dang rgyu 'di las skye zhes pa'i rgyu'i chos su gyur pa dang / 'bras bu 'di skye zhes pa 'bras bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i chos dang /
translated: The many moments of the son are related, and as previously explained, the phenomena that are the cause of the statement ‚ÄúThis effect arises from this cause and action,‚Äù such as external action, and the phenomena that are the nature of the effect of the statement ‚ÄúThis effect arises,‚Äù

original: srid pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu 'bras dang / mya ngan las 'das ba dang lam zhes pa go rims bzhin rnam par byang ba'i 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu 'bras dang / mya ngan las 'das ba dang lam zhes pa go rims bzhin rnam par byang ba'i 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: and existence, that is, the cause and effect of thorough affliction, and nirvana and the path, that is, the effect and cause of complete purification, respectively.

original: las dang 'bras bu ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa ste /
translated: Action and effect are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: They are included in thorough affliction and complete purification, respectively, as is appropriate.

original: de dag thams cad kyang bden pa bzhis bsdus pa ste /üîΩde rnams 'jig pa dang / chad par lta ba ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang bden pa bzhis bsdus pa ste / de rnams 'jig pa dang / chad par lta ba ste /
translated: All of those are included in the four noble truths.üîΩThe views of annihilation and of the extremes

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: are the extreme of denial.

original: gal te kun rdzob tsam du 'bras bu sngar med pa skye bar ni theg pa chen po pa khyed cag gis kyang 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tsam du 'bras bu sngar med pa skye bar ni theg pa chen po pa khyed cag gis kyang 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But, you may ask, don‚Äôt you, the Mahayana practitioner, also accept that the effect arises in a way that is previously nonexistent, but only on the conventional level?üîΩSo why do we incur the fault of nihilism?

original: des na kho bo cag la chad par lta ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmngon sum dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des na kho bo cag la chad par lta ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba ci'i phyir zhe na / mngon sum dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The response to this is as follows:

original: don ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: don ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of this has already been explained above.

original: 'dir de dag dang mtshungs par mi 'gyur ba ni snga ma ltar yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid du bden pa'i 'bras bu don dam par skye bar 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir de dag dang mtshungs par mi 'gyur ba ni snga ma ltar yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid du bden pa'i 'bras bu don dam par skye bar 'dod pa ni /
translated: Here, unlike in the case of the above, the effect that is truly existent in terms of the nature of existence and nonexistence is accepted as arising ultimately.

original: tshad mas gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: This is undermined by valid cognition.

original: de las gzhan kun rdzob pa'i skye ba ni khas mi len pas skur pa 'debs pa'i lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las gzhan kun rdzob pa'i skye ba ni khas mi len pas skur pa 'debs pa'i lta bar 'gyur la /
translated: Other than that, since we do not accept conventional arising, we are left with a view of denial.

original: kho bo cag ni ji ltar snang bzhin pa'i skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kun rdzob pa nyid du khas len te /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni ji ltar snang bzhin pa'i skye ba shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kun rdzob pa nyid du khas len te /
translated: We accept that arising is of the nature of consciousness, just as it appears, on the conventional level.

original: de la ni sngar med par snang ba las gnag gis mjug thogs su gang zhig nges par snang ba nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: de la ni sngar med par snang ba las gnag gis mjug thogs su gang zhig nges par snang ba nyid du dmigs te /
translated: In that case, what is definitely perceived immediately after the appearance of what did not exist before is observed.

original: sngar bstan pa lta bu'i spyad pa las grol bas rkyen med ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa lta bu'i spyad pa las grol bas rkyen med ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from the conduct previously explained, it is considered to be without conditions.

original: de ltar gzhung gi cha de rnams kyis ni pha rol po'i phyogs skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhung gi cha de rnams kyis ni pha rol po'i phyogs skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, those parts of the treatise teach that the position of the opponent is just a deprecation.

original: de @87b nyid kyi phyir rang gi lugs kyi don dam pa'i skye ba med ces bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de @87b nyid kyi phyir rang gi lugs kyi don dam pa'i skye ba med ces bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of our system is taught by ‚Äúultimate non-arising.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is thus.

original: 'gags pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsum ni gnas ma bu'i sde ba ltar byung ba'i rgyun 'gags pa dang / 'gag pa de dag gi lugs kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad na gnas par 'dod pa ni skad cig gi dbang du byas nas 'gag pa nyid yin pas 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsum ni gnas ma bu'i sde ba ltar byung ba'i rgyun 'gags pa dang / 'gag pa de dag gi lugs kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad na gnas par 'dod pa ni skad cig gi dbang du byas nas 'gag pa nyid yin pas 'gag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The three, ‚Äúcessation,‚Äù and so on, are the cessation of the continuum of arising according to the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya school, and if the cause of destruction in their system does not contact them, they assert that they endure. Since that is cessation in terms of momentariness, it is called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba ni rgyun 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba ni rgyun 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCeased‚Äù means the continuum has ceased.

original: skad cig gi dbang du byas nas 'gags pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba las gzhan 'gag pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa da ltar ba ni grub pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig gi dbang du byas nas 'gags pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba las gzhan 'gag pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa da ltar ba ni grub pa med do //
translated: From the perspective of the instant, apart from what has ceased and what will cease, there is no present that possesses the action of cessation.

original: bdag gi sems snang ba rang gi sems nyid yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi sems snang ba rang gi sems nyid yin la /
translated: The appearances in one‚Äôs mind are one‚Äôs mind itself.

original: sems de yang snang ba las tha dad kyis dngos por rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems de yang snang ba las tha dad kyis dngos por rtog pa ste /
translated: That mind is also imagined to be a thing that is different from appearances.

original: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa nyid mthong zhing myong ba'i rgyu las phung po la sogs pa 'gags pa la sogs par snang ba byung ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rtog pa nyid mthong zhing myong ba'i rgyu las phung po la sogs pa 'gags pa la sogs par snang ba byung ba ste /
translated: The cause of seeing and experiencing such an imagination is the appearance of the aggregates and so on arising as ceased and so on.

original: 'phral du rtogs pa nyid kyis sgro btags pa'am /
analyzed: 'phral du rtogs pa nyid kyis sgro btags pa'am /
translated: It is a superimposition by the mere thought of the present.

original: yang sngar brtags pa'i sa bon sad ba las de 'dra ba'i snang ba byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang sngar brtags pa'i sa bon sad ba las de 'dra ba'i snang ba byung ba ste /
translated: Or, the appearance of such an imagination arises from the activation of the seed of the previous imagination.

original: mi bden pa'i don blos bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i don blos bzhag pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúunreal‚Äù is posited by the mind.

original: de'i phyir sa bon tshig pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pas stong pas de dag ni rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon tshig pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pas stong pas de dag ni rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba med ces pa'o //
translated: Therefore, like a burnt seed, etc., they are empty of the capacity to generate an effect. Thus, they do not arise in an uninterrupted continuum.

original: de ltar blos brtags pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar blos brtags pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: Thus, it is only the mind that imputes them.

original: nus pas stong pa nyid ni sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: nus pas stong pa nyid ni sngar bstan pa'i gtan tshigs rnams kyis so //
translated: The emptiness of capacity is due to the previously explained reasons.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs skye ba dgag pa'i 'thad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs skye ba dgag pa'i 'thad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan ston te /
translated: By ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, etc.,‚Äù he teaches another alternative refutation of the arising of the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning has been explained previously.

original: yod pa las zhes pa ni grangs can gyi lugs te 'bras bu snga nas yod pa'i rang bzhin las skye ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa las zhes pa ni grangs can gyi lugs te 'bras bu snga nas yod pa'i rang bzhin las skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom existence‚Äù is the SƒÅ·πÉkhya system, where the effect arises from the nature that existed previously.

original: gsum phrad pa ni dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa snga ma'o //
analyzed: gsum phrad pa ni dbang po dang don dang rnam par shes pa snga ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe union of the three‚Äù is the sense faculty, object, and prior consciousness.

original: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log ni de dag gi rang dga'i rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i phyin ci log ni de dag gi rang dga'i rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yin nam /
translated: If such errors are imputed by their own fanciful imagination,

original: snga rabs gzhan gyi tshig la brten pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: snga rabs gzhan gyi tshig la brten pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is based on the words of other ancient ones,üîΩthen it is based on the words of other ancient ones such as the sage Kapila.

original: drang srong ser skya la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshig la brten pa yin no zhes log par rtogs pa brgyud pa nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: drang srong ser skya la sogs pa gzhan gyi tshig la brten pa yin no zhes log par rtogs pa brgyud pa nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: The following passage shows that this is a mistaken view that has been passed down:

original: blo gros chen po de dag la'ang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩrang gi @88a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de dag la'ang zhes pa la sogs pa ste / rang gi @88a * //
translated: ‚ÄúMahamati, some of them say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: Their own characteristics are their own natures.

original: de lta bur ston pa'i bla ma 'ga' zhig yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur ston pa'i bla ma 'ga' zhig yod ces pa'o //
translated: Some gurus teach that way.

original: de dag gis tshul ji ltar ston ce na /üîΩ'das pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis tshul ji ltar ston ce na / 'das pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: How do they teach?üîΩ‚ÄúThe past, the future, and the present‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: sngar bstan pa ltar des dben de'i rnam pa can gyi mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i yul rgyu dang 'bras bu ma 'ongs nas med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i rjes su rgyu dmigs shing de'i rjes su 'bras bu yang mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar des dben de'i rnam pa can gyi mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i yul rgyu dang 'bras bu ma 'ongs nas med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i rjes su rgyu dmigs shing de'i rjes su 'bras bu yang mthong ba ste /
translated: As previously explained, they say that the object of reasoning, such as direct perception, is the absence of the future, which is characterized by the absence of cause and effect.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yod pa dang / de dag las rgyur mngon par 'dod pa cig ma dmigs na 'bras bu yang mi dmigs zhes pa'i don 'das nas med pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu 'bras yod par de 'dra ba'i rigs pa dang /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yod pa dang / de dag las rgyur mngon par 'dod pa cig ma dmigs na 'bras bu yang mi dmigs zhes pa'i don 'das nas med pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu 'bras yod par de 'dra ba'i rigs pa dang /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIf an existent thing of the present and a cause of those are not observed, an effect is not observed‚Äù is that, in the past, cause and effect, which have the characteristics of going and coming, exist in the sense that they do not exist.

original: yid ches pa'i gzhung gis brtag cing gzhal bar bya ba'i sa la gnas shing zhes pa ste /üîΩde lta bu'i yul la brten cing rang gi lta ba'i nyes pa'i bdag chags kyis ston pa ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i gzhung gis brtag cing gzhal bar bya ba'i sa la gnas shing zhes pa ste / de lta bu'i yul la brten cing rang gi lta ba'i nyes pa'i bdag chags kyis ston pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú One should examine and evaluate the ground of the trustworthy scripture‚Äù means that one should rely on such an object.üîΩ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of one‚Äôs own view‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of one‚Äôs own attachment to the self.üîΩ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of the view of the reality of mere appearances‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of the view that mere appearances are real things.

original: ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi don la bden pa'i dngos por phyin ci log tu lta ba'i nyes pa'i bag chags la brten nas /üîΩsnga ma ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam par yod ces ston pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba tsam gyi don la bden pa'i dngos por phyin ci log tu lta ba'i nyes pa'i bag chags la brten nas /üîΩsnga ma ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po don dam par yod ces ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of the view of the reality of mere appearances‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of the view that mere appearances are real things.üîΩ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of the view of the reality of mere appearances‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of the view that mere appearances are real things.üîΩ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of the view of the reality of mere appearances‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of the view that mere appearances are real things.üîΩ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of the view of the reality of mere appearances‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of the view that mere appearances are real things.üîΩ‚Äú One should teach with the faults of the view of the reality of mere appearances‚Äù means that one should teach with the faults of the view that mere appearances are real things.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar phyin ci log gi sa bstan pa la byis pa'i skye bo rnams ser skya la sogs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pas bstan to zhes yid ches par 'gyur ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de ltar phyin ci log gi sa bstan pa la byis pa'i skye bo rnams ser skya la sogs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pas bstan to zhes yid ches par 'gyur ba nyid du ston to //
translated: By ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on, it is shown that childish beings will come to have confidence in the teachings of the Omniscient One, such as the one called Kapila, who taught the stages of error in this way.

original: mi mnyam pa'i blo can zhes pa ni dngos po'i mtshan ma sna tshogs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i blo can zhes pa ni dngos po'i mtshan ma sna tshogs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUneven-minded‚Äù means grasping at the various characteristics of things.

original: mi shes pa ni ston pa snga ma rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni ston pa snga ma rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIgnorant‚Äù should be applied to the previous teachers.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log las bzlog pa'i phan yon ston te //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log las bzlog pa'i phan yon ston te //
translated: By ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on, the benefits of turning away from error are shown.

original: de ltar skye ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad du snang ba dang 'dra bar zung du 'jug pa'i don nyid du rtogs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa sgyu ma'i dpe brgyad du snang ba dang 'dra bar zung du 'jug pa'i don nyid du rtogs zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, the nature of things such as arising is like an illusion, like the eight examples of illusion. Realize the meaning of union in this way.

original: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the words is mostly understood.

original: sprin dang zhes pa ni snying po med pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: sprin dang zhes pa ni snying po med pa'i dpe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúClouds‚Äù is an example of something insubstantial.

original: ma skyes pa ni gzugs brnyan nam mig yor te gzugs kyi dngos por ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni gzugs brnyan nam mig yor te gzugs kyi dngos por ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The unborn is a reflection or a mirage, not born as a real entity.

original: phyi rol gyi sems kyi snang ba yang dpe de rnams dang 'dra bar rtog pas brtags pa'am thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa brtags pa las byung ba'i snang ba tsam du mthong zhes @88b pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sems kyi snang ba yang dpe de rnams dang 'dra bar rtog pas brtags pa'am thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa brtags pa las byung ba'i snang ba tsam du mthong zhes @88b pa'o //
translated: The external appearance of mind is also seen as mere appearance, imagined by thought as those examples, or arising from the conceptual elaborations of beginningless time.

original: rkyen phyir ldog pa med ces pa ni phyin ci log gnas ma gyur gyi bar la rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen phyir ldog pa med ces pa ni phyin ci log gnas ma gyur gyi bar la rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of conditions, there is no reversal‚Äù means that it occurs continuously until the reversal of error.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi ni mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dang ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi ni mtshon par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dang ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The characteristic and the basis of characteristics are the characteristic that is the means of expression and the entity that possesses it.

original: lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa sems can gyi lus so //
analyzed: lus ni dbang po dang bcas pa sems can gyi lus so //
translated: The body is the body of sentient beings together with the sense faculties.

original: longs spyod ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'o //
analyzed: longs spyod ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'o //
translated: Enjoyment is the five sense objects.

original: gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: gnas ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The abode is the world receptacle.

original: yul ni de dag la sogs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yul ni de dag la sogs pa yul gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The object is the nature of those objects and so on.

original: de nyid gzung ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / blo ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du btags pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gzung ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / blo ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du btags pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The mind is free from being labeled as the characteristic of the apprehending subject,üîΩbecause it appears in the aspect of duality.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba yin pas so so rang rig pa'i spyod yul don dam par 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'i don sgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba yin pas so so rang rig pa'i spyod yul don dam par 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma'i don sgom par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, they meditate on the meaning of the middle way of mere awareness, the illusion-like dependent nature, which is the domain of individually self-cognizing primordial wisdom, ultimately free from the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni ring po mi thogs par tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sa las 'das na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni ring po mi thogs par tshogs dang mos pas spyod pa'i sa las 'das na /
translated: Bodhisattvas who meditate in this way will, before long, transcend the levels of accumulation and the path of earnest aspiration.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa thob pa ste /
translated: They will then attain the realization that samsara and nirvana are equality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: Bodhisattvas dwelling on the first ground

original: chos dang sems can rnams dang ni //
analyzed: chos dang sems can rnams dang ni //
translated: With regard to phenomena and sentient beings,

original: de yi bya ba sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: de yi bya ba sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: And with regard to buddhahood,

original: mchog la sems mnyam rnyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mchog la sems mnyam rnyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Attain an attitude of equality.

original: de yi rab dga' khyad par 'phags //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yi rab dga' khyad par 'phags // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The joy of that is especially exalted.

original: yang khyad par du ni sa brgyad pa la bshad de /
analyzed: yang khyad par du ni sa brgyad pa la bshad de /
translated: And it is explained especially on the eighth stage.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe purification of the field,

original: zhing ni rnam par sbyong ba dang // mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa zhes //
analyzed: zhing ni rnam par sbyong ba dang // mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa zhes //
translated: and the Nirvana without remainder,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ro gcig pa nyid du rtogs par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ro gcig pa nyid du rtogs par gsungs so //
translated: It is said that one realizes the sameness of the taste of cyclic life and of Nirva·πáa.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i sbyor ba yang sems can smin pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos sgom pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i sbyor ba yang sems can smin pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos sgom pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The spontaneous application is the application to the maturation of sentient beings and to the cultivation of one‚Äôs own Buddha qualities.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad do //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad do //
translated: It is on the eighth stage and above.

original: phyi rol du lta bas mtshan ma med ces pa ni de lta bu'i tshul gyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du lta bas mtshan ma med ces pa ni de lta bu'i tshul gyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of signs in the external view is the absence of the apprehension of signs in that way.

original: rim gyis sa'i rim pa zhes pa ni sa dang po la sogs pa bgrod pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rim gyis sa'i rim pa zhes pa ni sa dang po la sogs pa bgrod pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ste /
translated: The gradual stages of the stages is the gradual process of traversing the first stage and so on.

original: shes par zad do //
analyzed: shes par zad do //
translated: It is just knowledge.

original: 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: Here, the absence of the characteristics of subject and object will be taught later on, just as in the sutra.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang khyad par dus brgyad pa la'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang khyad par dus brgyad pa la'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization like an illusion is also on the eighth stage.

original: bdag gi sems snang ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni de nas rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du thob pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems snang ba zhes pa la sogs pas ni de nas rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du thob pa'o //
translated: From the line beginning ‚ÄúThe mind appears as‚Äù and so on, he obtains the stage of buddhahood.

original: skye ba dang bya ba ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus len pa 'am @89a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang bya ba ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus len pa 'am @89a * //
translated: Birth and action are the taking of a mental body

original: sems can gyi don du bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba dang / der yang sems can smin pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba dang / der yang sems can smin pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: or the intentional birth in existence for the sake of sentient beings, and also the performance of the action of ripening sentient beings there.

original: ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu'i gzugs ni khyad par du sa bcu pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rdo rje lta bu'i gzugs ni khyad par du sa bcu pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The meditative stabilization like a vajra is the special stage of the tenth stage,

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ni mi shigs shing /üîΩde rnams nyid 'joms par byed pas rdo rje dang chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas ni mi shigs shing /üîΩde rnams nyid 'joms par byed pas rdo rje dang chos mthun pa'o //
translated: because it is indestructible by conceptualization and so on,üîΩand it destroys those conceptualizations and so on.

original: de nyid chos kyi sku'i rjes su 'jug pa de bzhin nyid rtogs shing /
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi sku'i rjes su 'jug pa de bzhin nyid rtogs shing /
translated: It is the realization of thusness, which is the subsequent state of the dharmakaya.üîΩAnd it is the emission of infinite emanations that are of the nature of that thusness.

original: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sprul pa dpag tu med pa 'gyed pa stobs bcu dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dbang bcu dang / snying brtse ba ste sbyor ba med pa'i snying rje dang / snying rje ba ste sbyor ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sprul pa dpag tu med pa 'gyed pa stobs bcu dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / dbang bcu dang / snying brtse ba ste sbyor ba med pa'i snying rje dang / snying rje ba ste sbyor ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The ten powers, the six superknowledges, the ten masteries, compassion, which is non-conceptual compassion, and loving kindness, which is conceptual compassion.

original: de ltar stobs la sogs pa ni 'phags pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos zhus pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: de ltar stobs la sogs pa ni 'phags pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos zhus pa las ji skad du /
translated: Thus, the ten powers and so forth are as they are described in the Sutra of the Questions of the Noble Aroused Power King:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang byang chub sems dpa'i stobs bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang mchis lags sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang byang chub sems dpa'i stobs bcu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang mchis lags sam /
translated: Bhagavan, do the bodhisattvas also have the ten powers of a bodhisattva, the four fearlessnesses of a bodhisattva, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan replied:

original: rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa' gang yongs su sbyar ba byas shing /
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal po byang chub sems dpa' gang yongs su sbyar ba byas shing /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are kings of emanation have fully prepared

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i bzod pa thob pa /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i bzod pa thob pa /
translated: and attained irreversible acceptance.

original: sa brgyad pa la gnas shing sa dgu la 'phar ba /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la gnas shing sa dgu la 'phar ba /
translated: They abide on the eighth level and leap to the ninth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin pa de dag la yod de zhes byang chub sems dpa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa shin tu rgyas par bstan to //üîΩgzhan yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pas yongs su zin pa de dag la yod de zhes byang chub sems dpa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa shin tu rgyas par bstan to // gzhan yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las kyang /
translated: They are fully endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skillful means.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi byang chub sems dpa' la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rigs dang ldan par gsungs te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chod kyi byang chub sems dpa' la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rigs dang ldan par gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the noble S≈´tra on Chanting the Dharma Together teaches that bodhisattvas from the eighth level on have the qualities of the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas and so forth.

original: 'on kyang de dag rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa'i khyad par ni yod do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang ma dag pa'i khyad par ni yod do zhes pa'o //
translated: However, it says that there is a difference in whether they are complete or incomplete, and whether they are pure or impure.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing gi mu stegs can gyi gnas su nye bar 'gro zhes pa ni nus pa dang shes rab la sogs pas de rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing gi mu stegs can gyi gnas su nye bar 'gro zhes pa ni nus pa dang shes rab la sogs pas de rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du nye bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: Approaching the abodes of the tirthikas in the realms of all Buddhas means that he goes there in order to care for them with his power, wisdom, and so forth.

original: sngon gyi las dang smon lam la sogs pa'i stobs kyis kyang khyad par du de rnams 'dul @89b bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang smon lam la sogs pa'i stobs kyis kyang khyad par du de rnams 'dul @89b bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And by the power of his previous karma, prayers, and so forth, he will especially tame them.

original: rim gyis gnas 'pho zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rim gyis gnas 'pho zhes pa ni /
translated: As for gradually changing abodes,

original: rnam par shes pa rnams sngar bshad pa ltar rim gyis gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams sngar bshad pa ltar rim gyis gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the consciousnesses gradually change abodes as explained above.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i don sgom pa nyid du gdams pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i don sgom pa nyid du gdams pa'o //
translated: With O Mahamathi, and so forth, he instructs them to meditate on the meaning endowed with such qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i rjes su 'brang ba rab tu thob ces pa ni thos ba dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i rjes su 'brang ba rab tu thob ces pa ni thos ba dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs pa'o //
