translated: As for attaining the state of following the Tathagata's body, it is the realization of the meaning of thatness through the wisdom of listening and reflection.

original: sems dang rgyu zhes pa la sems nyid rgyu zhes gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: sems dang rgyu zhes pa la sems nyid rgyu zhes gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: As for mind and cause, they are combined into one.

original: sngar bshad pa ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äústorehouse consciousness‚Äù is as explained above.

original: rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ni bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ni bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú One should follow‚Äù means ‚Äúone should cultivate.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang srid pa gsum du snang ba ni bag chags kyis byung ba'o //üîΩgzugs sna tshogs kyi nor bu dang 'dra zhes pa ni shel yongs su dag pas sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar bsgyur ba'i rkyen gyis kha dog sna tshogs su snang ba dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yongs su dag pa yang gdul bya'i bsam
analyzed: gzhan yang srid pa gsum du snang ba ni bag chags kyis byung ba'o // gzugs sna tshogs kyi nor bu dang 'dra zhes pa ni shel yongs su dag pas sngon po la sogs pa'i nye bar bsgyur ba'i rkyen gyis kha dog sna tshogs su snang ba dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yongs su dag pa yang gdul bya'i bsam
translated: Moreover, the appearance of the three realms arises from the latent impressions.üîΩ‚Äú Like a jewel of various forms‚Äù means that just as a completely pure crystal appears as various colors due to the condition of being placed near something blue, etc.,

original: pa'i bye brag gis gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i bye brag gis gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
translated: so also the completely pure pristine wisdom of the TathƒÅgata appears as various forms due to the differences in the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: phra ba ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Subtle‚Äù means that their nature is difficult to understand.

original: sems tsam du 'jug pa ni snang ba sems su rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems tsam du 'jug pa ni snang ba sems su rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Entering into mind-only‚Äù means understanding that appearances are mind.

original: rab tu 'jog pa ni rang gis rtogs shing gzhan la yang ston pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jog pa ni rang gis rtogs shing gzhan la yang ston pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Fully placed‚Äù means understanding it oneself and teaching it to others.

original: 'di rnams kyang sngar gyi dri ba ji ltar sal 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang sngar gyi dri ba ji ltar sal 'jug par 'gyur zhes pa 'am /
translated: These are also applied as the answer to the previous question, ‚ÄúHow does one enter into the purification of the object of knowledge?‚Äù

original: gang gis sa'i rim par zhes pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa'i rim par zhes pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, they are also applied as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúBy what means does one enter into the stages of the earth?‚Äù

original: de ltar shes bya'i don gtan la 'bebs pa na /
analyzed: de ltar shes bya'i don gtan la 'bebs pa na /
translated: Thus, when the meaning of the object of knowledge is ascertained,

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul bstan pa dang / shes bya bden pa bzhi rtogs pa phan yon dang bcas te bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul bstan pa dang / shes bya bden pa bzhi rtogs pa phan yon dang bcas te bstan nas /
translated: the mode of the arising and cessation of consciousnesses is taught, and the realization of the four truths of the object of knowledge together with their benefits is taught.üîΩNow,

original: da ni ; / yid dang rnam par shes pa dang // kun gzhi de yang ji lta bur //
analyzed: da ni ; / yid dang rnam par shes pa dang // kun gzhi de yang ji lta bur //
translated: the mind, consciousness, and the foundation consciousness, how are they

original: ji ltar snang la 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar snang la 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: and how do they engage in appearance?üîΩFor what reason do they turn away from appearance?

original: ci yi slad du snang las ldog / ces dris pa'i lan du rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: ci yi slad du snang las ldog / ces dris pa'i lan du rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: The answer to this question teaches the mode of engagement and withdrawal of those consciousnesses.

original: de la re zhig de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas zhu ba'i tshig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig de nas yang zhes pa la sogs pas zhu ba'i tshig bstan pa'o //
translated: In that regard, first, the words of the question are taught beginning with ‚ÄúThen, again.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristics of the three natures and so onüîΩare taught.

original: kun rdzob bam don dam pa'i de kho na nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams de nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i tshul gyis khyad par du 'gro ba'i bdag gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul dang / rnam par bral ba'i gnyis su @90a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob bam don dam pa'i de kho na nyid sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams de nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i tshul gyis khyad par du 'gro ba'i bdag gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul dang / rnam par bral ba'i gnyis su @90a * //
translated: The ultimate reality, or conventional reality, is the sphere of activity of my mind, which is free from the domain of appearances, and which is the means by which the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, through their realization of reality, progress.

original: snang ba'i mtshan ma dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i mtshan ma dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is free from the signs of the duality of appearances.

original: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the characteristic of the reality of the expressed and the expresser.

original: de ltar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / tha snyad pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa dang / de'i yul du gyur pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jig ces pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / tha snyad pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pa dang / de'i yul du gyur pa'i de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jig ces pa ste /
translated: Thus, the conceptualization of appearances, the reasoning of conventional direct perception, and so forth, and the characteristic of the reality that is their object are destroyed.

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i rgyu ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i rgyu ba bkag pa'o //
translated: The movement of consciousness and the object of consciousness is stopped.

original: de yang med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyis /
analyzed: de yang med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin gyis /
translated: And that is not an identity of negation.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung rab kyi snying po sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba don dam pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs mkhas pa dga' ba skyed par byed pas me tog dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung rab kyi snying po sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba don dam pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs mkhas pa dga' ba skyed par byed pas me tog dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The reality of mind, free from conceptual elaboration and radiant, is the essence of the scriptures of all the Buddhas, the ultimate teaching, and it is like a flower, since it delights the wise.

original: lang ka'i grong rdal zhes pa la sogs pas yang bsnan te zhus pa'o //
analyzed: lang ka'i grong rdal zhes pa la sogs pas yang bsnan te zhus pa'o //
translated: The phrase in the city of Lanka and so on is the question.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul zhes pa ni de'i de bzhin nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i yul yin pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul zhes pa ni de'i de bzhin nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i yul yin pa ste /
translated: The domain of the store-consciousness is the reality of the store-consciousness, which is the object to be realized by the Buddhas.

original: gzhi mthun pa'i drug pa nyid du sbyar bar bya'o ;
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa'i drug pa nyid du sbyar bar bya'o ;
translated: The sixth case ending is to be construed in the sense of a common locus.

original: / de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho zhes nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: / de nyid rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas rgya mtsho zhes nye bar gdags te /
translated: That very reality is like an ocean, and so it is designated as an ocean.

original: chos kyi sku'i rigs sam de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin pas chos kyi sku zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rigs sam de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin pas chos kyi sku zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called Dharma Body, since it is the family of the Dharma Body or the essence of the Tathagata.

original: rlabs lta bu ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rlabs lta bu ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The waves are the actual consciousnesses.

original: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa gnas gyur gyi rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa gnas gyur gyi rgyu yin pas /
translated: Those are the causes of the transformation of the Buddha's gnosis of equality and so forth.

original: chos kyi sku zhes nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes nye bar gdags te /
translated: They are designated as the Dharma Body.

original: de rnams kyi 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul de bzhin gshegs pa snga ma rnams kyis rjes su gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul de bzhin gshegs pa snga ma rnams kyis rjes su gsungs pa /
translated: The way of their engagement and disengagement was taught by the former Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis khyad par du bshad du gsol zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis khyad par du bshad du gsol zhes pa'o ;
translated: The Tathagata himself should explain the distinction.

original: / de nas zhes pa la sogs pas dang po sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston to //
analyzed: / de nas zhes pa la sogs pas dang po sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston to //
translated: Then and so forth teaches the way of engagement of the first five consciousnesses.

original: de ltar rang gi sems snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud ces pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi sems snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud ces pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of not understanding the appearance of one's own mind as a mere grasping is as follows.

original: kun rdzob tu mig gi rnam par shes pa rang gi snang ba tsam la 'dzin cing /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu mig gi rnam par shes pa rang gi snang ba tsam la 'dzin cing /
translated: On the conventional level, the eye consciousness grasps its own mere appearance.

original: don dam par stong pa nyid du ma rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par stong pa nyid du ma rtogs pa ste /
translated: On the ultimate level, it does not understand emptiness.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa mig gi rnam shes skye ba'i 'gal rkyen med pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa mig gi rnam shes skye ba'i 'gal rkyen med pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the absence of adverse conditions for the arising of the eye consciousness that is associated with defilements.

original: spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyis bsdus pa gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'i bag chags dang / de'i rten kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dngos por mngon par zhen @90b pa ste ;
analyzed: spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyis bsdus pa gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'i bag chags dang / de'i rten kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dngos por mngon par zhen @90b pa ste ;
translated: The habitual tendencies of the appearance of various forms that are included in the negative propensities of conceptual elaborations and the clinging to the dependent consciousness as a real thing

original: rgyu'i rkyen la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: are the clinging to the causal condition.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of consciousness is the nature of the immediately preceding condition,

original: de la ngo mtshar du 'dzin cing dngos por zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngo mtshar du 'dzin cing dngos por zhen pa'o //
translated: and one should be amazed by it and cling to it as a real thing.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni phyi rol gyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni phyi rol gyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The characteristics of the various forms that appear as external colors, shapes, and so on are amazing,

original: mos pa'i khyad par du gtogs pa de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa'i khyad par du gtogs pa de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas bsdus pa ste /
translated: and the mental consciousness that is included in such a special interest clings to them.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen la dngos por zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen la dngos por zhen pa'o //
translated: The clinging to a real thing is the objective condition.

original: yang nang gi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: yang nang gi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: Moreover, there are various internal forms.

original: gzugs can gyi dbang por grags pa la snga ma ltar ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi dbang por grags pa la snga ma ltar ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The first is the wonderment with regard to the so-called material sense faculties.

original: bdag po'i rkyen la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: This is the clinging to the dominant condition.

original: 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba la rkyen bzhir grags pa las /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba la rkyen bzhir grags pa las /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows: In the arising of the contaminated eye consciousness, the four conditions are renowned.

original: 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs na zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs na zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one realizes the emptiness of their nature just as it is, the contaminated consciousness will not arise.

original: ji ltar gnas gyur pa'i gnas skabs nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas gyur pa'i gnas skabs nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is just like the state of the transformation of the basis.

original: de las gzhan du de rnams dngos po'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i mthun rkyen gyis gsos btab pa na za ba  pa  dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du de rnams dngos po'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i mthun rkyen gyis gsos btab pa na za ba  pa  dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, when the conditions for the arising of the contaminated consciousness are activated by the power of clinging to them as real, the contaminated consciousness will arise.

original: de'i phyir tshig dang pos 'gal rkyen med pa nyid bstan la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig dang pos 'gal rkyen med pa nyid bstan la /
translated: Therefore, the first line teaches the absence of adverse conditions.

original: gzhan rnams kyis ni mthun pa'i rkyen tshogs pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis ni mthun pa'i rkyen tshogs pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The others teach the assembly of concordant conditions.

original: 'di rnams zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las /
analyzed: 'di rnams zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa yang 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las /
translated: These are also contaminated, as the noble Great Nirvana Sutra teaches:

original: 'od srungs kyis gsol ba /
analyzed: 'od srungs kyis gsol ba /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi rnam par shes pa lnga ni zag ba dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi rnam par shes pa lnga ni zag ba dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, the five consciousnesses of sentient beings are contaminated.

original: phyin ci log ma lags la /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma lags la /
translated: They are not mistaken,

original: sems rtse gcig pa yang ma lags na /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa yang ma lags na /
translated: and they are not one-pointed.

original: ci'i slad du yongs su dag pa'i tshangs par spyod pa zhes mi bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du yongs su dag pa'i tshangs par spyod pa zhes mi bgyi /
translated: Why are they not called pure pure conduct?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rigs kyi bu sems can gyi rnam par shes pa lnga ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems can gyi rnam par shes pa lnga ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, the five consciousnesses of sentient beings

original: sems rtse gcig pa ma yin yang /üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ma yin yang / zag pa dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: are not one-pointed,üîΩbut they are contaminated.

original: phyin ci log kyang yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang yin te /
translated: They are mistaken,

original: zag pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because they give rise to the contaminants, they are called contaminated.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not real by nature.

original: 'du shes la chags pas phyin ci log pa zhes bya'o zhes @91a * //
analyzed: 'du shes la chags pas phyin ci log pa zhes bya'o zhes @91a * //
translated: Because of attachment to perception, it is called ‚Äúinverted.‚Äù

original: gsungs so // 'dir slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gsungs so // 'dir slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: Here, the master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra explains: Consciousness is the active consciousnesses.

original: rang bzhin ni rgyu ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rgyu ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Nature is the cause, i.e., the store consciousness.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun thog mar 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa yang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun thog mar 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the initial arising of the eye consciousness is the wonderment at the characteristics of various forms.

original: de la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pas mig phye ba na rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: de la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pas mig phye ba na rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'chad do //
translated: Because of that wonderment, when the eyes are opened, consciousness arises.

original: snga ma ltar na de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma bsdus pas khyab chung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma ltar na de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma bsdus pas khyab chung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were as the former explain, since the condition as cause would not be included, it would have a narrow scope.

original: dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab ces pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang po rdul phra rab tu 'dus par snang ba tsam yin gyi phyi rol gyi rdul ni grub pa med ces sngar bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab ces pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang po rdul phra rab tu 'dus par snang ba tsam yin gyi phyi rol gyi rdul ni grub pa med ces sngar bstan to //
translated: The ‚Äúatoms of all the sense faculties‚Äù are merely the appearance of the aggregation of atoms of the physical sense faculties. It has been explained above that external atoms do not exist.

original: spu'i khung bu ni khyad par du lus kyi dbang por snang ba'i ba spu'i khung bu'o //
analyzed: spu'i khung bu ni khyad par du lus kyi dbang por snang ba'i ba spu'i khung bu'o //
translated: The ‚Äúpores of the body‚Äù are the pores of the body that appear as the sense faculty of the body in particular.

original: de rnams kyang sgra la sogs pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud pa dang / gnas ngan len gyis bsdus pa sgra la sogs par snang ba'i bag chags la mngon par zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sgra la sogs pa rang gi sems kyi snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud pa dang / gnas ngan len gyis bsdus pa sgra la sogs par snang ba'i bag chags la mngon par zhen pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid dang /
translated: Those who have not understood that sound and so on are the appearances of their own mind, who are attached to the latent tendencies for the appearance of sound and so on, which are included in the negative tendencies, and who are attached to the nature of consciousness

original: sgra dang dri la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / yang nang gi gzugs dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang / spu'i khung bu rnams la ngo mtshar du 'dzin cing dngos por zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dang dri la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid la ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa dang / yang nang gi gzugs dbang po thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang / spu'i khung bu rnams la ngo mtshar du 'dzin cing dngos por zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: They are amazed by the characteristics of the various aspects of sound, smell, and so on, and they are amazed by the atoms of all the internal faculties and the pores of the body. They arise from the cause of clinging to things.

original: de dag las yul gyi rnam par snang ba yang /
analyzed: de dag las yul gyi rnam par snang ba yang /
translated: The appearance of objects from those [seeds] is as follows.

original: ji ltar me long la cig car gzugs kyi rkyen mang po nye bar gnas pa na rdzas su ma grub pa'i gzugs brnyan mang por cig car snang zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar me long la cig car gzugs kyi rkyen mang po nye bar gnas pa na rdzas su ma grub pa'i gzugs brnyan mang por cig car snang zhing /
translated: Just as in a mirror, when many conditions of form are present simultaneously, many reflections that are not substantially established appear simultaneously,

original: rkyen rim gyis nye bar gnas pa na /üîΩgzugs brnyan yang rim gyis snang ba bzhin du lnga char gyi rkyen cig car gnas pa na /
analyzed: rkyen rim gyis nye bar gnas pa na / gzugs brnyan yang rim gyis snang ba bzhin du lnga char gyi rkyen cig car gnas pa na /
translated: and when the conditions are present sequentially,üîΩthe reflections also appear sequentially.

original: rdzas su ma grub pa'i yul lnga ru snang ba cig car 'byung la /
analyzed: rdzas su ma grub pa'i yul lnga ru snang ba cig car 'byung la /
translated: In the same way, when the conditions of all five [sense objects] are present simultaneously, the five objects that are not substantially established appear simultaneously.

original: rkyen rnams rim gyis nye ba na rim gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams rim gyis nye ba na rim gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: When the conditions are present sequentially, they appear sequentially.

original: gcig dang tha dad las grol ba ni kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad las grol ba ni kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: Being free from identity and difference refers to the all-ground and the engaging consciousnesses,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa phan tshun yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa phan tshun yang rung ste /
translated: or to the engaging consciousnesses themselves.

original: don dam par gcig dang tha dad las grol ba ste /
analyzed: don dam par gcig dang tha dad las grol ba ste /
translated: In the ultimate, they are free from identity and difference,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong ba'o //
translated: and are empty of inherent nature.

original: kun rdzob tu yul so sor rnam par 'jog pa'i las dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa rang gi rgyud du @91b gtogs pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu 'brel pa'i rang bzhin la bdag nyid kyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du khong du mi chud pa /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yul so sor rnam par 'jog pa'i las dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid ces pa rang gi rgyud du @91b gtogs pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / shin tu 'brel pa'i rang bzhin la bdag nyid kyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid du khong du mi chud pa /
translated: Conventionally, the function of positing individual objects, the characteristic of the type, which is the characteristic of the cause that is included in one‚Äôs continuum, and the nature that is very connected are not understood by the mind to be of such a nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'jug ces pa'o //
translated: The five collections of consciousness engage.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: ‚Äú MahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on teaches the way the mental consciousness engages.

original: lnga po de dag dang lhan cig ces pa ni /
analyzed: lnga po de dag dang lhan cig ces pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Together with those five‚Äù

original: gang zag gcig gi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i dus dang spyod yul mtshungs par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag gcig gi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i dus dang spyod yul mtshungs par rgyu ba'o //
translated: means that they move in the same time and place within the continuum of a single person.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: Thus, the noble S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa de dang lhan cig tu rjes su 'jug pa dus mtshungs pa spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'byung ngo zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mental consciousness that is concomitant with the eye consciousness and that has the same object and the same time arises with concepts.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni sgro btags spyi'i rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni sgro btags spyi'i rnam pa yin la /
translated: You might ask, ‚ÄúThe object of the mental consciousness is a superimposed universal.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni sgro ma btags pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul ni sgro ma btags pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the object of a sense consciousness a non-superimposed particular?

original: ji ltar de dag yul mtshungs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag yul mtshungs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can they have the same object?‚Äù

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: phyi rol du gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: External particulars do not exist.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang rang gi rnam pa ni mtshungs pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang rang gi rnam pa ni mtshungs pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Particulars that are the nature of consciousness appear to be the same.

original: rgyu dang yul bye brag 'byed pa ni don 'di ni rgyu 'di lta bu las gyur pa yin la rang gi rang bzhin ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang yul bye brag 'byed pa ni don 'di ni rgyu 'di lta bu las gyur pa yin la rang gi rang bzhin ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhes tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ste /
translated: Distinguishing causes and objects means that one imputes the conventional expressions ‚ÄúThis object is produced from such and such a cause‚Äù and ‚ÄúIts intrinsic nature is such and such.‚Äù

original: de nyid tsam la khong du chud par byed pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid tsam la khong du chud par byed pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: This is also called ‚Äúunderstanding reality just as it is,‚Äù

original: nges pa'i rnam pa can kyi blo yin pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam pa can kyi blo yin pas so //
translated: because it is a cognition that has the aspect of ascertainment.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag gi rgyu ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de dag gi rgyu ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The cause of those mental consciousnesses is the five sense consciousnesses.

original: gal te de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mtshungs par mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mtshungs par mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If that is so, it is untenable that cause and effect are simultaneous.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error,

original: de rnams phan tshun gnyis ka yang rkyen du gyur pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de rnams phan tshun gnyis ka yang rkyen du gyur pa yin mod kyi /
translated: because although they are mutually conditioned,

original: spyir rgyun la ltos te dus mtshungs pa mi 'gal te /
analyzed: spyir rgyun la ltos te dus mtshungs pa mi 'gal te /
translated: in general, there is no contradiction in their being simultaneous in dependence on a continuum,

original: ji ltar ro dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ro dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as in the case of taste and form.

original: de dag dang de zhes pa la sogs pas ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa des de rnams rang rang gi 'jug pa mi rtogs pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de dag dang de zhes pa la sogs pas ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa de dag dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa des de rnams rang rang gi 'jug pa mi rtogs pa nyid du ston to //
translated: The words ‚Äúthose‚Äù and ‚Äúthat‚Äù and so on indicate that those five sense consciousnesses and that mental consciousness do not realize their own engagement.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pas kun gzhi dang / de la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi 'jug pa ni rtogs par dka' ba nyid du ston to /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pas kun gzhi dang / de la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi 'jug pa ni rtogs par dka' ba nyid du ston to /
translated: However, the words ‚Äúbut‚Äù and so on indicate that the engagement of the afflicted mind that is based on the foundation consciousness is difficult to realize.

original: phan tshun tha mi dad pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: phan tshun tha mi dad pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The general characteristic is that they are not mutually different.

original: @92a * // sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @92a * // sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as it was previously explained.

original: rnam par rig pa'i yul bye brag 'byed pa ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa yul la tha snyad 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i yul bye brag 'byed pa ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa yul la tha snyad 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The differentiation of the objects of consciousness is the five sense consciousnesses designating conventions in regard to objects.

original: sngar bstan pa'i don nyid rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i don nyid rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: This is a repetition of the meaning that was previously explained.

original: de la 'dir sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa cig car byung ba na /
analyzed: de la 'dir sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa cig car byung ba na /
translated: Here, when the five sense consciousnesses arise simultaneously,

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin tha dad pa lnga 'byung ngam //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin tha dad pa lnga 'byung ngam //
translated: Do the five mental consciousnesses, which are similar to those, arise as different natures?

original: 'on te gcig nyid 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'on te gcig nyid 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Or do they arise as one?

original: snga ma ltar ni mi 'thad de //üîΩrtog pa du ma cig car 'jug pa med par nyams su myong ba'i tshad mas grub pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: snga ma ltar ni mi 'thad de // rtog pa du ma cig car 'jug pa med par nyams su myong ba'i tshad mas grub pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: The first is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams //üîΩrim gyis 'byung bar yang dag rtogs //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa rnams // rim gyis 'byung bar yang dag rtogs //
translated: It is established by valid knowledge that experiences do not engage many thoughts simultaneously, and moreover,

original: zhes sngon gyi mkhas pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes sngon gyi mkhas pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previous scholars said,üîΩ‚ÄúIt is correctly realized that thoughts arise in sequence.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa ltar na yang yul lnga'i rnam pa 'gal bar snang ba ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na yang yul lnga'i rnam pa 'gal bar snang ba ni gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: In the second case, it is not tenable that the appearances of the aspects of the five objects are one.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'dir dus mnyam pa nyid du yid kyi rnam par rtog pa du ma 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dus mnyam pa nyid du yid kyi rnam par rtog pa du ma 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here many mental thoughts do not arise simultaneously.

original: sngar bstan pa'i tshad mas gnod pa dang / 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang lnga char lhan cig byung na yang der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo zhes gsungsüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i tshad mas gnod pa dang / 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las kyang lnga char lhan cig byung na yang der rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang gcig kho na lan cig 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses and the mental consciousness that has the same object arise simultaneously, but only one conceptual mental consciousness arises at one time.

original: de lta na gcig po de yul lnga char gyi rnam par snang ba na ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam pa 'gal bas gcig pa nyid du mi rung la /
analyzed: de lta na gcig po de yul lnga char gyi rnam par snang ba na ni sngar bstan pa ltar rnam pa 'gal bas gcig pa nyid du mi rung la /
translated: If that one consciousness appears in the aspect of all five objects, as explained earlier, it is not suitable to be one because its aspects are contradictory.

original: yul gang yang rung ba'i rnam par snang na ni /
analyzed: yul gang yang rung ba'i rnam par snang na ni /
translated: If it appears in the aspect of any object,

original: lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs zhes pa'i mdo'i don mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: lnga po dag dang spyod yul mtshungs zhes pa'i mdo'i don mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: it is untenable that the s≈´tra says that it has the same object as the five sense consciousnesses.

original: ma yin te de ni sngar gyi yul gang la goms pa la sogs pa'i yul de nyid kyi rnam par snang la /
analyzed: ma yin te de ni sngar gyi yul gang la goms pa la sogs pa'i yul de nyid kyi rnam par snang la /
translated: That is not so, because it appears in the aspect of the object to which it is habituated and so on.

original: lnga po dag dang mtshungs zhes pa'i don ni lnga po de rnams las 'di kho na dang spyod yul mtshungs par snang ngo zhes pa'i nges pa med de /
analyzed: lnga po dag dang mtshungs zhes pa'i don ni lnga po de rnams las 'di kho na dang spyod yul mtshungs par snang ngo zhes pa'i nges pa med de /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúsimilar to the five‚Äù is that there is no certainty that this appears with a similar domain to those five.

original: goms pa la sogs pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa gang yung rung ba dang spyod yul mtshungs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: goms pa la sogs pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa gang yung rung ba dang spyod yul mtshungs par snang ba'o //
translated: Any that have the condition of being cultivated and so on appear with a similar domain.

original: 'dir nye bar gyur pa las byung ba'i yid rnam par rtog pa med pa ni du ma rnams kyang 'byung bar srid mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir nye bar gyur pa las byung ba'i yid rnam par rtog pa med pa ni du ma rnams kyang 'byung bar srid mod kyi /
translated: Here, the nonconceptual mental consciousness that arises from proximity may arise in many ways.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: But a proof is not seen.

original: de ltar sngar gyi don rjes su brjod nas skabs @92b kyi don nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar sngar gyi don rjes su brjod nas skabs @92b kyi don nyid ston pa ni /
translated: Having thus reviewed the previous topics, the meaning of the present topic is taught:

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, when engaging‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug de ltar 'jug pa'i tshe 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnal 'byor can gyis kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kun gzhi la yod pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rgyun gyis
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug de ltar 'jug pa'i tshe 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnal 'byor can gyis kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kun gzhi la yod pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rgyun gyis
translated: When the six collections of consciousness engage in this way, even yogis who are equipoised in meditative attainment of cessation and so on have the latent tendencies of engaging consciousness existing in the foundation consciousness, which is their nature.üîΩ

original: 'jug pa rnams shin tu phra ba'i phyir mi rtogs te /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnams shin tu phra ba'i phyir mi rtogs te /
translated: When the six collections of consciousness engage in that way, even yogis who are equipoised in the meditative attainment of cessation and so on do not realize that the latent tendencies of engaging consciousness exist in the foundation consciousness and that they continue to exist in the nature of that foundation consciousness because they are extremely subtle.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is profound and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab //üîΩbdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i klung ltar 'bab // bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: All seeds fall into it like rain into the ocean.üîΩFearing that the childish would conceive it to be a self,

original: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ngas ni de ma bstan // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I do not teach it to them.

original: de ltar na de 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor thob pa rnams ni 'di ltar bdag cag ni yul la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bkag nas snyoms par 'jug ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar na de 'dra ba'i rnal 'byor thob pa rnams ni 'di ltar bdag cag ni yul la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bkag nas snyoms par 'jug ces pa la sogs pa'i don ni shes par zad do //
translated: Thus those who attain such yoga understand the meaning of statements such as, ‚ÄúWe enter meditative attainment by stopping the consciousness that engages objects.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rtogs par nus pa'i gang zag gi khyad par ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni de rtogs par nus pa'i gang zag gi khyad par ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose of great intellect‚Äù and so forth indicates the specific type of person who is capable of realizing the buddha nature.

original: sa la rab tu gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: sa la rab tu gnas pa ni yang dag pa'i sa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding on the grounds‚Äù refers to the authentic grounds.

original: rab tu dga' ba yan chod la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba yan chod la gnas pa'o //
translated: They abide on the grounds of the Joyous and so forth.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it has been said:

original: so so skye bo phyin ci log / bden pa mthong bas ldog bya ste //
analyzed: so so skye bo phyin ci log / bden pa mthong bas ldog bya ste //
translated: The ordinary being is mistaken, but the one who sees the truth is not.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: And also:

original: 'jig rten chos mchog man chod nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten chos mchog man chod nas /
translated: Up to the supreme mundane point,

original: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is accord but also error.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i tshul lugs bdag nyid thams cad nas ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i tshul lugs bdag nyid thams cad nas ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the one who realizes the buddha nature, the way of the all-base consciousness, in all its aspects just as it is, is the TathƒÅgata himself.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: dper na mang srubs zho la yang //
analyzed: dper na mang srubs zho la yang //
translated: For example, when one churns curd,

original: de na mar yod mi snang ba //
analyzed: de na mar yod mi snang ba //
translated: the butter that is there is not seen.

original: bsrubs pa'i tshul gyis mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bsrubs pa'i tshul gyis mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: But through the method of churning, it will be seen.

original: de bzhin kun gzhi rnam par shes //
analyzed: de bzhin kun gzhi rnam par shes //
translated: In the same way, the all-base consciousness

original: rnam shes bdun dang ldan pa yang //üîΩrnam par srubs shing stug spyod pa'i //
analyzed: rnam shes bdun dang ldan pa yang // rnam par srubs shing stug spyod pa'i //
translated: Those who possess the seven consciousnesses

original: thub dbang rnams kyis mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thub dbang rnams kyis mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: are seen by the lords of sages

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: as churning and thick with afflictions.

original: / khong du chud pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: / khong du chud pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: Understanding is through the wisdom of hearing and reflection.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi stobs zhes pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'o //üîΩ'dir so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni thos pa dang @93a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi stobs zhes pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'o // 'dir so so'i skye bo'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni thos pa dang @93a * //
translated: The power of meditative stabilization and wisdom is the consciousness that arises from the cultivation of the union of serenity and insight.

original: bsam pa'i shes pas spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes pas spyi'i rnam pa'i tshul du rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas who are ordinary beings understand the meaning of the perfection of wisdom in a general way through the wisdom of hearing and reflection.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i don gong nas gong du goms shing tshogs khyad par can bsags pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i don gong nas gong du goms shing tshogs khyad par can bsags pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on that understanding, they cultivate it more and more and accumulate the special collections of merit and sublime wisdom.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes sdar gyi don nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes sdar gyi don nyid gsal bar bshad pa ni /
translated: In dependence on that, they understand the reality of the perfection of wisdom in terms of its own characteristics.üîΩThe meaning of the above is explained clearly in the Ornament of Clear Realization:

original: blo gros chen po gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa ste tshig rab tu phye ba la rnam par gdon mi za zhes pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //üîΩrgyal ba rnams la mtha' yas pa'i //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan du na zhes pa la sogs pa ste tshig rab tu phye ba la rnam par gdon mi za zhes pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo // rgyal ba rnams la mtha' yas pa'i //
translated: Great Intelligence, otherwise, and so on. In the analysis of the words, without doubt refers to the wisdom that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa de dag mnyes par byas pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa de dag mnyes par byas pa ste /
translated: The accumulation of roots of virtue for the victors is pleasing them with those offerings of gain, honor, and practice.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: bskal ba grangs med nges 'byung zhing //
analyzed: bskal ba grangs med nges 'byung zhing //
translated: Emerging from incalculable eons,

original: mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
analyzed: mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa //
translated: increasing devotion,

original: ji ltar chu yis rgya mtsho bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar chu yis rgya mtsho bzhin //
translated: like the ocean with water,

original: dge chos rnams kyis yang dag gang //
analyzed: dge chos rnams kyis yang dag gang //
translated: filled with virtuous qualities.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As stated.

original: rang gi sems snang ba la phyi rol la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba la phyi rol la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: One's mind appears free from the conceptual elaborations of external objects, and so on.

original: shes rab dang ye shes la mkhas zhes sngar bstan pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes la mkhas zhes sngar bstan pa dang sbyar te /
translated: Skill in wisdom and knowledge is connected to what was taught earlier.

original: zhi gnas dang 'brel ba'i shes rab bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang 'brel ba'i shes rab bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the cultivation of wisdom in conjunction with serenity.

original: nags tshal stug po dang / phug dang shing khrod na gnas shing zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi spangs shing lus rnam par dben pa ste /
analyzed: nags tshal stug po dang / phug dang shing khrod na gnas shing zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi spangs shing lus rnam par dben pa ste /
translated: Staying in a secluded place in the forest or in the open means to avoid distractions and to have physical solitude.

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: This is a branch of serenity.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa sa'i snying po'i mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa sa'i snying po'i mdo las /
translated: The noble K·π£itigarbha S≈´tra says:

original: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dag gal te ting nge 'dzin mang po ma grub na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dag gal te ting nge 'dzin mang po ma grub na /
translated: If those who cultivate samƒÅdhi do not achieve samƒÅdhi,

original: nam gyi stod dang nam gyi smad la mi nyal bar bya ste /
analyzed: nam gyi stod dang nam gyi smad la mi nyal bar bya ste /
translated: they should not sleep during the first or last part of the night.

original: brtson 'grus su bslab cing bsgom pa dang / 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus su bslab cing bsgom pa dang / 'du 'dzi yongs su spangs te /
translated: They should train in diligence and cultivate samƒÅdhi.üîΩThey should avoid distractions and have few desires.

original: 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes par bya ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs shing /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung zhing chog shes par bya ba dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs shing /
translated: They should be content.üîΩAnd:

original: gzhan yang / ting 'dzin bsgoms pas the tshom gcod 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ting 'dzin bsgoms pas the tshom gcod 'gyur te //
translated: The cultivation of samƒÅdhi cuts through doubt,

original: de ma rtogs par gzhan gyis nus ma yin //
analyzed: de ma rtogs par gzhan gyis nus ma yin //
translated: and without realizing it, one is unable to do otherwise.

original: zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyang ting nge 'dzin la ngag las ba nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa'i shes rab kyang ting nge 'dzin la ngag las ba nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Thus, even right wisdom is said to be based on samƒÅdhi.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: Again, in one sense,

original: 'dis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba sems rnam par dben pa nyid mtshon par zad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba sems rnam par dben pa nyid mtshon par zad de /
translated: this verse shows the freedom from discursive thought of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the mere mental isolation.

original: yang dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa rnyed zin pas lus rnam @93b par dben pa la ched cher byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa rnyed zin pas lus rnam @93b par dben pa la ched cher byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But the bodhisattvas who have entered the levels have already found the object of meditation for ≈õamatha, so they do not emphasize physical isolation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: rtag tu grong dang yul 'khor grong rdal gnas byed cing //
analyzed: rtag tu grong dang yul 'khor grong rdal gnas byed cing //
translated: Always living in towns, cities, and districts,

original: sems can smin byed byang chub brtson pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: sems can smin byed byang chub brtson pa ma gtogs par //
translated: except for the sake of ripening beings and striving for enlightenment,

original: de na dgra bcom rang rgyal 'dod pa gzhan mi skyed //
analyzed: de na dgra bcom rang rgyal 'dod pa gzhan mi skyed //
translated: they do not give rise to any other desire, such as for arhatship or pratyekabuddhahood.

original: 'di ni bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyis dben par gsungs //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bar gshegs pa'i sras kyis dben par gsungs //
translated: This is said to be the isolation of the heirs of the sugatas.

original: gang zhig dpag tshad lnga brgya yod pa'i ri yi sul //
analyzed: gang zhig dpag tshad lnga brgya yod pa'i ri yi sul //
translated: Those who live in the mountains,

original: sprul gyis gang bar lo mang bye bar gnas byed kyang //
analyzed: sprul gyis gang bar lo mang bye bar gnas byed kyang //
translated: He would live for many millions of years in a place filled with snakes,

original: dben pa 'di mi shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: dben pa 'di mi shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni //
translated: but the bodhisattva who does not know this solitude,

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnyed nas 'dre bar gnas pa yin //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnyed nas 'dre bar gnas pa yin //
translated: having attained conceit, lives in a crowd.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And so on.

original: shing khrod ces pa ni shing gcig la sogs pa'i drung ngo //
analyzed: shing khrod ces pa ni shing gcig la sogs pa'i drung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn a forest‚Äù means in front of a single tree, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gi dmigs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rab dang 'bring dang tha ma ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan lhag mthong gi dmigs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The best, middling, and least of yogis take as their objects of observation for insight the conceptual image and the nonconceptual image, respectively, and take as their objects of observation for serenity the nonconceptual image and the conceptual image, respectively.

original: dmigs pa gnyis po tsam thob pa 'jig rten chos mchog man chad kyi gnas skabs dang / de dag zung du 'brel cing dngos po mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa mthong ba'i lam nas sa brgyad pa'i par dang / sa brgyad pa nas sa bcu pa'i bar dgos pa yongs su 'grub pa'i dmigs pa thob pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gnyis po tsam thob pa 'jig rten chos mchog man chad kyi gnas skabs dang / de dag zung du 'brel cing dngos po mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa mthong ba'i lam nas sa brgyad pa'i par dang / sa brgyad pa nas sa bcu pa'i bar dgos pa yongs su 'grub pa'i dmigs pa thob pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The third is the situation of attaining the object of meditation that is the fulfillment of one's purpose, which is from the eighth level up to the tenth level.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum dang go rims las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum dang go rims las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, these three are to be applied in the reverse order.

original: yang na 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
translated: Alternatively, there is sustained calm and profound insight that focus on the combined and the extensive.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don dang tshig rnams gcig tu bsdus pa'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang / 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag nyid kyi tshig don thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes pas bzung zhing bsam pa'i don rnams kyis de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don dang tshig rnams gcig tu bsdus pa'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang / 'dres pa chen por gyur pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag nyid kyi tshig don thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes pas bzung zhing bsam pa'i don rnams kyis de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang /
translated: The meditative absorption of serenity and insight that focuses on the suchness subsumed in the meaning and words of the twelve branches of excellent speech and the meditative absorption of serenity and insight that focuses on the Dharma that has become a great mixture are those very meditative absorptions of serenity and insight that are held by the consciousnesses of hearing and contemplation of the words and meanings and that focus on suchness.

original: 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes dang / de'i yul thams cad shes shing don dam par de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dbyer med pa mngon sum du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa tshad ma mchis pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos bstan pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes dang / de'i yul thams cad shes shing don dam par de rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dbyer med pa mngon sum du rtogs pa ste /
translated: The meditative absorption of serenity and insight that focuses on the Dharma that has become an immeasurable mixture is the meditative absorption of serenity and insight that is the exalted wisdom of the correct discrimination of the teachings of the tathagatas and the direct realization of the indivisibility of the suchness of all those objects in the ultimate.

original: de rnams gsum dang go rims bzlog pa'i tshul gyis sbyar @94a * //
analyzed: de rnams gsum dang go rims bzlog pa'i tshul gyis sbyar @94a * //
translated: These three are to be applied in the reverse order.

original: bar bya'o // 'dir bshad pa snga ma'i shes par byed pa ni /
analyzed: bar bya'o // 'dir bshad pa snga ma'i shes par byed pa ni /
translated: The explanation here is the proof of the former.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: The noble S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: des sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa yin no //
analyzed: des sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pas ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa yin no //
translated: Since they have previously attained serenity and insight, they have attained the two kinds of objects of meditation: a conceptual representation and a nonconceptual representation.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam thob pas dngos po mtha'i dmigs pa thob pa yin te /
translated: Thus, by attaining the path of seeing, they attain the object of meditation that is the end of materiality.

original: des gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa ni /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: des gong ma gong ma rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs shing dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: Having attained that, they enter the path of meditation and keep in mind the three kinds of objects of meditation.

original: dper na la la zhig khyi gu ches phra mos khyi gu ches sbom po 'byin pa de bzhin du nang gi mtshan ma'i rnam par sel bar byed pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de
analyzed: dper na la la zhig khyi gu ches phra mos khyi gu ches sbom po 'byin pa de bzhin du nang gi mtshan ma'i rnam par sel bar byed pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed de
translated: For example, just as a small puppy can drive away a large, fierce mastiff, so too, by the mere act of eliminating the internal signs, they eliminate all the signs that are associated with the afflictions.

original: / mtshan ma rnam par sel ba na gnas ngan len rnams kyang sel bar byed do //
analyzed: / mtshan ma rnam par sel ba na gnas ngan len rnams kyang sel bar byed do //
translated: When the signs are eliminated, the negative tendencies are also eliminated.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs par bcom pas rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong bar byed la /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad legs par bcom pas rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma rnams su gser lta bur sems rnam par sbyong bar byed la /
translated: By thoroughly destroying all signs and negative tendencies, the mind is gradually purified like gold on the higher and higher stages.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing /
translated: Up to the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, one will fully awaken.

original: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And one will attain the object of the fulfilled intention.

original: bshad pa gnyis pa'i shes byed kyang mdo de nyid las 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags zhes dris pa la sogs pa'i lan du /
analyzed: bshad pa gnyis pa'i shes byed kyang mdo de nyid las 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa ni gang lags zhes dris pa la sogs pa'i lan du /
translated: The proof for the second explanation is also from that same sutra, in response to the question What is the observation of the lesser mixed dharmas? and so on.

original: byams pa mdo'i sde nas shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag so sor gcig tu bzlums te /
analyzed: byams pa mdo'i sde nas shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde'i bar dag so sor gcig tu bzlums te /
translated: Maitreya, the sutra collection, the vaipulya collection, the marvelous Dharma collection, up to the collection of the teachings on the ascertainment, each one is combined into one.

original: yid la byed pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni 'dres pa chung du'i chos la dmigs pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: One should understand that mental attention, serenity, and insight are the small mixing of the objective reference.

original: mdo de nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo de nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand this and so forth in accordance with that very sutra.

original: tshig gi don gzhan ni phal cher sngar bstan pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //üîΩblo gros chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes pa la sogs pas ni bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phan yon dang ldan pas /
analyzed: tshig gi don gzhan ni phal cher sngar bstan pa rnams kyi rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o // blo gros chen po dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes pa la sogs pas ni bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phan yon dang ldan pas /
translated: The other meanings of the words should be understood in accordance with the earlier explanations.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems @94b dpa'i dge pa'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems @94b dpa'i dge pa'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya ba nyid du ston te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the spiritual friend‚Äù shows that one should rely on the spiritual friends of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, since they have the benefits that have been explained and will be explained.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas byang chub mchog zhugs byang chub sems dpa' dag / pha rol phyin dang bcas te dge ba'i bshes su bstan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub mchog zhugs byang chub sems dpa' dag / pha rol phyin dang bcas te dge ba'i bshes su bstan //
translated: The bodhisattvas who have entered the supreme enlightenment, together with the perfections, are taught to be the spiritual friends.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de yang chos bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de yang chos bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: And they have four qualities.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bstan pa'i blo gros chos gzhan bzhi dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'i blo gros chos gzhan bzhi dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya ste /
translated: Sagaramati, bodhisattvas who have four qualities will be spiritual friends.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: tshar gcod pa'i tshig dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: tshar gcod pa'i tshig dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They have words that cut through.

original: chos zab mo la sbyor bar byed pa nyid yin /
analyzed: chos zab mo la sbyor bar byed pa nyid yin /
translated: They apply to the profound Dharma.

original: dus dus su gdams ngag gi tshig dang ldan pa nyid yin /
analyzed: dus dus su gdams ngag gi tshig dang ldan pa nyid yin /
translated: They have words of instruction from time to time.

original: dus dus su yal bar 'jog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dus dus su yal bar 'jog pa nyid yin te /
translated: They let go from time to time.

original: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag dang ldan pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen du rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who have those four qualities are spiritual friends.

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang chos bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang chos bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they have four qualities.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are those four?

original: bstan pa'i blo gros 'di la dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni mngon par 'byung ba la sbyor du 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bstan pa'i blo gros 'di la dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni mngon par 'byung ba la sbyor du 'jug pa yin /
translated: Sagaramati, spiritual friends cause you to engage in renunciation.

original: don zab mo la nges par sems pa la sbyor du 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: don zab mo la nges par sems pa la sbyor du 'jug pa yin /
translated: They cause you to engage in the ascertainment of profound meaning.

original: bsam gtan gyi dmigs pa thams cad la ma chags pa nyid la sbyor du 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dmigs pa thams cad la ma chags pa nyid la sbyor du 'jug pa yin /
translated: They cause you to engage in nonattachment to all objects of meditation.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa nyid la sbyor du 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i dmigs pa nyid la sbyor du 'jug pa yin te /
translated: It is the application to the object of signlessness.

original: bzhi po de dag go zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag go zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: These are the four.

original: don de rnams nyid lhag ma dang bcas te tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas bsdus te bstan pa las /üîΩdang por tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis rgya mtsho dang rlabs lta bur 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi'i yongs su 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: don de rnams nyid lhag ma dang bcas te tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas bsdus te bstan pa las / dang por tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis rgya mtsho dang rlabs lta bur 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi'i yongs su 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: The meaning of those is taught in summary in verse, together with the remainder.

original: gnas skabs lta bur bstan te /
analyzed: gnas skabs lta bur bstan te /
translated: First, two verses teach the consciousness that engages like an ocean and waves, which is the transformation of the foundation consciousness or its state.

original: de la gar cing zhes pa ni myur du sna tshogs su bsgyur zhing g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la gar cing zhes pa ni myur du sna tshogs su bsgyur zhing g-yo ba'o //
translated: There, ‚Äúdancing‚Äù means quickly changing and moving in various ways.

original: rnam par chad pa med ces pa ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pa na'o //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa med ces pa ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout interruption‚Äù means when the assemblage of causes and conditions is present.

original: sngon po dmar po zhes pa la sogs pas dpe gzhan du ma'i sgo nas kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: sngon po dmar po zhes pa la sogs pas dpe gzhan du ma'i sgo nas kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba nyid du ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúBlue, red,‚Äù and so on teach that the foundation consciousness and the engaging consciousness are free from being the same or different through many other examples.

original: de'i don ni sngar bstan la /
analyzed: de'i don ni sngar bstan la /
translated: The meaning of that has been taught previously.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar dba' rlabs rgya mtsho las gzhan ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar dba' rlabs rgya mtsho las gzhan ma yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, just as waves are not different from the ocean,

original: dpa' rlabs dang rgya mtsho bdag nyid thams cad nas khyad par med cing gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dpa' rlabs dang rgya mtsho bdag nyid thams cad nas khyad par med cing gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: and the ocean is not at all different from the waves, and yet they are not identical,

original: rgya mtsho'i mching g-yo ba med pa bzhin du dpa' rlabs kyang g-yo ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du kun gzhi @95a * //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i mching g-yo ba med pa bzhin du dpa' rlabs kyang g-yo ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de bzhin du kun gzhi @95a * //
translated: because if they were identical, the waves would not move, just as the still ocean is not moving.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: In the same way, the consciousness that engages objects is not different from the all-base,

original: yang bdag nyid thams cad nas khyad par med cing gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang bdag nyid thams cad nas khyad par med cing gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and the all-base is not at all different from the consciousness that engages objects, and yet they are not identical,

original: rgyun 'gag pa med pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ltar gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun 'gag pa med pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ltar gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: because if they were identical, the all-base consciousness, which is a continuous, uninterrupted stream, would not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad du bstan pa ni 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad du bstan pa ni 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction in teaching eight collections of consciousness.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni me tog autpa la dang de'i sngon po dang / pad ma dang pad ma'i dmar po dang / lan chva dang de'i ro dang / dung dang dung gi dkar po dang / 'o ma dang / kha ra dang / de dag gi mngar ba dang /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni me tog autpa la dang de'i sngon po dang / pad ma dang pad ma'i dmar po dang / lan chva dang de'i ro dang / dung dang dung gi dkar po dang / 'o ma dang / kha ra dang / de dag gi mngar ba dang /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is that a blue utpala flower and its blueness, a lotus and the redness of a lotus, water and its taste, a conch and its whiteness, milk and sugar, and their sweetness,

original: bska ba'i 'bras bu aa ru ra la sogs pa dang / de dag gi bska ba'i ro dang / nyi ma dang nyi ma'i 'od zer la sogs pa bdag nyid thams cad nas gcig cing khyad par med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bska ba'i 'bras bu aa ru ra la sogs pa dang / de dag gi bska ba'i ro dang / nyi ma dang nyi ma'i 'od zer la sogs pa bdag nyid thams cad nas gcig cing khyad par med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: and the myrobalan fruit and so on and their astringent taste, and the sun and its light rays, are not all of their own natures one and without distinction,

original: rnam pa thams cad du tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: but they are not entirely different.

original: yang 'dir don dam par ni rnam par shes pa'i dngos po nyid ma grub pas shin tu yang gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: yang 'dir don dam par ni rnam par shes pa'i dngos po nyid ma grub pas shin tu yang gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba'o //
translated: Moreover, here, since the entity of consciousness is not established ultimately, it is completely free from being one or different.

original: rgya mtsho yongs su gyur zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yongs su gyur zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the above is summarized and taught by ‚Äúthe ocean transforms‚Äù and so on.

original: sems dang yid dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs rnams kyang don dam par gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba nyid du bstan pa na gzhan dag de ltar rnam par phye ste bstan pa mi 'thad do snyam du dogsüîΩpa sel ba ste /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs rnams kyang don dam par gcig dang tha dad pa las grol ba nyid du bstan pa na gzhan dag de ltar rnam par phye ste bstan pa mi 'thad do snyam du dogs pa sel ba ste /
translated: This passage is intended to dispel the fear that some may have that the teaching of the eight collections of consciousness is not tenable.

original: de'i don ni kun rdzob tu rnam par shas pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres shing tha dad par gnas la /
analyzed: de'i don ni kun rdzob tu rnam par shas pa brgyad kyi mtshan nyid ma 'dres shing tha dad par gnas la /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows. Conventionally, the eight collections of consciousness are distinct from each other and have different characteristics.

original: de ltar byis pa rnams la bstan pa'i don du rab tu brtag cing bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar byis pa rnams la bstan pa'i don du rab tu brtag cing bshad pa'o //
translated: For the sake of teaching this to the childish, they are imagined and explained.

original: don dam par ni mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid can du ro gcig cing tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa'o //üîΩde la yongs su gyur ba mi rnyed ces pa ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid can du ro gcig cing tha dad pa ma yin zhes pa'o // de la yongs su gyur ba mi rnyed ces pa ni /
translated: Ultimately, they are of one taste, characterized by the absence of characteristics, and are not different.

original: kun gzhi yongs su gyur ba'i rnam shes tha dad pa don dam par ma grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi yongs su gyur ba'i rnam shes tha dad pa don dam par ma grub ces pa'o //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúthe transformation is not found‚Äù means that the transformation of the foundation consciousness into the different consciousnesses is not ultimately established.

original: sems ni las rnams sogs ces pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu tha dad pa'i tshul bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni las rnams sogs ces pa la sogs pas ni kun rdzob tu tha dad pa'i tshul bstan pa ste /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe mind is the agent of actions‚Äù and so forth indicates the way in which the mind is different in the relative.

original: kun gzhi ni bag chags kyi rten byed pa'i sgo nas sogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: kun gzhi ni bag chags kyi rten byed pa'i sgo nas sogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: The all-base is the agent of accumulation in the sense that it serves as the support for habitual tendencies.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dam /üîΩdrug po 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyang rung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dam / drug po 'das ma thag pa'i yid kyang rung ste /
translated: The afflicted mind or

original: bag chags @95b bsgos par byed pa'i sgo nas sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags @95b bsgos par byed pa'i sgo nas sogs pa'o //
translated: the immediately preceding mind of the six consciousnesses is the agent of accumulation in the sense that it is imbued with habitual tendencies.

original: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gis ni yul rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gis ni yul rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The six collections of consciousness are the agents of the perception of objects.

original: de yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa da ltar ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par snang la /
analyzed: de yang sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa da ltar ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par snang la /
translated: The five sense consciousnesses perceive the characteristics of the present.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas de la ngo bo nyid dam khyad par du rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas de la ngo bo nyid dam khyad par du rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness conceives of the essence or the attributes of those objects.

original: ji ltar snang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar snang zhe na /
translated: How do they appear?

original: sngon po dmar po'i rnam par ni //
analyzed: sngon po dmar po'i rnam par ni //
translated: Blue appears as the aspect of red

original: mig gi rnam par shes par gda' //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par gda' //
translated: to the eye consciousness.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is how it is.

original: nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par snang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par snang zhes pa'o //
translated: It appears in the aspect of form, sound, and so on.

original: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dpa' rlabs rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dpa' rlabs rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yongs su 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If the waves of the evolving consciousnesses are the transformation of the consciousness that is the basis of all or its type,
