original: rigs nyid yin zhing de dang mthun par ji ltar 'gyur zhes rgol ba ni /üîΩdpa' rlabs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs nyid yin zhing de dang mthun par ji ltar 'gyur zhes rgol ba ni / dpa' rlabs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: how is it that they are similar?

original: rgol ba'i don ni dpa' rlabs yul gyi rnam par gsal bar snang ba dang / kun gzhi de las bzlog pa ji ltar mtshungs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba'i don ni dpa' rlabs yul gyi rnam par gsal bar snang ba dang / kun gzhi de las bzlog pa ji ltar mtshungs zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the objection is that the waves are clear appearances of objects, while the consciousness that is the basis of all is the opposite. How can they be similar?

original: lan gyi don ni don dam par sngon po dang / dmar po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dpa' rlabs dag la ma mchis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni don dam par sngon po dang / dmar po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dpa' rlabs dag la ma mchis zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the reply is that ultimately the appearances of blue, yellow, and so on do not exist in the waves of eye consciousness and so on.

original: de'i don yang gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bdag la yod la /
analyzed: de'i don yang gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bdag la yod la /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: If the aspects of blue and so on exist in the nature of eye consciousness and so on, then they would be the same as the consciousness that is the basis of all.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du yod dam 'on te du mar yod ces brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du yod dam 'on te du mar yod ces brtag par bya'o //
translated: It should be analyzed whether consciousness exists as a single entity or as multiple.

original: de la 'dir rnam bden pa sna tshogs gnyis su med par smra ba rnams ni sngar bstan pa ltar lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems nyid du grub cing /
analyzed: de la 'dir rnam bden pa sna tshogs gnyis su med par smra ba rnams ni sngar bstan pa ltar lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa sems nyid du grub cing /
translated: In this regard, the Proponents of Real Images, who assert that the variety [of appearances] is nondual, have established, as previously explained, that the aspects of blue and so forth are mind itself through logical arguments such as the ascertainment of simultaneous occurrence.

original: sems kyang gcig pa nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: sems kyang gcig pa nyid du grub ste /
translated: And they have established that mind is singular.

original: sna tshogs su snang ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang ba nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: This is because it is the appearance of a variety.

original: de'i khyad par gyi don ni dkar dmar sna tshogs su snang ba shes pa du ma'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi don ni dkar dmar sna tshogs su snang ba shes pa du ma'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: The meaning of the distinction is this: If the appearance of a variety of red and white is the nature of multiple cognitions,

original: rang rang gi rang bzhin tsam myong gi phan tshun gyi rnam pa myong ba med pas sna tshogs su snang ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rang rang gi rang bzhin tsam myong gi phan tshun gyi rnam pa myong ba med pas sna tshogs su snang ba mi 'thad de /
translated: since each experiences its own nature alone and does not experience the aspects of the other, the appearance of a variety is not tenable.

original: ji ltar skyes bu lngas kha dog rnam pa lnga la so sor bltas pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu lngas kha dog rnam pa lnga la so sor bltas pa na /
translated: For example, when five people look at five different colors,üîΩthe many cognitions that appear individually

original: so sor snang ba'i blo du ma yin pas /
analyzed: so sor snang ba'i blo du ma yin pas /
translated: are not experienced as a single cognition.

original: khra bo 'am sna tshogs su snang ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: khra bo 'am sna tshogs su snang ba mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the variegated or multicolored appears.

original: 'ga' zhig la dkar por snang ba'i blos rnam pa de nyid myong gi gzhan ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la dkar por snang ba'i blos rnam pa de nyid myong gi gzhan ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that perceives something as white experiences only that aspect and does not experience any other.

original: @96a * // snang ba gzhan yang de dang mtshungs //
analyzed: @96a * // snang ba gzhan yang de dang mtshungs //
translated: The appearance of other things is the same.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di ni mi 'thad de /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par sems su grub pa ni mi 'thad pa nyid du sdar bstan la /
analyzed: lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par sems su grub pa ni mi 'thad pa nyid du sdar bstan la /
translated: The reasoning of the ascertainment of simultaneous observation and so on has already demonstrated that it is untenable to establish the mind as ultimate reality.

original: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba shes pa gcig nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba shes pa gcig nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the various appearances of blue and so on are a single cognition,

original: de nyid phyi rol gyi rdzas gcig nyid yin zhes kyang ci ste mi brtsad /
analyzed: de nyid phyi rol gyi rdzas gcig nyid yin zhes kyang ci ste mi brtsad /
translated: why not also argue that they are a single external substance?

original: gal te cha sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir phyi rol gcig gi bdag nyid min no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te cha sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir phyi rol gcig gi bdag nyid min no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because they appear as a variety of parts they are not a single external object,

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: then they are also not a single cognition.

original: don 'di ni sngar phyi rol gcig pa nyid 'gog pa'i skabs su rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: don 'di ni sngar phyi rol gcig pa nyid 'gog pa'i skabs su rgyas par bstan no //
translated: This point has been extensively explained above in the section on the refutation of external objects being a single entity.

original: gal te 'dir phyi rol gyi rdzas gcig gi bdag nyid 'gog pa ni tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i chos 'gal bar gnas pa'i sgo nas 'gog la /
analyzed: gal te 'dir phyi rol gyi rdzas gcig gi bdag nyid 'gog pa ni tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i chos 'gal bar gnas pa'i sgo nas 'gog la /
translated: If you say that the refutation of external objects as a single substance is done by way of the contradiction of the properties of being colored and uncolored,

original: de nyid shes pa gcig tu khas len pa la ni mi mtshungs te /
analyzed: de nyid shes pa gcig tu khas len pa la ni mi mtshungs te /
translated: then it is not the same in the case of the assertion of a single consciousness.

original: shes pa ni tshon gyis bsgyur bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa ni tshon gyis bsgyur bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because it is not tenable that consciousness is colored.

original: de ci shes par khas blangs zhes kyi de tsam gyis shes pa'i ngo bo don dam par grub bam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ci shes par khas blangs zhes kyi de tsam gyis shes pa'i ngo bo don dam par grub bam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: You should ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of accepting consciousness? Does that alone establish the entity of consciousness ultimately?‚Äù

original: de ltar ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ma grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not established in that way,

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then for that very reason,

original: sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba'i chos can don dang shes pa'i khyad par du ma byas pa la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang ba'i chos can don dang shes pa'i khyad par du ma byas pa la /
translated: with regard to the phenomena that appear as various things such as blue, without distinguishing between objects and consciousnesses,

original: tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba'i 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs gcig nyid grub na /
analyzed: tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba'i 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs gcig nyid grub na /
translated: if you establish a single reason that is contradictory, such as being colored and uncolored,üîΩthen you have established the nonexistence of external objects.

original: de shes par khas blangs pa'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub ces ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de shes par khas blangs pa'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub ces ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: When one accepts that it is known, one cannot say that the reason is not established.

original: chos can dang gtan tshigs snga ma nyid las ma 'phos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can dang gtan tshigs snga ma nyid las ma 'phos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subject and the reason are not different from the previous.

original: de yang ji ltar lha sbyin gyi mdog sngo bsangs nyid du tshad mas grub pa na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar lha sbyin gyi mdog sngo bsangs nyid du tshad mas grub pa na /
translated: Moreover, when the blueness of Devadatta is established by a valid cognition,

original: de dmangs rigs nyid du khas blangs pas sngo bsangs nyid du mi gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dmangs rigs nyid du khas blangs pas sngo bsangs nyid du mi gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that it does not become blue by accepting that he is a ≈õ≈´dra.

original: rigs kyi khyad par gang du khas blangs kyang kha dog sngo bsangs nyid du tshad mas grub pa bzhin du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par gang du khas blangs kyang kha dog sngo bsangs nyid du tshad mas grub pa bzhin du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: No matter what specific caste one accepts, it does not become the case that the valid cognition establishing the blueness of the color is not established.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so,

original: phyi rol gcig pa nyid du khas len pas de la tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba'i 'gal ba mi 'thad do zhes ci ste mi brjod //
analyzed: phyi rol gcig pa nyid du khas len pas de la tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang ma bsgyur ba'i 'gal ba mi 'thad do zhes ci ste mi brjod //
translated: why would you not say that because you accept external objects to be the same, the contradiction of being and not being colored by the color is untenable?

original: gal te gcig tu khas blangs pa tsam gyis gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu khas blangs pa tsam gyis gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not the case that something becomes one merely by accepting it to be one.

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i chos can la ni gtan tshigs de ma grub pa ma yin no @96b zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i chos can la ni gtan tshigs de ma grub pa ma yin no @96b zhe na /
translated: But the reason is not unestablished with respect to the subject, which is the phenomenon that appears as blue and so on.

original: de bzhin du shes par khas blangs pa tsam gyis kyang shes pa nyid du ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes par khas blangs pa tsam gyis kyang shes pa nyid du ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, mere acceptance that it is consciousness does not make it consciousness.

original: de ltar snang ba'i chos can la ni gtan tshigs de grub pas ci'i phyir ni mi mtshungs snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i chos can la ni gtan tshigs de grub pas ci'i phyir ni mi mtshungs snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: So why is it not similar?

original: gzhan yang sna tshogs pa snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sna tshogs pa snang ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Moreover, because of the appearance of variety,

original: shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid yin /
analyzed: shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid yin /
translated: it is the nature of a single consciousness.

original: zhes pa ni bsgrub bya las bzlog pa'i chos kyis khyab pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid yin pa 'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bsgrub bya las bzlog pa'i chos kyis khyab pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid yin pa 'am /
translated: This is because the reason is contradictory, since it is pervaded by the opposite of the probandum.

original: yang don dam par sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na ni ma grub la /üîΩkun rdzob tu sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir don dam par de ltar snang ba'i shes pa gcig nyid du sgrub na /
analyzed: yang don dam par sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs su 'god na ni ma grub la /üîΩkun rdzob tu sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir don dam par de ltar snang ba'i shes pa gcig nyid du sgrub na /
translated: Moreover, if the reason is stated as ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of variety ultimately,‚Äù it is not established.üîΩIf the reason is stated as ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of variety conventionally,‚Äù it is established.

original: khyab pa ma grub po zhes spyir bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ma grub po zhes spyir bstan par bya'o //
translated: In general, it should be said that the pervasion is not established.

original: de ltar sna tshogs gnyis su med pa'i phyogs bkag nas gzhan dag sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba ni shes pa du ma'i bdag nyid du yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sna tshogs gnyis su med pa'i phyogs bkag nas gzhan dag sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ba ni shes pa du ma'i bdag nyid du yod do zhe na /
translated: Having thus refuted the position of non-duality of variety, some may think that the appearance of variety is the existence of the nature of many cognitions.

original: 'di yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di yang mi 'thad de /
translated: This is also not tenable.

original: du ma rtsom par byed pa'i sngo snang la sogs pa'i shes pa so so ba gcig nyid yin nam /
analyzed: du ma rtsom par byed pa'i sngo snang la sogs pa'i shes pa so so ba gcig nyid yin nam /
translated: If the individual cognitions appearing as blue and so forth that compose the many are one,

original: 'on te du ma zhig tshe thug pa med par khas len /
analyzed: 'on te du ma zhig tshe thug pa med par khas len /
translated: then one would have to accept an infinite regress of many.

original: dang po ltar na rdul phra rab kyi dpyad pa mtshungs te /
analyzed: dang po ltar na rdul phra rab kyi dpyad pa mtshungs te /
translated: In the first case, the analysis of the most subtle particle is the same.

original: ji ltar dbus phyogs su dkar por snang ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar dbus phyogs su dkar por snang ba la /
translated: Just as the appearance of white in the centerüîΩis seen and applied as the appearance of blue in the east,

original: de'i shar phyogs su sngon por snang ba bltas shing sbyar ba'i phyogs de nyid du lho phyogs la sogs par so sor snang ba rnams kyis bltas shing sbyar na /
analyzed: de'i shar phyogs su sngon por snang ba bltas shing sbyar ba'i phyogs de nyid du lho phyogs la sogs par so sor snang ba rnams kyis bltas shing sbyar na /
translated: if the appearances in the south and so forth are seen and applied in that very direction,

original: thams cad shar phyogs kyi gogs nyid du snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad shar phyogs kyi gogs nyid du snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: all would appear in the very east.

original: 'on te de dag gis phyogs so sor bltas shing sbyar ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gis phyogs so sor bltas shing sbyar ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they are applied to the individual directions,

original: de lta na dbus kyi dkar por snang ba de nyid cha bzhir 'gyur bas gcig pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: de lta na dbus kyi dkar por snang ba de nyid cha bzhir 'gyur bas gcig pa nyid nyams so //
translated: then the appearance of white in the center will be divided into four parts, and the theory of one consciousness is undermined.

original: gal te rdul phra rab lus can gyis dpyad la /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab lus can gyis dpyad la /
translated: You may say that the analysis is made in terms of the physical particles,

original: sems lus can ma yin pas mi mtshungs te /
analyzed: sems lus can ma yin pas mi mtshungs te /
translated: but that it does not apply to the mind, which is not physical.

original: de ni yul dang phyogs kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni yul dang phyogs kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But since the mind is not included in space and direction,üîΩit is not the same.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar sems su khas blangs kyang don dam par sems su grub pa ni med la ;
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar sems su khas blangs kyang don dam par sems su grub pa ni med la ;
translated: because, as was previously explained, although the mind is accepted, ultimately the mind is not established.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ni yul dang phyogs la sogs pas bsdus par snang bas ci'i phyir na dpyad pa mi 'jug ces pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ni yul dang phyogs la sogs pas bsdus par snang bas ci'i phyir na dpyad pa mi 'jug ces pa'o //
translated: But the appearance as the aspects of blue and so on is included in space and direction, and so why should the analysis not apply to it?

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rdul phra rab cha shas med pa las shar dang lho la sogs pa'i cha mi 'thad pas rnam rig tsam du smra ba rnams kyis drug gis @97a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab cha shas med pa las shar dang lho la sogs pa'i cha mi 'thad pas rnam rig tsam du smra ba rnams kyis drug gis @97a * //
translated: since it would be untenable that the partless particle has parts such as east and south, the proponents of consciousness only would have to accept that the six consciousnesses are not supported by the sense faculties.

original: cig car sbyar ba la sogs pa'i brtag pa byas pa yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: cig car sbyar ba la sogs pa'i brtag pa byas pa yang mi 'jug go //
translated: The analysis of the simultaneous conjunction and so on is also not applicable.

original: gal te cha med par khas blangs kyang de ltar grub pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te cha med par khas blangs kyang de ltar grub pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Even though you accept partless particles, they are not established in that way.

original: 'on kyang rdul phra rab rnams 'dab chags su gnas pa las rags pa rtsom par khas len pa na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul phra rab rnams 'dab chags su gnas pa las rags pa rtsom par khas len pa na /
translated: However, when you accept that coarse objects are formed from partless particles that are situated without interstice,

original: don gyis shar la sogs par khas len dgos pas de lta bu'i dpyad pa 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis shar la sogs par khas len dgos pas de lta bu'i dpyad pa 'jug go zhe na /
translated: you must accept that they have an eastern part and so on. Therefore such an analysis is applicable.

original: 'dir shes par khas blangs pa tsam gyis shes par grub pa ni ma min la /
analyzed: 'dir shes par khas blangs pa tsam gyis shes par grub pa ni ma min la /
translated: Here, mere acceptance that consciousness exists does not establish that consciousness exists.

original: 'on kyang rdul sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dab chags su snang ba las rags par snang la rtsom par khas len pa na de lta bu'i dpyad pa ci ste mi 'jug ces pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rdul sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dab chags su snang ba las rags par snang la rtsom par khas len pa na de lta bu'i dpyad pa ci ste mi 'jug ces pa'o //
translated: However, when you accept that coarse appearances are formed from the appearance of the parts of blue particles and so on without interstice, why would such an analysis not be applicable?

original: gal te shes pa'i phra rab du ma nyi tsher khas len na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i phra rab du ma nyi tsher khas len na /
translated: If you accept that many partless moments of consciousness are discrete,

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor rgyas par snang ba dang / skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam du snang ba gnyis rnam pa che chung gi khyad par med par thal te /
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor rgyas par snang ba dang / skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam du snang ba gnyis rnam pa che chung gi khyad par med par thal te /
translated: It follows that the appearance of the earth mandala as vast and the appearance of the earth mandala as the size of the tip of a hair are not different in terms of their aspects,üîΩbecause there is no difference in the number of subtle particles that compose them.

original: rtsom byed kyi shes pa'i rdul phra rab la mang nyung gi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa sngar rdul phra rab la dpyad pa byas pa dang mtshungs par blta bar bya'o /
analyzed: rtsom byed kyi shes pa'i rdul phra rab la mang nyung gi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa sngar rdul phra rab la dpyad pa byas pa dang mtshungs par blta bar bya'o /
translated: This should be understood in the same way as the analysis of subtle particles above.

original: de ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dpa' rlabs la med cing /
analyzed: de ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dpa' rlabs la med cing /
translated: Thus, the waves of consciousness that engage the aspects of blue and so on do not exist.

original: rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i dpa' rlabs kyang grub pa med pas don dam par kun gzhi dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i dpa' rlabs kyang grub pa med pas don dam par kun gzhi dang mthun pa ste /
translated: And since waves that are not aspects do not exist, ultimately they are in accord with the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi yang sngar bstan pa ltar don dam pa'i ngo bor ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi yang sngar bstan pa ltar don dam pa'i ngo bor ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as was previously explained, the foundation consciousness is not established as an ultimate entity.

original: de lta na de rnams kyi 'jug pa bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na de rnams kyi 'jug pa bstan pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts the teaching on their engagement.

original: mtshan nyid don du zhes pa la sogs pas lan bstan to /
analyzed: mtshan nyid don du zhes pa la sogs pas lan bstan to /
translated: The reply to that is indicated by ‚ÄúThe characteristic is not the object . . .‚Äù

original: don dam par ni rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid de bzhin nyid la /
analyzed: don dam par ni rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid de bzhin nyid la /
translated: In the ultimate, the reality of consciousness is suchness.

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pa med la /
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pa med la /
translated: It does not engage in a continuum.

original: yul la 'jug pa ni kun rdzob tu yang med de /
analyzed: yul la 'jug pa ni kun rdzob tu yang med de /
translated: It does not engage objects even conventionally,

original: gzung ba'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are no apprehended objects.

original: gal te gzung ba'i phyi rol gyi bdag nyid med kyang shes pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i gzung ba ni kun rdzob tu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i phyi rol gyi bdag nyid med kyang shes pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i gzung ba ni kun rdzob tu yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that although there is no external object that is apprehended, the apprehended that is included in consciousness exists conventionally,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du grub pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not established as the characteristic of the apprehended,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pas stong pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is empty of apprehended and apprehender.

original: de ni de ltar rang nyid gsal //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni de ltar rang nyid gsal // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is clear in that way by itself.

original: gal te gzung ba'i yul 'ga' zhig yod na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba'i yul 'ga' zhig yod na /
translated: If there were some apprehended object,

original: de'i ltos sar gyur pa 'dzin pa'i dba' rlabs kyang de ltar snang ba dang / mthun par grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i ltos sar gyur pa 'dzin pa'i dba' rlabs kyang de ltar snang ba dang / mthun par grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: the apprehender, which is the basis of dependence on that, would also be established in accordance with the appearance.

original: gzung ba @97b nyid med pa'i phyir de la ltos pa'i 'dzin pa mi 'thad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba @97b nyid med pa'i phyir de la ltos pa'i 'dzin pa mi 'thad do zhes pa'o //
translated: Since there is no object, the subject that depends on it is not tenable.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sems tsam nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sems tsam nyid yin zhing /
translated: Thus, conventionally, all phenomena are mind only.

original: don dam par sems kyi ngo bo yang ma grub pa med do zhes sngar rgyas par bstan la /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi ngo bo yang ma grub pa med do zhes sngar rgyas par bstan la /
translated: Ultimately, the essence of mind is not established as anything. This has been extensively explained above.

original: 'dir ni khyad par du rnam pa bden pa'i phyogs bkag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni khyad par du rnam pa bden pa'i phyogs bkag pa'o //
translated: Here, the position that the aspects are real is specifically refuted.

original: yang rnam pa brdzun pa'i phyogs kyang 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ro //üîΩlus dang zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu dpa' rlabs sems dang mthun zhing /
analyzed: yang rnam pa brdzun pa'i phyogs kyang 'og nas 'gog par 'gyur ro // lus dang zhes pa la sogs pas kun rdzob tu dpa' rlabs sems dang mthun zhing /
translated: Later, the position that the aspects are false will be refuted.üîΩThe line ‚Äúthe body and so on‚Äù and so forth shows that, conventionally, the waves are similar to the mind.

original: sems kyi 'jug pa yang dba' rlabs dang 'dra bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa yang dba' rlabs dang 'dra bar ston pa ste /
translated: The engagement of the mind is also like the waves.

original: 'di'i don zhib tu ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don zhib tu ni 'og nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This point will be explained in detail below.

original: dpa' rlabs dngos por zhen pa la sogs pas ni dpe bstan pa'i sgo nas byis pa rnams kyis kyang de dag gi 'jug pa spyi'i tshul du rtogs par rigs shing /
analyzed: dpa' rlabs dngos por zhen pa la sogs pas ni dpe bstan pa'i sgo nas byis pa rnams kyis kyang de dag gi 'jug pa spyi'i tshul du rtogs par rigs shing /
translated: The attachment to the actuality of the waves and so on is taught through the example so that even the childish can understand the general way in which they engage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpe yang nye bar dgod pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpe yang nye bar dgod pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the example is also presented.

original: sngar rtogs par dka' ba nyid du bstan pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba yin pas 'gal ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar rtogs par dka' ba nyid du bstan pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba yin pas 'gal ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The previous statement about difficulty of understanding is in accordance with the nature of the subject matter and does not contradict the present statement.

original: 'dir dba' rlabs dngos po zhes pa ni dpe'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir dba' rlabs dngos po zhes pa ni dpe'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin la /
translated: Here, the waves are things, and the teaching is from the point of view of the example.

original: sngar bstan pa'i dba' rlabs zhes pa rnams ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i dba' rlabs zhes pa rnams ni dpes mtshon pa'i don gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The waves taught previously are from the point of view of the meaning illustrated by the example.

original: skye bo bzang ngan zhes pa la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bshad pa 'jug pa'i bye brag gdul bya'i khyad par gyis mi 'dra ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: skye bo bzang ngan zhes pa la sogs pas ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bshad pa 'jug pa'i bye brag gdul bya'i khyad par gyis mi 'dra ba nyid du ston te /
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe good and evil of people‚Äù shows that the teaching of the Dharma by the buddhas is not uniform because of the differences in the disciples.

original: de la dang por rgol ba'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs rje chen po phyogs ris med pa mnga' pas //
analyzed: de la dang por rgol ba'i don ni de bzhin gshegs pa la thugs rje chen po phyogs ris med pa mnga' pas //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs point is this: Since the tathƒÅgatas possess impartial great compassion,

original: thams cad la yang dag pa'i don mtshungs pa nyid du ston par rigs te /
analyzed: thams cad la yang dag pa'i don mtshungs pa nyid du ston par rigs te /
translated: it is reasonable that they teach the reality of all things equally.

original: ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor sems can rnams la mnyam por 'char ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor sems can rnams la mnyam por 'char ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the orb of the sun rises equally for all sentient beings.

original: gal te thams cad la yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid du gsungs na //
analyzed: gal te thams cad la yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid du gsungs na //
translated: If it is said that it is the true suchness of all,

original: gsung rab dag las sems tsam dngos por bstan pa 'am //
analyzed: gsung rab dag las sems tsam dngos por bstan pa 'am //
translated: then in the scriptures, is mind-only taught as a reality,

original: phyi'i don la bstan pa la de bzhin nyid ma mchis zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyi'i don la bstan pa la de bzhin nyid ma mchis zhes pa ste /
translated: or is external reality taught?

original: bstan pa'i don la tshad mas gnod pas de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor ma grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i don la tshad mas gnod pas de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor ma grub ces pa'o //
translated: Since the meaning of the teaching is undermined by valid cognition, it is not established as the essence of suchness.

original: chos la rab tu bzhugs mdzad cing //
analyzed: chos la rab tu bzhugs mdzad cing //
translated: Abiding in the Dharma,

original: zhes pa ni rang nyid chos kyi dbyings las ma g-yos pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang nyid chos kyi dbyings las ma g-yos pa'am /
translated: means not moving from the dharmadhatu oneself,

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi chos te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid la rtag @98a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi chos te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid la rtag @98a * //
translated: or the Dharma of Buddhahood, the essence of the great non-abiding nirvana, which is the indivisibility of method and wisdom.

original: tu bzhugs nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: tu bzhugs nas zhes pa'o //
translated: It means always abiding in that.

original: tshig 'di bstan pa'i dgos pa yang thugs rjes sems can gyi don byed pa na rang nyid chos kyi dbyings las g-yengs par 'gyur bar srid pas de 'dra ba dgag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di bstan pa'i dgos pa yang thugs rjes sems can gyi don byed pa na rang nyid chos kyi dbyings las g-yengs par 'gyur bar srid pas de 'dra ba dgag pa'i don du'o //
translated: The purpose of teaching this verse is to prevent the possibility that when one acts for the sake of sentient beings through compassion, one might be distracted from the ultimate realm.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho zhes pa la sogs pas lan ston te ;
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho zhes pa la sogs pas lan ston te ;
translated: The reply is given by the verse beginning ‚ÄúJust as in the ocean.‚Äù

original: / de la dang por kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa'i 'jug tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan te /üîΩde'i don yang ji ltar me long gi ngos la rdzas su ma grub pa'i gzugs snang ba dang / rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang dngos po la med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rim mam cig car gyis snang ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rang gi spyod yul du snang ba las /
analyzed: / de la dang por kun rdzob tu rnam par shes pa'i 'jug tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas bstan te / de'i don yang ji ltar me long gi ngos la rdzas su ma grub pa'i gzugs snang ba dang / rmi lam la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang dngos po la med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rim mam cig car gyis snang ba bzhin du rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rang gi spyod yul du snang ba las /
translated: In the first place, the way in which consciousness engages its object is taught in terms of other-production.

original: rdzas su grub pa'i yul dang mi ldan yang rim ma ma cig car gyis 'jug cing snang ba ste //
analyzed: rdzas su grub pa'i yul dang mi ldan yang rim ma ma cig car gyis 'jug cing snang ba ste //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Just as reflections appear in the surface of a mirror without being substantial, and just as forms and so on that do not exist in reality appear in a dream and so on, either in sequence or all at once, in the same way, consciousnesses engage their objects of appearance without possessing substantial objects, either in sequence or all at once.

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'am //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'am //
translated: Consciousness refers to the foundation consciousness and the mental consciousness.üîΩ

original: yang na rnam pa drug gi bdag nyid do ;
analyzed: yang na rnam pa drug gi bdag nyid do ;
translated: Consciousness is the store-consciousness and the thinking-consciousness, or else it is the six consciousnesses.

original: / yid kyis de bzhin snyems par byed //
analyzed: / yid kyis de bzhin snyems par byed //
translated: The thinking consciousness conceives of it in the same way.

original: ces pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun gzhi lang yir 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: ces pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun gzhi lang yir 'dzin pa ste //
translated: The defiled thinking consciousness conceives of the store-consciousness as a self,

original: bdag tu nga rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu nga rgyal ba'o //
translated: because it is the pride of self.

original: nang du mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni de 'dra ba'i 'jug pa'i rim pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: nang du mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni de 'dra ba'i 'jug pa'i rim pa med ces pa'o //
translated: But in the state of inner equipoise, there is no such process of evolution.

original: de ltar na yul dang yal can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs su bshad pa ni don dam par grub pa med ces ri mo'i dpe'i sgo nas ston par byed de /üîΩde yang // tshon la ri mo yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar na yul dang yal can gyi ngo bo sna tshogs su bshad pa ni don dam par grub pa med ces ri mo'i dpe'i sgo nas ston par byed de / de yang // tshon la ri mo yod ma yin //
translated: Thus, the explanation of the various natures of the object and subject is shown by the example of the picture to be without ultimate reality.

original: zhes pas dpe nyid gsal bar 'chad de //
analyzed: zhes pas dpe nyid gsal bar 'chad de //
translated: And that is explained by the example itself:üîΩThe picture is not in the colors.

original: ji ltar tshon rtsi gcig pu la ri mo skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar tshon rtsi gcig pu la ri mo skyed pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the picture is not in the colors alone,

original: rkyen gzhan don med pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rkyen gzhan don med pa nyid du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the other conditions would be useless.

original: / de bzhin du pir dang snod dang skyes bu'i rtsol ba dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du pir dang snod dang skyes bu'i rtsol ba dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the efforts of the brush, the pot, and the person.

original: gal te de rnams re re la 'bras bu skyed nus pa med kyang //
analyzed: gal te de rnams re re la 'bras bu skyed nus pa med kyang //
translated: If each of them does not have the ability to produce the effect,

original: de rnams tshogs pa la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams tshogs pa la yod do zhe na /
translated: then it is the collection that has it.

original: tshogs pa can re re ba rnams ma gtogs pa'i tshogs ni grub pa med de //
analyzed: tshogs pa can re re ba rnams ma gtogs pa'i tshogs ni grub pa med de //
translated: Apart from the individual members of the collection, there is no collection to be found.

original: de'i don zhib tu 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i don zhib tu 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of this will be explained in detail below.

original: de ltar dpyad pa'i don ma grub kyang //
analyzed: de ltar dpyad pa'i don ma grub kyang //
translated: Although the meaning of this analysis is not established,

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du tshon la sogs las ri mo skyed par snang zhing //
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba tsam du tshon la sogs las ri mo skyed par snang zhing //
translated: it appears that a painting is produced from colors and so on, which are delightful when not examined.

original: de ltar rnam par brtag par bya bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid sna tshogs su bshad pa yang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par brtag par bya bzhin du shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid sna tshogs su bshad pa yang /
translated: Similarly, although the various explanations of the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness are to be analyzed in this way,

original: so so ba dang 'dus pa'i rkyen las skye ba ma yin @98b zhing ;
analyzed: so so ba dang 'dus pa'i rkyen las skye ba ma yin @98b zhing ;
translated: they are not produced from conditions that are either individual or in a collection.

original: ma skyes pa'i ngo bor yang grub pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i ngo bor yang grub pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: And they are not established as having an unproduced nature.

original: kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa tsam du de ltar snang ba dang / dmigs pa can gyi sems can rnams drang ba'i don du de ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob rnam par gzhag pa tsam du de ltar snang ba dang / dmigs pa can gyi sems can rnams drang ba'i don du de ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: It appears like that merely as the conventional presentation, and it is taught like that for the sake of guiding sentient beings who are focused on objects.

original: yang dag pa'i don la ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi chos thams cad med cing //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don la ni brjod bya rjod byed kyi chos thams cad med cing //
translated: In the correct meaning, all phenomena that are the expressed and the expresser do not exist.

original: yod par bstan pa ni phyin ci log yin mod kyi //
analyzed: yod par bstan pa ni phyin ci log yin mod kyi //
translated: Although it is a mistake to teach that they exist,

original: sems can rnams drang ba'i don du bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams drang ba'i don du bstan pa yin pas /
translated: it is taught for the sake of guiding sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la brdzun gsungs pa'i nyes pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la brdzun gsungs pa'i nyes pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is not at fault for teaching lies.

original: de ltan yang dag pa'i don su la ston zhe na /
analyzed: de ltan yang dag pa'i don su la ston zhe na /
translated: Well then, to whom is the correct meaning taught?

original: chos rnams la ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúTo those who are skilled in the meaning of the words,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar gyi don nyid bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma zhes pa la sogs pas ni sngar gyi don nyid bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the above is summarized and taught in the lines beginning ‚ÄúJust like an illusion,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar gdul bya'i bye brag mi 'dra bas bshad pa 'jug pa'i bye brag kyang mi 'dra ba nyid du dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de ltar gdul bya'i bye brag mi 'dra bas bshad pa 'jug pa'i bye brag kyang mi 'dra ba nyid du dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bstan pa ni //
translated: The different ways of explaining the distinctions in the engagement of the disciples are taught clearly through examples:

original: gzhan la gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other is whatsoever and so forth.

original: sems cam du yang zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: sems cam du yang zhes pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The also in mind also is merely an illustration.

original: gdul bya'i khyad par la gang zag dang phyi'i don yang yod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i khyad par la gang zag dang phyi'i don yang yod par ston pa'o //
translated: It shows that there are also persons and external objects as special objects to be subdued.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i don de nyid dbang po mchog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i don de nyid dbang po mchog dang ldan pa /
translated: The meaning of the teaching in this way is that it is not for those who have the highest faculties.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs can la ni ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs can la ni ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: It is not for those who have the MahƒÅyƒÅna lineage.

original: shes par zad do //
analyzed: shes par zad do //
translated: It is merely known.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa rnams yul la ji ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul bstan nas /üîΩgnyis kyi mtha' brjod ji lta bu /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa rnams yul la ji ltar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul bstan nas / gnyis kyi mtha' brjod ji lta bu /
translated: Having taught in this way the mode of engagement and disengagement of consciousnesses with objects,üîΩin response to the question,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan du yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma blo'i mdun du byas pa ni g-yang sa'i gnas su gyur pa'i mtha' nyid yin pas de rnams rnam par bkag pa'i de bzhin nyid ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i lan du yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma blo'i mdun du byas pa ni g-yang sa'i gnas su gyur pa'i mtha' nyid yin pas de rnams rnam par bkag pa'i de bzhin nyid ston te /
translated: how can the extremes of duality be expressed? and so on, it is said that the extremes of the abyss are the very appearance of the signs of existence, nonexistence, and so on to the mind. Therefore it teaches suchness, which is the negation of those.

original: de la dang por de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag dang ldan par bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gdams pa'i tshul du ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang por de bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag dang ldan par bya'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pas gdams pa'i tshul du ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas, yogins, and yoginƒ´s should not rely on the mind, mentation, and consciousness, the three natures, the two kinds of identity, the four truths, the eight consciousnesses, the twenty-two faculties, the five bases, and the five dharmas.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba ni rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid yin zhing tha dad pa'i spyod yul grub pa med pa la de bzhin du rtogs shing don dam par sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang ngo boüîΩnyid med par rtogs par 'dod pas /üîΩ'du ba dang 'du 'dzi ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa ste / de la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par snang ba ni rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid yin zhing tha dad pa'i spyod yul grub pa med pa la de bzhin du rtogs shing don dam par sems kyi rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang ngo bo nyid med par rtogs par 'dod pas / 'du ba dang 'du 'dzi ste /
translated: They should not rely on the two kinds of selflessness.üîΩThey should not rely on the three realms, the three realms, the three times, and the four kinds of reasoning.üîΩThey should not rely on the two kinds of cessation, the two kinds of nirvƒÅ·πáa, the two kinds of form, the two kinds of wisdom, the two kinds of truth, the two kinds of vehicle, and the two kinds of emptiness.üîΩThey should not rely on the two kinds of self, the two kinds of attachment, the two kinds of grasping, the two kinds of craving, the two kinds of birth, the two kinds of suffering, the two kinds of origination, the two kinds of cessation, the two kinds of path, the two kinds of nirvƒÅ·πáa, the two kinds of emptiness, the two kinds of signlessness, the two kinds of wishlessness, the two kinds of formless, the two kinds of liberation, the two kinds of abandonment, the two kinds of exhaustion, the two kinds of nonexhaustion, the two kinds of nonproduction, the two kinds of nonarising, the two kinds of nonbirth, the two kinds of noncessation, the two kinds of nonentity, the two kinds of nonexistence, the two kinds of nonappearance, the two kinds of nonattachment, the two kinds of nonobstruction, the two kinds of nonaffliction, the two kinds of nonpurification, the two kinds of nonrealization, and the two kinds of nonattainment.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti mang po dang / g-yog 'khor la sogs pa skye bo mang po'i tshogs dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod @99a * //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti mang po dang / g-yog 'khor la sogs pa skye bo mang po'i tshogs dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod @99a * //
translated: They should not rely on the two kinds of self, the two kinds of attachment, the two kinds of grasping, the two kinds of craving, the two kinds of birth, the two kinds of suffering, the two kinds of origination, the two kinds of cessation, the two kinds of path, the two kinds of nirvƒÅ·πáa, the two kinds of emptiness, the two kinds of signlessness, the two kinds of wishlessness, the two kinds of formless, the two kinds of liberation

original: pa dang 'gyod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang the tshom du gyur pa'i sgrib pa lnga sbang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: pa dang 'gyod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang the tshom du gyur pa'i sgrib pa lnga sbang bar bya zhing /
translated: and the five hindrances of sensual desire, malice, lethargy, excitedness and regret, doubt.

original: de nyid kyis srod dang tho rangs dang nam gyi gung la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa shes par zad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis srod dang tho rangs dang nam gyi gung la mi nyal zhing rnal 'byor la brtson par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa shes par zad do //
translated: By that very [practice] one should strive in yoga without sleeping at dawn, dusk and midnight.

original: sems ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi rigs sam //
analyzed: sems ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste / sangs rgyas kyi rigs sam //
translated: The mind is the essence of the TathƒÅgata, the fundamental consciousness.üîΩIt is taught as the buddha lineage,

original: rang bzhin la sogs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: nature, and so on.

original: shes rab dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dir go rims bzhin du chos kyi dbye ba rab tu shes pa dang // de rnams kyi de kho na nyid shes pa ste //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dir go rims bzhin du chos kyi dbye ba rab tu shes pa dang // de rnams kyi de kho na nyid shes pa ste //
translated: The characteristics of wisdom and gnosis are, in order, the knowledge of the divisions of phenomena and the knowledge of their suchness.

original: de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par dgod pa la gnas zhes pa ste //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par dgod pa la gnas zhes pa ste //
translated: One who is established in the presentation of such characteristics is called a bodhisattva.

original: de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa sa bdun pa man chod kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa sa bdun pa man chod kyi gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The realization of those just as they are is included in the stage of the seventh stage.

original: gong du zhes pa ni de las lhag tu ste //
analyzed: gong du zhes pa ni de las lhag tu ste //
translated: Superior means superior to that.

original: yon tan khyad par can mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the actualization of special qualities.

original: de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: snang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: It is the characteristic of non-appearance.

original: sa brgyad ba'i gnas kyis bsdus pa gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med bzhi ba'i bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad ba'i gnas kyis bsdus pa gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med bzhi ba'i bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is the meditative equipoise in the fourth concentration without the characteristics of dualistic appearance, etc., included in the stage of the eighth stage.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang gi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mtshan nyid ni de rnams kyis sngon tshogs bsags shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang gi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mtshan nyid ni de rnams kyis sngon tshogs bsags shing /
translated: The characteristic of the blessing of one's own prayers of all Buddhas is that they previously accumulated the collections, made prayers,

original: smon lam btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis kyang de bzhin du tshogs bsags shing /
analyzed: smon lam btab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyis kyang de bzhin du tshogs bsags shing /
translated: and the Bodhisattva himself also accumulated the collections and made prayers in the same way.

original: smon lam btab pa'i stobs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi phyag glang po'i sna lta bu'o //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa'i stobs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi phyag glang po'i sna lta bu'o //
translated: By the power of that, the Buddhas of Complete Enjoyment extend their trunk-like arms

original: de mgo la bzhag cing tshig tu brjod par snang ba'i sgo nas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i don du zhi ba'i bsam gtan las bslangs nas sems can gyi don la sogs pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de mgo la bzhag cing tshig tu brjod par snang ba'i sgo nas kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i tshogs rdzogs par bya ba'i don du zhi ba'i bsam gtan las bslangs nas sems can gyi don la sogs pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: In order to complete the accumulations for attaining buddhahood, he is roused from the meditative stabilization of peace by the buddhas, who place their hands on his head and speak to him, and he is applied to the benefit of sentient beings and so on.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The first seven levels are mind.

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pas bcu pa las /
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o // zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pas bcu pa las /
translated: The eighth is nonappearance.

original: sa brgyad pa la zhi ba'i bas ma gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa nas sangs rgyas rnams kyis de las bslangs nas sems can gyi don la bskul ba nyid du gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la zhi ba'i bas ma gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa nas sangs rgyas rnams kyis de las bslangs nas sems can gyi don la bskul ba nyid du gsungs pas so //
translated: Moreover, the noble Ten Levels says that on the eighth level, he enters meditative stabilization in the peace of the base of nothing at all and is roused from that by the buddhas and is urged to the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni de ltar sems can gyi don la sogs pa la sbyar ba na yang @99b de rnams sems snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin du rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gi ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni de ltar sems can gyi don la sogs pa la sbyar ba na yang @99b de rnams sems snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin du rtogs shing /
translated: When the noble one is applied to the benefit of sentient beings and so on, he realizes that they are the nature of mere appearance to mind.

original: de'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa las mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa las mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is unshakable because it is the realization of suchness just as it is.

original: bong bu theng po lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sa bdun pa man chod du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams gnas ma gyur cing /
analyzed: bong bu theng po lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni sa bdun pa man chod du rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams gnas ma gyur cing /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúlike a lame person‚Äôs horse‚Äù and so on is that up to the seventh stage, the groups of consciousness have not been transformed.

original: mtshan ma 'am rtsel ba dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs yin pas /
analyzed: mtshan ma 'am rtsel ba dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs yin pas /
translated: Because they are still accompanied by signs or effort,

original: bgrod par bya ba'i gnas ji lta bar 'gro ba la cung zad thogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba'i gnas ji lta bar 'gro ba la cung zad thogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: they are slightly impeded in going to the places that are to be traversed.

original: de'i phyir sngar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid gsum khong du chud pas sngar gyi dman pa'i gnas skabs spangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bstan pa'i mtshan nyid gsum khong du chud pas sngar gyi dman pa'i gnas skabs spangs te /
translated: Therefore, by understanding the three characteristics that were previously taught, the bodhisattva abandons the previous inferior stage.

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyis brgyad pa thob nas dgu pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba'i rim gyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyis brgyad pa thob nas dgu pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba'i rim gyis sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having attained the eighth stage, the bodhisattva becomes a buddha by the process of application to the ninth stage and so on.

original: 'dir de'i gong du zhes pa ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i sngon rol lo //
analyzed: 'dir de'i gong du zhes pa ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa'i sngon rol lo //
translated: Here, ‚Äúbefore that‚Äù is before the eighth stage and so on.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi mtshan nyid gsum po ji ltar 'byung ba'i tshul ston to //
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pas sngar gyi mtshan nyid gsum po ji ltar 'byung ba'i tshul ston to //
translated: The phrase in that and so on teaches the way in which the three characteristics arise.

original: de la dang po'i don ni slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos mu stegs la sogs pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: de la dang po'i don ni slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos mu stegs la sogs pa rnams la yang /
translated: The meaning of the first is as follows: The master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´bhadra says, Even tƒ´rthikas and so on,

original: srog dang rtsol ba bsngams  pa'am //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba bsngams  pa'am //
translated: through the power of training in the prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅmaüîΩof counting, following, reversing,

original: bgrang dang rjes 'gro ldog pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa srog gi rlung la bslabs pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yod la /
analyzed: bgrang dang rjes 'gro ldog pa dang // zhes pa la sogs pa srog gi rlung la bslabs pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yod la /
translated: and so on, have a samƒÅdhi in which the appearances of conceptuality and so on are absent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs la bslabs shing 'dris par byas pas de 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs la bslabs shing 'dris par byas pas de 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob po zhes gsungs so //
translated: Also, bodhisattvas, through training in and familiarizing themselves with the method that is concordant with that, attain a samƒÅdhi like that.

original: 'dir de dag dang byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par ni ji ltar skyes bu mig btsums pa na /
analyzed: 'dir de dag dang byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par ni ji ltar skyes bu mig btsums pa na /
translated: Here the difference between those and bodhisattvas is as follows: When a person closes their eyes,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs mi snang ba dang / mig dang ldan pas dbang po legs par byas pa na bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs snang du rung ba las ma dmigs pas yod pa'i sgro 'dogs chod cing /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs mi snang ba dang / mig dang ldan pas dbang po legs par byas pa na bum pa la sogs pa'i gzugs snang du rung ba las ma dmigs pas yod pa'i sgro 'dogs chod cing /
translated: When the form of a pot, for example, is not visible, and when the eyes are functioning well, the form of the pot, for example, is suitable to appear, but it is not observed.

original: med par rtogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: med par rtogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: This eliminates the superimposition of existence, and one realizes nonexistence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni mtshan ma'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas de 'dra ba'i snang ba med pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni mtshan ma'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas de 'dra ba'i snang ba med pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa nyid yin la /
translated: Great bodhisattvas, on the other hand, realize that all phenomena with characteristics are emptiness. Since there is no such appearance, they have a union of serenity and insight.

original: gzhan ni de las bzlog pa'o //üîΩyang rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag dang / chos kyi bdag tu dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang de'i yul la ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su dpyod cing 'dris @100a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni de las bzlog pa'o // yang rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag dang / chos kyi bdag tu dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan dang de'i yul la ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su dpyod cing 'dris @100a * //
translated: The other approach is the opposite of that.

original: par byas pa las /
analyzed: par byas pa las /
translated: Moreover, in one sense, the concentrations of the person of sravaka and so on, which are accompanied by the observation of a self of persons and a self of phenomena, and the wisdom that fully analyzes and familiarizes one with the objects of those concentrations,

original: de rnams stong pa nyid du rtogs pas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams stong pa nyid du rtogs pas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba ste /
translated: Since one realizes those as emptiness, the meditative stabilization of non-appearance arises.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa nyid bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa nyid bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: the foot of magical emanation endowed with the formative force of the abandonment of the meditative stabilization of conduct is explained.

original: gnyis pa'i don ni shes par sla'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i don ni shes par sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the second is easy to understand.

original: 'dir smon lam ni sngar bstan pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyi smon lam yang de'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir smon lam ni sngar bstan pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid kyi smon lam yang de'i rgyu nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, the aspiration is as previously explained, and the bodhisattva's own aspiration is also a cause of that.

original: de la 'dir byin gyi rlabs ni de dag gi mthu yin la /
analyzed: de la 'dir byin gyi rlabs ni de dag gi mthu yin la /
translated: Here, the transformation is the power of those.

original: mtshan nyid ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de'i 'bras bur gyur pa tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The characteristic is the completion of the two accumulations which is the result of that.

original: gsum pa'i don la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces pa sa brgyad pa yan chad du stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rigs thams cad thob par gsungs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gsum pa'i don la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces pa sa brgyad pa yan chad du stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rigs thams cad thob par gsungs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang /
translated: As for the meaning of the third, ‚Äúall the qualities of a buddha‚Äù refers to the attainment of all the types of qualities of a buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, on the eighth ground and above.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi lus te /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi lus te /
translated: It is the body of the meditative absorption that is like an illusion.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus sgyu ma lta bu thob pas /
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus sgyu ma lta bu thob pas /
translated: Since one attains the illusory body that is of the nature of mind,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa'i rgyun gong nas gong du 'jug pa las 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa'i rgyun gong nas gong du 'jug pa las 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: one enters into the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa skabs kyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa skabs kyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage is summarized in the words ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas spyi'i tshul du gdams pa'i don 'khor gyi gtso bos zhus pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas spyi'i tshul du gdams pa'i don 'khor gyi gtso bos zhus pa ni /
translated: The chief of the retinue requests the meaning of the general way in which the TathƒÅgata has instructed:

original: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThen all the buddhas‚Äù and so on.

original: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the words is for the most part exhausted by that.

original: 'dir 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po tsam smos kyi de'i yul ma smos pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po tsam smos kyi de'i yul ma smos pa mi 'thad de /
translated: Here, it is not tenable to mention only the entity of the noble wisdom and not its object,

original: de la yang gzhan dag rmongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan dag rmongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because others would be confused about that.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault,

original: ye shes las tha dad pa'i gzung ba'i yul grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes las tha dad pa'i gzung ba'i yul grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no established apprehended object that is different from wisdom.

original: gang la gnas zhas pa ni dbyings dang nam mkha' dbyer med pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas zhas pa ni dbyings dang nam mkha' dbyer med pa chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin la gnas pa'o //
translated: As for where it abides, it abides in the nature of the dharmakƒÅya, the inseparability of the dhƒÅtu and space.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i rab tu rgyu ba zhes pa ni bdag med gnyis rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi rgyun rgyud de /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i rab tu rgyu ba zhes pa ni bdag med gnyis rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi rgyun rgyud de /
translated: As for the movement of the two types of selflessness, it is the continuum of the wisdom that realizes the two types of selflessness.

original: de nyid kyi dri ma sa bon dang bcas te sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dri ma sa bon dang bcas te sbyangs pa'o //
translated: It is the purification of the stains of that [wisdom] together with their seeds.

original: chos lnga dang rang bzhin rtogs pa las rnam par log pa ni de dag gi rnam par dbye ba rtogs pa kun rdzob mkhyen pa'i ye shes snang ba dang bcas pa las log pa @100b chos kyi sku shes rab dang ye shes tu 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: chos lnga dang rang bzhin rtogs pa las rnam par log pa ni de dag gi rnam par dbye ba rtogs pa kun rdzob mkhyen pa'i ye shes snang ba dang bcas pa las log pa @100b chos kyi sku shes rab dang ye shes tu 'brel ba ste /
translated: The dharmakƒÅya is the opposite of the realization of the five dharmas and the nature, the opposite of the relative wisdom that realizes the divisions of those, together with its appearances, and is connected with wisdom and gnosis.

original: ye shes rig pa dang / dbyings dang stong pa nyid dbyer med pa'i tshul du rtogs pa chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i spyod yul mngon par rtogs shing goms pa'i sgo nas mngon par grub pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes rig pa dang / dbyings dang stong pa nyid dbyer med pa'i tshul du rtogs pa chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i spyod yul mngon par rtogs shing goms pa'i sgo nas mngon par grub pa ste /
translated: The realization of the indivisible way of the gnosis of vidyƒÅ and the dhƒÅtu of emptiness is the realization of the object of the illusion-like state of all phenomena.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni zhing dang gnas de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs bstan pa'o // sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni zhing dang gnas de dag tu rdzu 'phrul gyis song zhing /
translated: This is the explanation of the accumulation of wisdom.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúall buddhafields‚Äù and so on refers to the perfection of the accumulation of merit by going to those fields and places through one‚Äôs miraculous powers,

original: sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / sems can gyi don byas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mchod pa dang / sems can gyi don byas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: making offerings to the buddhas, and benefiting sentient beings.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar mthar gyis 'og min gyi gnas su nye bar song ste /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar mthar gyis 'og min gyi gnas su nye bar song ste /
translated: As previously explained, one gradually approaches the Akani·π£·π≠ha realm,

original: de bzhin gshes sa  pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rab tu thob par 'gyur ba'i 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po ral tu 'byed pa'i rang bzhin thab mo'i chos kyi rnam grangs sngar bstan pa dgag bya dang de dgag par brjod pa'i tshig brgya rtsa brgyad
analyzed: de bzhin gshes sa  pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rab tu thob par 'gyur ba'i 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po ral tu 'byed pa'i rang bzhin thab mo'i chos kyi rnam grangs sngar bstan pa dgag bya dang de dgag par brjod pa'i tshig brgya rtsa brgyad
translated: and one attains the enjoyment body of a tathƒÅgata. The subject matter of the noble wisdom that is the nature of the differentiation of the Dharma of the perfection of wisdom, which was previously explained as the enumeration of the Dharma, is the basis of the differentiation of the one hundred and eight topics that express the refutation and the object of refutation.

original: shin tu phye ba'i gnas te de dag thams cad la bden pa'i don grub pa med pas tshig tsam nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: shin tu phye ba'i gnas te de dag thams cad la bden pa'i don grub pa med pas tshig tsam nyid yin zhing /
translated: All of these are mere words because the meaning of truth is not established.

original: tshig nyid kyang don la ltos pas dngos por mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: tshig nyid kyang don la ltos pas dngos por mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: And since the words themselves depend on the meaning, it is not tenable that they are things.üîΩTherefore, the apprehension of the object of refutation and the sign of the negated phenomenon is itself an extreme.

original: de'i phyir dgag bya dang / bkag pa'i chos kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni mtha' nyid du 'gyur pa de ltar bdag la bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag bya dang / bkag pa'i chos kyi mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni mtha' nyid du 'gyur pa de ltar bdag la bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, please explain this to me.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas lan ldon par byed de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas lan ldon par byed de /
translated: The reply is given by the Blessed One in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so!‚Äù

original: re zhig dang por mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa'i tshul ni phyi rol pa 'am rang gi sde pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: re zhig dang por mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa'i tshul ni phyi rol pa 'am rang gi sde pa yang rung ste /
translated: First, the way of holding the two extremes is as follows.

original: log par lta ba can thams cad mu stegs nyid du 'og nas ston par 'gyur la //
analyzed: log par lta ba can thams cad mu stegs nyid du 'og nas ston par 'gyur la //
translated: All those with wrong views, whether non-Buddhists or our own Buddhist schools, will be shown below to be tƒ´rthikas.

original: de dag las kyang 'ga' zhig snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dang / bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gtan nas med pa'o zhes med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin la /
analyzed: de dag las kyang 'ga' zhig snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dang / bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa phan tshun gcig la gcig med pa dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa gtan nas med pa'o zhes med pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin la /
translated: And among them, some hold the sign of nonexistence, saying, ‚ÄúThere is no prior nonexistence, no post nonexistence, no mutual nonexistence of things like pots and cloth, and no utter nonexistence of things like the horns of a rabbit.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba'i don de dag gis dben pa'am /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba'i don de dag gis dben pa'am /
translated: They think that the objects of negation are empty of those,

original: de dag gis bzlog zlar gyur pa'i bong gi mgo bo dang / glang gi rva la sogs pa ni dngos po yod pa'o zhes yod pa'i mthar rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bzlog zlar gyur pa'i bong gi mgo bo dang / glang gi rva la sogs pa ni dngos po yod pa'o zhes yod pa'i mthar rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: and that the opposites of those, things like the head of an ass and the horns of an ox, are existent things.

original: de la mu stegs kyi lta ba can zhes pa ni de dag ni grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la mu stegs kyi lta ba can zhes pa ni de dag ni grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'o //
translated: In this regard, those with tƒ´rthika views are based on tenets.

original: mu stegs can zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' ma thos kyang rang bzhin gyis phyin ci log pa'o //üîΩde ltar mngon par zhen pa'i @101a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha' ma thos kyang rang bzhin gyis phyin ci log pa'o // de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i @101a * //
translated: The ‚Äúnon-Buddhists‚Äù are those who are naturally mistaken even without hearing the philosophical tenets.

original: rgyu mtshan yang ri bong gi rvar rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo de 'dra ba'i rnam par snang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang ri bong gi rvar rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo de 'dra ba'i rnam par snang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason for such a conception is that, in the case of the thought ‚ÄúThe rabbit has no horns,‚Äù the object of that thought, the rabbit, does not appear in the aspect of the thought.

original: de'i yul ri bong la rva med do snyam ste /
analyzed: de'i yul ri bong la rva med do snyam ste /
translated: Thus one thinks, ‚ÄúThe rabbit has no horns.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la yang phan tshun gyi bdag nyid med pa dang / sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs su med do zhes rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la yang phan tshun gyi bdag nyid med pa dang / sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs su med do zhes rnam par rtog go //
translated: Similarly, one conceives of all phenomena, such as form, as lacking mutual identity and as lacking identity in terms of prior and subsequent temporal stages.

original: rgyu zad pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i rtog pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen gzhan zad pa'i dbang gis med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu zad pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i rtog pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen gzhan zad pa'i dbang gis med pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe exhaustion of the cause‚Äù means that the exhaustion of other conditions that are the causes of such thoughts is the reason for their nonexistence.

original: rva med pa'i mtshan ma ji ltar bzung ba bzhin gnas pa la brten nas de 'dra ba'i blo med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rva med pa'i mtshan ma ji ltar bzung ba bzhin gnas pa la brten nas de 'dra ba'i blo med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not that the nonexistence of such thoughts is due to the fact that the sign of the nonexistence of horns remains as it is apprehended.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas yod pa'i mthar rtog pa'i tshul ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas yod pa'i mthar rtog pa'i tshul ston te /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, and so forth, shows the way of conceiving the extreme of existence.

original: de la dpe'i tshul gyi khyad par ni ba lang gi rva la sogs pa yod par 'jog pa'i gtan tshigs don byed par nus pa dang / gang zhig don byed par nus pa de ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dpe'i tshul gyi khyad par ni ba lang gi rva la sogs pa yod par 'jog pa'i gtan tshigs don byed par nus pa dang / gang zhig don byed par nus pa de ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the special way of the example is: The reason for positing the existence of a cow's horn and so forth is that it is able to perform a function, and that which is able to perform a function exists,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: for example, like a pot.

original: de'i phyir de la sa bzlog pa'i ri bong gi rva med par mngon par chags shing zhen pa rnams de dang mi mthun pa ba lang gi rva yod do snyam du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la sa bzlog pa'i ri bong gi rva med par mngon par chags shing zhen pa rnams de dang mi mthun pa ba lang gi rva yod do snyam du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in that regard, those who are attached to the non-existence of the reversed horn of a rabbit conceive of the existence of a cow's horn as being different from that.

original: blo gros chen po mtha' gnyis zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i lta ba 'or cig par gdams pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po mtha' gnyis zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i lta ba 'or cig par gdams pa'o //
translated: Mahamati, the two extremes and so forth admonishes to abandon such a view.

original: sems kyi khams nyid rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi khams nyid rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The element of mind itself is conceptual.

original: khams kyi don ni rgyu 'am dbyings so //
analyzed: khams kyi don ni rgyu 'am dbyings so //
translated: The meaning of element is cause or space.

original: de'i phyir lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas dang 'gro ba rnams su rnam par rtog par brtags pa ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas dang 'gro ba rnams su rnam par rtog par brtags pa ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of the body, possessions, abode, and going is imagined as the nature of conceptualization,

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: or it arises from its cause.

original: des sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: des sgro btags pa'o //
translated: It is a superimposition by that.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi ri bong gi rva med do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i mdun du med pa'i mtshan mar sgro btags pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi ri bong gi rva med do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i mdun du med pa'i mtshan mar sgro btags pa /
translated: The non-existence of a rabbit's horn, which has such a nature, is a superimposition of the sign of non-existence in front of the mind that conceives.

original: de kho na nyid du yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan ma las rnam par log pa la med pa'i mtshan mar brtag par mi bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan ma las rnam par log pa la med pa'i mtshan mar brtag par mi bya zhes pa'o //
translated: In reality, it should not be imagined as the sign of non-existence, which is the opposite of the sign of existence and non-existence.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis bcos shing brtags pa las log pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis bcos shing brtags pa las log pa ste /
translated: Similarly, all phenomena are the opposite of being fabricated and imagined by the mind that conceives the signs of existence, non-existence, and so on.

original: de lta de ltar brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta de ltar brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: They should not be imagined in that way.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam rtog ma rig chen po ste /
analyzed: rnam rtog ma rig chen po ste /
