translated: Conceptualization is the great ignorance,

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ltung bar byed //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ltung bar byed //
translated: Which causes one to fall into the ocean of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: @101b 'di nyid du yang sngar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @101b 'di nyid du yang sngar bstan pa ste /
translated: And here in this very text it has been taught previously:üîΩIf one is free from all conceptual thoughts, free from all conceptual elaborations,

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes mtshan mar bzung zhing mdun du byas na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes mtshan mar bzung zhing mdun du byas na /
translated: and one apprehends it as a sign and makes it into something in front of oneself,

original: de yang phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ba'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de yang phyin ci log nyid du 'gyur ba'o zhes bstan te /
translated: then that is a mistake.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid dam /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the nature of all phenomena,

original: ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i pad ma la sogs pa kun rdzob tsam du yang dngos po'i ngo bo bkag pa tsam ni de ltar bden mod kyi /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i pad ma la sogs pa kun rdzob tsam du yang dngos po'i ngo bo bkag pa tsam ni de ltar bden mod kyi /
translated: or the mere conventional, such as the horns of a rabbit, the sky flower, and so on, is indeed true as the mere negation of the entity of things.

original: de dag med pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis mdun du byas shing mtshan mar bzung ba ni phyin ci log g-yang sa'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis mdun du byas shing mtshan mar bzung ba ni phyin ci log g-yang sa'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: But the conceptual thought that apprehends as a sign and makes into something in front of oneself the statement ‚ÄúThose do not exist‚Äù is called ‚Äúthe extreme of the mistake of the abyss of nonexistence.‚Äù

original: med pa las rnam par log zhes pa yab de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi med pa las log pa ste /
analyzed: med pa las rnam par log zhes pa yab de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi med pa las log pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúReverses from nonexistence‚Äù means that it is the opposite of the nonexistence of such a nature.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: dgag pa bkag pa sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dgag pa bkag pa sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: the negation of the negation would be established.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa sngar bstan no //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa sngar bstan no //
translated: These faults have been taught above.üîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, if someone says‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: blo gros chen po gang yang zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log la gnas pa rnams de ltar rtog mod kyi /üîΩyang dag par na de dag gis ri bong gi rva med cing /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang yang zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log la gnas pa rnams de ltar rtog mod kyi / yang dag par na de dag gis ri bong gi rva med cing /
translated: Although those who abide in error think in this way,üîΩin reality they should not conceive that the rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist

original: ba lang gi rva la sogs pa yod ces brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva la sogs pa yod ces brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: and that the ox‚Äôs horns and so on do exist.

original: yod pa dang med pa phan tshun ltos pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa phan tshun ltos pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because existence and nonexistence are mutually dependent causes.

original: gal te de lta na yang ltos par bya ba ba lang gi rva la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ltos par bya ba ba lang gi rva la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if that is so, since the object of dependence, the ox‚Äôs horns and so on, exist,

original: de las bzlog pa ri bong gi rva med pa nyid du brtag par 'os so zhe na ;
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ri bong gi rva med pa nyid du brtag par 'os so zhe na ;
translated: it is appropriate to conceive that the opposite, the nonexistence of the rabbit‚Äôs horns, exists.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, if someone says‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul las rnam par log ces pa'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa la yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bden pa gnyis kyi rab tu byed pa las bshad pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul las rnam par log ces pa'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa la yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bden pa gnyis kyi rab tu byed pa las bshad pa'am /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe domain of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas‚Äù is that it does not appear even to the wisdom of omniscience. This is explained in the Topic of the Two Truths.

original: gzhan yang gzugs rnams mi mthong tshor bdag kyang mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs rnams mi mthong tshor bdag kyang mi mthong zhing /
translated: Moreover, one does not see forms, nor does one see feelings as the self,

original: 'du shes mthong ba med pa la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du shes mthong ba med pa la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: and one does not see discriminations, and so on, as explained in the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i the tshom bcad par bya ba'i don du zhus pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i the tshom bcad par bya ba'i don du zhus pa ste /
translated: Then, the request is made in order to eliminate the doubts of the disciples, beginning with ‚ÄúThen, the Bodhisattva Avalokite≈õvara . . .‚Äù

original: de'i don ni ri bong gi rva ra rnam par rtog cing snang ba'i blo ma dmigs pas blo'i yul du gyur pa de las tha dad pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur ba'i ri bong gi rva med do zhes dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni ri bong gi rva ra rnam par rtog cing snang ba'i blo ma dmigs pas blo'i yul du gyur pa de las tha dad pa phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur ba'i ri bong gi rva med do zhes dpag par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Since the mind that appears and conceives of the rabbit‚Äôs horns is not observed, one should infer that the rabbit‚Äôs horns, which are a different external entity from the object of the mind, do not exist.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig yod na /
translated: If some external entity existed,

original: de ltar snang ba'i blo dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i blo dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: then the mind that appears in that way would be observed,

original: glang gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems @102a * //
analyzed: glang gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems @102a * //
translated: like the elephant‚Äôs horns and so on.

original: pa'o // lan gyi don ni gal te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i dngos po yod na der snang ba'i yul can gyi blo ni 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: pa'o // lan gyi don ni gal te ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i dngos po yod na der snang ba'i yul can gyi blo ni 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: The meaning of the reply: If things such as the horns of a rabbit exist, then the mind that perceives them would be the effect,

original: yul ni rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yul ni rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and the object would be the cause.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshad ma rnam par gtan la dbab pa las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par gtan la dbab pa las /
translated: In Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge it says:

original: rnam par rtog par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is able to conceive,

original: shes pa'i yul ni rgyu nyid yin la /
analyzed: shes pa'i yul ni rgyu nyid yin la /
translated: the object of consciousness is the cause,üîΩand that which is not the cause is not the object.

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul du mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / rnam 'grel las kyang /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni yul du mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / rnam 'grel las kyang /
translated: And in the Thorough Exposition of Valid Knowledge it says:

original: rgyu min yul yang ji ltar rung //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu min yul yang ji ltar rung // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: How could a non-cause be an object?

original: de'i phyir ri bong gi rvar rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa yul can gyi blo 'bras bur gyur ba bkag pas rgyu bkag pa ni 'khrul pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir ri bong gi rvar rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa yul can gyi blo 'bras bur gyur ba bkag pas rgyu bkag pa ni 'khrul pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of the mind that is the subject, the conception of the horns of a rabbit, and so on, as the effect refutes the cause. This is just a mistake.

original: ji ltar sa phyogs su sha zar snang ba'i blo bkag pas sha za dgag par mi nus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sa phyogs su sha zar snang ba'i blo bkag pas sha za dgag par mi nus pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as, for example, the refutation of the mind that perceives a ghost in a cairn is not able to refute the ghost.

original: 'dir de ni zhes bya ba'i don ni gal te phyi rol gyi dngos por gyur pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yod na /
analyzed: 'dir de ni zhes bya ba'i don ni gal te phyi rol gyi dngos por gyur pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yod na /
translated: Here the meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is as follows: If the horns of a rabbit and so on existed as external things,

original: de nyid der snang pa'i yul can rnam par rtog pa'i blo la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid der snang pa'i yul can rnam par rtog pa'i blo la sogs pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: then that would be the cause of the cognition that perceives it, such as the conceptual mind.

original: de la brten te blo byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten te blo byung zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe mind arises in dependence on that.‚Äù

original: gal te 'dir sha za la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi skal ba yin pas yod kyang der snang ba'i blo mi 'byung la /
analyzed: gal te 'dir sha za la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi skal ba yin pas yod kyang der snang ba'i blo mi 'byung la /
translated: If a flesh-eating ghost and so on existed by its own nature, it would not arise as the cognition that perceives it.

original: ri bong gi rva ni yod par gyur na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal zhing mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag kyang chang bas dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te glang gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ni yod par gyur na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis ma bskal zhing mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag kyang chang bas dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te glang gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If the horns of a rabbit existed, it would be observed, like the horns of an ox, because it is not excluded by place, time, and nature, and other conditions that are observed, such as the eye sense faculty, are complete.

original: de ltar bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true.

original: 'dir ri bong gi rva mad ces rnam pa thams cad du med par bkag pa'i don dang / der snang ba'i blo bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa la ni go bya go byed du mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar rgyas par bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir ri bong gi rva mad ces rnam pa thams cad du med par bkag pa'i don dang / der snang ba'i blo bkag pa tsam gyi med par dgag pa la ni go bya go byed du mi 'thad pa nyid du sngar rgyas par bstan la /
translated: Here, the meaning of the negation ‚Äúthe rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist‚Äù is the complete negation of the rabbit‚Äôs horns.üîΩAnd the meaning of the negation ‚Äúthe mind that appears as that does not exist‚Äù is the mere negation of the mind that appears as that.

original: gzhan yang mad do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i mdun du mtshan mar bzung ba dang / der snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo med ces mtshan mar bzung ba ni sgro btags pa'i don te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mad do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i mdun du mtshan mar bzung ba dang / der snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo med ces mtshan mar bzung ba ni sgro btags pa'i don te /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the superimposition ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is the apprehension of a sign in the presence of the conceptual mind, and the meaning of the superimposition ‚Äúthe mind that appears as that does not exist‚Äù is the apprehension of a sign in the presence of the conceptual mind.

original: ji ltar btags pa bzhin mi bden pas khyad par du yang go bya dang go byed mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar btags pa bzhin mi bden pas khyad par du yang go bya dang go byed mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is not real in accordance with the imputation, it is not tenable that it is the object of expression and the means of expression.

original: gal te de lta na gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then because of being an entity that is free from one and many,

original: ji ltar snang ba sgyu ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yang mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba sgyu ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa yang mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: it is not tenable to posit ‚Äúwhatever appears is an illusion.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i blos brtags pa ni de @102b ltar bden pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir yang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i blos brtags pa ni de @102b ltar bden pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan la /
translated: Here also, the conceptual mind that apprehends the signs of illusions and so on is not true in that way, as was previously explained.

original: go bya go byed du 'gyur ba'i tshul don dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyang sngar rgyas par gtan la phab bo //
analyzed: go bya go byed du 'gyur ba'i tshul don dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyang sngar rgyas par gtan la phab bo //
translated: The way that the ultimate thatness is the object of understanding and the means of understanding was previously determined in detail.

original: skabs su bab pa'i don 'dir yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i dngos po bkag pa de'i mgo la sogs par snang ba'i chos can gyi chos su bskor ba sgyu ma lta bu'i don dang / de ltar dmigs pa'i blo bkag pa'i ngo bo ni go bya go byed du 'thad cing sgyu ma don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med ces bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i don 'dir yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i dngos po bkag pa de'i mgo la sogs par snang ba'i chos can gyi chos su bskor ba sgyu ma lta bu'i don dang / de ltar dmigs pa'i blo bkag pa'i ngo bo ni go bya go byed du 'thad cing sgyu ma don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med ces bya'o //
translated: In this context, the meaning of the illusion-like object is that the negation of things such as the horns of a rabbit is the object of understanding and the means of understanding, and the negation of the mind that observes it is the object of understanding and the means of understanding. The ultimate nature of the illusion is called ‚Äúessenceless.‚Äù

original: 'dir mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan pa'i don ni ri bong gi rva med ces rnam par rtog pa'i blo sa mdun du byas shing mtshan mar bzung ba'i don te ;
analyzed: 'dir mi 'thad pa nyid du bstan pa'i don ni ri bong gi rva med ces rnam par rtog pa'i blo sa mdun du byas shing mtshan mar bzung ba'i don te ;
translated: Here, the meaning that is taught to be untenable is the object that is taken as the front and apprehended as a sign by the conceptual mind that thinks, ‚ÄúThe horns of a rabbit do not exist.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i dngos po bkag pa tsam blo'i byed pas sgro ma btags pa ni de bzhin du bden pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i dngos po bkag pa tsam blo'i byed pas sgro ma btags pa ni de bzhin du bden pa'o //
translated: The mere negation of such an entity, which is not fabricated by the power of the mind, is the truth in that way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag skabs kyi mdo 'di rnams kyi don yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba rab tu mi gnas pa'i don nyid bstan pa yin no zhes smra ba'i log par rtogs pa bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag skabs kyi mdo 'di rnams kyi don yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba rab tu mi gnas pa'i don nyid bstan pa yin no zhes smra ba'i log par rtogs pa bsal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the error of others who claim that the meaning of these sutras of this section is the non-abiding of all positions, such as existence and non-existence, is refuted.

original: tha dad pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni ji ltar ba lang gi rva dang mtshungs par ri bong gi rva yod par gyur na yang don dam pa'i de kho na nyid du bsams na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang zhes pa la sogs pas ni ji ltar ba lang gi rva dang mtshungs par ri bong gi rva yod par gyur na yang don dam pa'i de kho na nyid du bsams na /
translated: The line ‚ÄúIf different‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth explains that if the rabbit‚Äôs horns were to exist in the same way as the cow‚Äôs horns, then when considering the ultimate reality,

original: rva dang de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i blo gnyis gcig dang tha dad pa la sa grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rva dang de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i blo gnyis gcig dang tha dad pa la sa grol ba'i phyir /
translated: the horns and the mind that conceives of them in that way would be free from being either the same or different.

original: de 'dra ba'i blo yod pa ma yin pas de la ltos te ri bong gi rva med do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis mtshan mar bzung ba ni mi bden zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i blo yod pa ma yin pas de la ltos te ri bong gi rva med do zhes rnam par rtog pa'i blo yis mtshan mar bzung ba ni mi bden zhes pa'o //
translated: Since such a mind does not exist, in dependence on that, the rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist. The conception that apprehends them as signs is not true.

original: de'i don yang ri bong gi rva dang der snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo gal te tha dad na ni blo rva'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i don yang ri bong gi rva dang der snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i blo gal te tha dad na ni blo rva'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: If the rabbit‚Äôs horn and the thought that appears as that are different, then the thought would not arise from the cause of the horn.

original: tha dad pa dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa gnyis ka yang rgyur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa gnyis ka yang rgyur mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that either a difference that is simultaneous or a difference that is not simultaneous is a cause.

original: de ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni de'i rgyu las byung ba ste /üîΩtha dad pa sa yin pa'i rtags las rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas blo de yang med par 'gyur zhes rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni de'i rgyu las byung ba ste / tha dad pa sa yin pa'i rtags las rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pas blo de yang med par 'gyur zhes rtogs pa'am /
translated: If they are not different, then it arises from its cause.üîΩThe thought is understood to be nonexistent through the inference that understands the reason of being different.

original: pha rol la thal ba'i don du sbyor bas te /
analyzed: pha rol la thal ba'i don du sbyor bas te /
translated: Or, the meaning of the consequence is applied to the opponent.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan ma yang rva dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan ma yang rva dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: The reason is because the horn is not different from that.

original: de'i khyab pa'i don ni glang gi rva dang mtshungs pa'i ri bong gi rva yang rigs pa dam pas rdul phra rab kyi bar du brtags na mi dmigs pas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i khyab pa'i don ni glang gi rva dang mtshungs pa'i ri bong gi rva yang rigs pa dam pas rdul phra rab kyi bar du brtags na mi dmigs pas zhes pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the pervasion is that even the horn of a rabbit, which is similar to the horn of an ox, is not observed when it is investigated with the best reasoning down to the level of the most subtle particles.

original: med pa dang tha dad med pa'i phyir med pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: med pa dang tha dad med pa'i phyir med pa nyid du 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Because of non-existence and non-difference, there is non-existence.

original: de ltar na blo dang rva gnyis @103a * //
analyzed: de ltar na blo dang rva gnyis @103a * //
translated: Thus, if the entity of both the mind and the horn

original: ka'i dngos po med na /
analyzed: ka'i dngos po med na /
translated: does not exist,

original: rgyu mtshan gang gis phan tshun gcig la gcig ltos te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang gis phan tshun gcig la gcig ltos te /
translated: on the basis of what reason would they be mutually dependent?

original: med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: They would be non-existent.

original: de 'dra ba'i mtshan ma grub par mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i mtshan ma grub par mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Such a sign would not be established.

original: gal te ba lang gi rva yod pa la ltos te ri bong gi rva med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ba lang gi rva yod pa la ltos te ri bong gi rva med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the non-existence of the rabbit‚Äôs horn is due to the existence of the cow‚Äôs horn,

original: blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: MahƒÅmati and so on.

original: de 'dra ba'i ltos pa ma grub pas de la ltos pa med pa'i mtshan mar bzung bar bya ba'i don grub pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i ltos pa ma grub pas de la ltos pa med pa'i mtshan mar bzung bar bya ba'i don grub pa med ces pa'o //
translated: Since such dependence is not established, there is no object to be apprehended as a sign that is independent of that.

original: de'i phyir gang dag ri bong gi mgo bo rva dang ldan par bskyed pa'i rgyu ni med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag ri bong gi mgo bo rva dang ldan par bskyed pa'i rgyu ni med la /
translated: Therefore, there is no cause that produces the rabbit‚Äôs head with horns.

original: ba lang gi rva la sogs pa ni de las bzlog pas rgyu mi mnyam pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva la sogs pa ni de las bzlog pas rgyu mi mnyam pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste shes par zad do /
translated: The horns of a cow and so forth are the opposite of that, and because the cause is not equal, and so forth, it is understood.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de'i rang bzhin can gzhan la sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni de'i rang bzhin can gzhan la sbyar ba ste /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati... and so forth apply this to other [phenomena].

original: phyin ci log tu lta ba'i mu stegs can gang dag thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs yod pa la ltos te /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba'i mu stegs can gang dag thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs yod pa la ltos te /
translated: The tirthikas who view things incorrectly, in dependence on existent obstructed form,

original: de las bzlog pa nam mkha' thogs par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'o zhes mtshan mar 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa nam mkha' thogs par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'o zhes mtshan mar 'dzin pa'am /
translated: think that the opposite of that is space, an unobstructed entity.üîΩThey apprehend it as a sign, or they think that space is the nature of the unconditioned, substantially established, and so forth.

original: de la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rdzas su grub par 'dod pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin yongs su rtog pa la mi mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rdzas su grub par 'dod pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin yongs su rtog pa la mi mkhas pa ste /
translated: They are unskilled in the complete understanding of the nature of space.üîΩForm is also conceived to be an entity that is free from the essence of space.

original: gzugs kyang nam mkha'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i dngos po yod par rtog par byed pa ni phyin ci log pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyang nam mkha'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i dngos po yod par rtog par byed pa ni phyin ci log pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is incorrect.

original: don dam par gzugs rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rjes su zhugs zhes pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rjes su zhugs zhes pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate, it is said that forms follow the elements.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs su snang ba ni rang rang gi ngo bos stong pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'am de'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs su snang ba ni rang rang gi ngo bos stong pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'am de'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: The appearance of primary and secondary material forms is like space, or has the nature of space, because it is empty of its own entity.

original: gzugs nyid kyang nam mkha' ste zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang nam mkha' ste zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Form itself is space‚Äù is applied to this.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' nyid kyang gzugs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' nyid kyang gzugs te /
translated: Therefore, space itself is form,

original: don dam par de dag dbyer med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par de dag dbyer med pa'i phyir /
translated: because ultimately they are inseparable.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gcig la gcig ltos pa'i dbang gis brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gcig la gcig ltos pa'i dbang gis brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be imagined to have mutually contradictory natures, by the power of mutual dependence.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, in the noble Perfection of Wisdom, it says, ‚ÄúThat bodhisattva mahasattva should not dwell on form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs gzugs kyi ngo bos stong pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / rigs pas kyang de bzhin du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs gzugs kyi ngo bos stong pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / rigs pas kyang de bzhin du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form is empty of the entityness of form.‚Äù And so on. And it is established by reasoning in the same way.

original: gal te de lta na gzugs dang nam mkha' phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du @103b dmigs pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzugs dang nam mkha' phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du @103b dmigs pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why is it observed that form and space are mutually exclusive?

original: kun rdzob tu de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni gzhag pa dang gzhi'i tshul du gyur par yid ches par bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni gzhag pa dang gzhi'i tshul du gyur par yid ches par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: One should believe that the cause of positing them as such in the conventional is the mode of the basis and the mode of positing.

original: ji ltar gzhag par bya ba bum pa dang / de'i gzhi sa phyogs dang 'dra bar ri dang sa gzhi la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhir gyur pa dang / de la rten cing 'byar bar snang ba nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhag par bya ba bum pa dang / de'i gzhi sa phyogs dang 'dra bar ri dang sa gzhi la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhir gyur pa dang / de la rten cing 'byar bar snang ba nam mkha' ste /
translated: Just as the object to be posited is a pot and its basis is a place, so the basis of form is mountains, the earth, and so on, and space appears to be supported on and connected to that.

original: kun rdzob tsam du phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du phan tshun 'gal ba'o //
translated: They are mutually exclusive only in the mere conventional.

original: yang nam mkha'i go skabs na gnas pa'i gzugs bya dang gnam du 'phangs pa la sogs pa ni gzhag pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang nam mkha'i go skabs na gnas pa'i gzugs bya dang gnam du 'phangs pa la sogs pa ni gzhag pa zhes bya la /
translated: Also form that exists in the space of an opening, such as a bird flying in the sky, is called the posited.

original: nam mkha' ni de dag gi gzhi'i tshul du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni de dag gi gzhi'i tshul du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Space should be viewed as the mode of the basis of those.

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob tsam du 'byung ba rnams skye ba ni phan tshun du rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob tsam du 'byung ba rnams skye ba ni phan tshun du rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the arising of the elements, which is mere convention, is different from each other by the particulars of their own characteristics.

original: tsha zhing sreg pa dang gsher ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: tsha zhing sreg pa dang gsher ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is different by the particulars of being hot and burning, being wet, and so forth.

original: nam mkha' la yang mi gnas zhes pa de'i rang bzhin gyis mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang mi gnas zhes pa de'i rang bzhin gyis mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Nor do they exist in space. They do not exist by their nature.

original: de dag la yang nam mkha' med //
analyzed: de dag la yang nam mkha' med //
translated: Nor is there space in them.

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: This is

original: de dag gi bdag nyid kyi tshul du med pa'a  //
analyzed: de dag gi bdag nyid kyi tshul du med pa'a  //
translated: because they do not exist in the manner of being its nature.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang nam mkha' kun rdzob tsam du phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang nam mkha' kun rdzob tsam du phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, form and space should be seen as mutually contradictory, merely conventionally.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid sngar gyi don la sbyar te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de nyid sngar gyi don la sbyar te bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati‚Äù and so on teaches the meaning of the above.

original: ri bong gi rva med do zhes pa'i mtshan mar bzung ba ni ba lang gi rva yod pa la ltos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med do zhes pa'i mtshan mar bzung ba ni ba lang gi rva yod pa la ltos zhes pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of the sign ‚ÄúThe rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist‚Äù depends on the existence of the ox‚Äôs horns.

original: de ste gzhan la ltos zhes pa bum pa la sogs pa yod pa'i chos can gzhan la'o //
analyzed: de ste gzhan la ltos zhes pa bum pa la sogs pa yod pa'i chos can gzhan la'o //
translated: That is to say, in dependence on another means in dependence on another existent phenomenon, such as a pot.

original: de yang de lta bu zhes pa ni rdul phra rab kyi bar du brtags na ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de lta bu zhes pa ni rdul phra rab kyi bar du brtags na ma grub pa'o //
translated: And that too is like that means that when it is investigated down to the most subtle particles, it is not established.

original: skabs kyi don 'di rnams sngar bstan pa'i chos dang chos med pa rnam par bkag pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di rnams sngar bstan pa'i chos dang chos med pa rnam par bkag pa dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These topics of the present section should be applied to the refutation of the existence and nonexistence of phenomena that was presented above.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas nye bar gdams pa'i tshul gyis bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pas nye bar gdams pa'i tshul gyis bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Then, beginning with Then the Blessed One, the text is a summary in the manner of an instruction.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i don ni phal cher shes par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the verses is for the most part self-explanatory.

original: gal te snang ba med na de las sems 'byung ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba med na de las sems 'byung ba mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: One might ask, If there is no appearance, it is untenable for the mind to arise from that.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po med kyang kun rdzob tu sems kyi ngo bor yod cing /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po med kyang kun rdzob tu sems kyi ngo bor yod cing /
translated: Even though external things do not exist, they exist as the nature of the mind on the conventional level.

original: de 'dra ba'i sa bon snga ma las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sa bon snga ma las 'byung ba'o //
translated: They arise from a seed that is similar to it.

original: 'dra ba ni de 'dra ba'i rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni de 'dra ba'i rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: Similarity means that it appears in a way that is similar to that.

original: dag pa zhes pa ni de dag la phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa'i dri ma'o //
analyzed: dag pa zhes pa ni de dag la phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa'i dri ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPure‚Äù means that they are stained by the superimposition of the opposite of those.

original: 'brel zhes pa ni snga ma ltar phan tshun ltos pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: 'brel zhes pa ni snga ma ltar phan tshun ltos pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRelated‚Äù means that they are related to each other in the manner of the former.

original: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa ni ring dang @104a * //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa ni ring dang @104a * // zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The meaning of that is clarified in ‚Äúlong and short,‚Äù and so on.

original: ring po sgrub pa thung du la ltos zhes pa la sogs pa go bar zad do //
analyzed: ring po sgrub pa thung du la ltos zhes pa la sogs pa go bar zad do //
translated: ‚ÄúLong‚Äù is established in dependence on ‚Äúshort,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par brtag mi bya zhes pa ni brtag bya'i yul grub pa med pas gzugs kyi dngos por mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par brtag mi bya zhes pa ni brtag bya'i yul grub pa med pas gzugs kyi dngos por mi rtag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not imagine‚Äù means that since the object of imagination is not established, it is not permanent as a thing of form.

original: kun rdzob sems tsam gyi tshul du gzhag pa ni ngan pa'i lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyis rtogs par ma nus zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob sems tsam gyi tshul du gzhag pa ni ngan pa'i lta ba la gnas pa rnams kyis rtogs par ma nus zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who abide in bad views are not able to understand‚Äù the presentation of the mere mind of the conventional.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas bshad pa dag kyang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dris pa'i lan /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes pa la sogs pas bshad pa dag kyang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dris pa'i lan /
translated: Then, beginning with ‚ÄúThen the BhagavƒÅn said to Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,‚Äù he asks, ‚ÄúHow is it that the explanations are also?‚Äù

original: gdul bya'i sems rgyud rnam par sbyang ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bshad pa 'jug pa'i tshul du ston te /
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems rgyud rnam par sbyang ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bshad pa 'jug pa'i tshul du ston te /
translated: In order to purify the mindstreams of disciples, the Tathagata teaches the way to enter the explanation.

original: de la dang por gdul bya khams dang mos pa dman pa zab mo bshad pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: de la dang por gdul bya khams dang mos pa dman pa zab mo bshad pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan pa rnams la /
translated: First, disciples whose elements and aspirations are inferior and who are not fortunate enough to be taught the profound are

original: thog mar gang zag dang phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa'i rim gyis sems brid cing de kho na nyid zab mo la brgyud nas sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: thog mar gang zag dang phung po la sogs pa yod par bstan pa'i rim gyis sems brid cing de kho na nyid zab mo la brgyud nas sbyor bar byed de /
translated: first taught that the person, the aggregates and so on exist. In stages, their minds are led and they are gradually introduced to the profound suchness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid tshol la thog mar ni ;
analyzed: de nyid tshol la thog mar ni ;
translated: For those who seek reality,

original: thams cad yod ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad yod ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: at first one should say that everything exists.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: yang gang dag dbang po yongs su smin pa de kho na nyid bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la /
analyzed: yang gang dag dbang po yongs su smin pa de kho na nyid bshad pa'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la /
translated: Those whose faculties are fully ripened and who are fortunate enough to be taught suchness

original: de nyid cig car bstan pa'i sgo nas de dag gi sems kyi rgyud rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: de nyid cig car bstan pa'i sgo nas de dag gi sems kyi rgyud rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: are purified of their mindstreams through being taught suchness all at once.

original: chos rnams la ni gnas bcas shing //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni gnas bcas shing //
translated: Having established them in the teachings,

original: rnal 'byor can la yang dag bstan //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can la yang dag bstan //
translated: It is taught to those who are yogis.

original: rgyal ba'i sras la 'di bstan gyi //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras la 'di bstan gyi //
translated: It is taught to the sons of the victors,

original: byis pa rnams la bshad ma yin //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la bshad ma yin //
translated: but not to the childish.üîΩThis is as taught above.

original: zhes sngar bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: zhes sngar bstan pa 'am /
translated: Or as it is said:

original: don rnams rtogs shing chags med la //
analyzed: don rnams rtogs shing chags med la //
translated: Having understood the meaning and being free from attachment,

original: phyis ni rnam par dben pa nyid //
analyzed: phyis ni rnam par dben pa nyid //
translated: later, there is complete seclusion.

original: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i rgyud ni sngar bstan pa ltar sna tshogs su snang ba rang rang gi sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i rgyud ni sngar bstan pa ltar sna tshogs su snang ba rang rang gi sems kyi ngo bor gyur pa ste /
translated: The continuum of appearances of one's own mind, as previously taught, is the various appearances becoming the essence of one's own mind.

original: sems kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por gyur pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems kyi de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por gyur pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to purify the suchness of the mind, which is naturally pure, the essence of the tathƒÅgatas,

original: bshad pa'i bye brag ji ltar 'byung //
analyzed: bshad pa'i bye brag ji ltar 'byung //
translated: how do the various explanations arise?

original: zhes gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: cig car ram rim gyis 'jug ces pa ni zab mo cig car ram rim gyis zhes pa ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: cig car ram rim gyis 'jug ces pa ni zab mo cig car ram rim gyis zhes pa ni shes par zad do //
translated: Engaging all at once or gradually means either engaging the profound all at once or gradually, and that is all that needs to be understood.

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste //
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is like this.

original: me long gi nang du zhes pa la sogs pas ni snga ma ltar gdul bya'i khyad par la cig car bshad pa 'jug pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: me long gi nang du zhes pa la sogs pas ni snga ma ltar gdul bya'i khyad par la cig car bshad pa 'jug pa'i tshul bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning in the mirror shows how the teaching is given all at once to the particular disciples as described above.

original: gzugs su snang ba @104b du ma'i rkyen cig car tshogs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba @104b du ma'i rkyen cig car tshogs pa na //
translated: When the conditions for the appearance of many forms come together all at once,

original: de ltar snang bar bya'o snyam pa'i rtog pa med kyang cig car snang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang bar bya'o snyam pa'i rtog pa med kyang cig car snang zhes pa'o //
translated: they appear all at once means that even though there is no thought I will appear in that way, they appear all at once.

original: sems can thams cad kyi zhes pa ni dbang po yongs su smin pa thams cad de //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi zhes pa ni dbang po yongs su smin pa thams cad de //
translated: All sentient beings refers to all those whose faculties are fully ripened.

original: rnam par mi rtog cing gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba med pa so so rang rig pa'i spyod yul rnams cig car zab mo bstan pa'i sgo nas spyod ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog cing gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba med pa so so rang rig pa'i spyod yul rnams cig car zab mo bstan pa'i sgo nas spyod ba'o //
translated: They practice all at once by means of the profound teaching, which is nonconceptual and free from the appearance of duality, and which is the domain of individual knowledge.

original: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags dang bral ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ji ltar rigs pa bzhin bag chags dang bcas nas spangs pa ste //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags dang bral ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa ji ltar rigs pa bzhin bag chags dang bcas nas spangs pa ste //
translated: Free from the latent dispositions of negative instinct means that they are free from the afflictions and so forth that are to be eliminated by the paths of seeing and cultivation, together with their latent dispositions, as is appropriate.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis spangs pa ni spangs pa'o zhes gsungs pas mthong ba'i lam thob pa yan chod kyi sbang bya spangs pa ni bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis spangs pa ni spangs pa'o zhes gsungs pas mthong ba'i lam thob pa yan chod kyi sbang bya spangs pa ni bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, that which is abandoned by the eye of the ƒÅrya‚Äôs wisdom is abandoned.‚Äù Therefore, the abandonment of the objects of abandonment from the time of attaining the path of seeing onward is abandoned together with their imprints.

original: de rnams la rgyal ba'i ye shes nyan thos la sogs pa'i bsam pa'i yul ma yin pa'i yul dang spyod yul zhes pas te /
analyzed: de rnams la rgyal ba'i ye shes nyan thos la sogs pa'i bsam pa'i yul ma yin pa'i yul dang spyod yul zhes pas te /
translated: Those are the objects and the domain of the wisdom of the victors, which are not the domain of the thoughts of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: go rims bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi don dang / kun rdzob kyi rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du de kho na nyid kyi don dang / kun rdzob kyi rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The meaning of suchness and the classification of the conventional are taught in order.

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas khyad par du sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa 'jug pa'i bye brag ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pas khyad par du sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa 'jug pa'i bye brag ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, it is thus,‚Äù and so on teaches the distinctions of the entry into the teaching of the buddhas, who are the embodiment of the three kƒÅyas.

original: de la rgyu 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: Among those, the buddha of similar cause is the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya.

original: dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid chos kyi sku'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: dbyings dang ye shes dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid chos kyi sku'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the cause of the dharmakƒÅya, which is the nature of the inseparability of the dhƒÅtu and wisdom.

original: de nyid kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyi sku ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i bdag nyid kyi sku ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that body is not of the nature of an accumulation of subtle atoms.

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas rgyu 'dra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas rgyu 'dra zhes pa'o //
translated: It is of the nature of transcendent wisdom, so it is said to be similar to its cause.

original: de ni gdul bya sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la /
analyzed: de ni gdul bya sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la /
translated: That body is for disciples who are bodhisattvas on the tenth level.

original: theg pa chen po'i don zab mo cig car bstan pa'i sgo nas yongs su smin par byas pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i don zab mo cig car bstan pa'i sgo nas yongs su smin par byas pa ste /
translated: It is the means of bringing them to full maturity through the teaching of the profound meaning of the Great Vehicle all at once.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong du rung ba dang / gnyen po ye shes skyed du rung bar byas pa ni yongs su smin pa'o zhes sa bcu'i mgon pos gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yang ji ltar dgongs pa des par 'grel pa la sogs pa dag las /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong du rung ba dang / gnyen po ye shes skyed du rung bar byas pa ni yongs su smin pa'o zhes sa bcu'i mgon pos gsungs pa'i phyir ro // de yang ji ltar dgongs pa des par 'grel pa la sogs pa dag las /
translated: The protector of the tenth level has said that full maturity is the ability to abandon counteragents and the ability to generate the wisdom that is their antidote.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs zab mo 'di bstan pa na byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes pa 'am /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs zab mo 'di bstan pa na byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri lnga stong gis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to zhes pa 'am /
translated: In the Elucidation of Intention and so forth, it is said that when this profound Dharma was taught, seventy-five thousand bodhisattvas attained the tolerance of the noncreation of things.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i yid la byed pa thob par gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa @105a * //üîΩgsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'og min gyi pho brang dang gzhal med khang na rnam grangs nyid du rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i yid la byed pa thob par gyur to zhes pa la sogs pa @105a * // gsungs pa lta bu'o // 'og min gyi pho brang dang gzhal med khang na rnam grangs nyid du rtogs pa'am /
translated: He attained the mental contemplation of a great yogi.

original: spyi dang bye brag ste gnas khyad par can de lta bur snang ba'o //
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag ste gnas khyad par can de lta bur snang ba'o //
translated: The palace and celestial mansion of Akani·π£h·π≠ha appear in the same way, either as a general or specific place.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rnal 'byor can du gzhag go zhes pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rnal 'byor can du gzhag go zhes pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe one who is established as a yogi of yoga‚Äù is as follows.

original: chags med mnyam par gzhag pa ste ;
analyzed: chags med mnyam par gzhag pa ste ;
translated: The one who is equipoised without attachment

original: mthar gyis stug por bzhugs nas su //
analyzed: mthar gyis stug por bzhugs nas su //
translated: gradually enters the thickets

original: rnam par sangs rgyas sangs rgyas sar //
analyzed: rnam par sangs rgyas sangs rgyas sar //
translated: and is fully enlightened in the buddhafield.

original: chos kyi dbang por bdag gyur te //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang por bdag gyur te //
translated: I become the lord of the Dharma

original: stug po'i dkyil na sras dang bcas //
analyzed: stug po'i dkyil na sras dang bcas //
translated: in the thickets together with my children,

original: chos kyi bdag por rnam par mdzes //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las bshad pa ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag por rnam par mdzes // zhes pa la sogs pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las bshad pa ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sam /
translated: beautiful as the lord of the Dharma.

original: de'i sras su gyur pa'i sa la rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sras su gyur pa'i sa la rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: As explained in the Ornament of the GandaÃÑlyadaÃÑna-suÃÑtra, the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya buddha or his children are established in the stage.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa so so rang rig pa'i ye shes ni go rims bzhin du gzugs sku gnyis su snang bas sems can gyi don byed par nus pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa so so rang rig pa'i ye shes ni go rims bzhin du gzugs sku gnyis su snang bas sems can gyi don byed par nus pa dang /
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, endowed with knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One‚Äù and so forth explains the appearance of the two form bodies from the wisdom of individual self-awareness, which is included in the path that is the natural outflow of the Buddhahood of the nature body.

original: mtha' gnyis su lta ba thams cad ci car rnam par spangs pa'i sog nas mdzes shing brgyan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su lta ba thams cad ci car rnam par spangs pa'i sog nas mdzes shing brgyan par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is beautiful and adorned with the complete abandonment of all views of the two extremes.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid dang 'dra bar byung ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas kyi bshad pa'i 'jug pa'i tshul gsal bar ston te /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid dang 'dra bar byung ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas kyi bshad pa'i 'jug pa'i tshul gsal bar ston te /
translated: Moreover, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, endowed with knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One‚Äù and so forth clearly teaches the mode of engagement of the explanation of the Buddha of the enjoyment body, which arises similar to the essence of the Buddhahood of the nature body, the ultimate reality.

original: de'i don ni yang dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la /
analyzed: de'i don ni yang dag pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: For bodhisattvas who have entered the true grounds,

original: rang bzhin gsum rnam par phye ste phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum rnam par phye ste phyin ci ma log par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The three natures are distinguished and taught without error.

original: de la 'dir gzhung gi don ni 'dra bar byung ba'i sangs rgyas ni ston te zhes 'og tu 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir gzhung gi don ni 'dra bar byung ba'i sangs rgyas ni ston te zhes 'og tu 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the text is that the Buddha, who has arisen in a similar way, is taught. This is connected below.

original: tshul ji ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar ston zhe na /
translated: In what way is he taught?

original: sgyu ma'i yan lag ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i yan lag ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúthrough the branches of illusion,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i rkyen gyi yan lag mang pos bsdus pa'i skyes bu yang dag par skyes bu'i bdag nyid ma yin pa sna tshogs la /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i sgyu ma'i rkyen gyi yan lag mang pos bsdus pa'i skyes bu yang dag par skyes bu'i bdag nyid ma yin pa sna tshogs la /
translated: Just as a person who is not a real person is gathered from many branches of illusory conditions, such as grass and wood,

original: ltad mo'i skyes bo rnams de'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: ltad mo'i skyes bo rnams de'i bdag nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: the audience of spectators manifestly cling to his nature.

original: bdag nyid ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is he not a real person?

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: He says ‚Äúbecause of non-apprehension,‚Äù

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i blo'i ngo na de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i blo'i ngo na de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: because he is not apprehended in that way in the perspective of an unmistaken mind.

original: de bzhin du rang @105b dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du gtogs pa'i chos thams cad brtags pa'i rang bzhin la dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /üîΩde 'dra ba'i zhen bas dngos su sgro btags pa'am //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang @105b dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du gtogs pa'i chos thams cad brtags pa'i rang bzhin la dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste / de 'dra ba'i zhen bas dngos su sgro btags pa'am //
translated: Likewise, all phenomena belonging to the characteristics of the individual and general are taught to arise from the cause of the adherence to entities in the nature of the imagined.

original: brtags pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba'o zhes ston to //
translated: Such adherence is either directly superimposed or appears in that way by the power of imagination.

original: mngon par zhen pa de nyid gang las byung zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa de nyid gang las byung zhe na /
translated: From what does that adherence arise?

original: rang gi sems snang ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩde 'dra ba'i bag chags rgyu'i nyid dam /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste / de 'dra ba'i bag chags rgyu'i nyid dam /
translated: [The root text] says, ‚Äúfrom the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i skad cig ma dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i skad cig ma dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: Such habitual tendencies are the cause or are connected to the moment of adherence.

original: de dag gi dbang gis byang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis byang zhes pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthe power of those.‚Äù

original: de lta na brtags pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar byung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na brtags pa'i rang bzhin ji ltar byung zhe na /
translated: In that case, how does the imagined nature arise?

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [The root text] says, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir rnam grangs kyis na kun du brtags pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam grangs kyis na kun du brtags pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Here, by way of enumeration, the imagined also becomes the dependent.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba ni de lta rtogs par byed pa'i blo nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba ni de lta rtogs par byed pa'i blo nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: The appearance of conceptualization is the nature of the mind that realizes it.

original: de yang blo snga ma'am bag chags kyis gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang blo snga ma'am bag chags kyis gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is dependent on the former mind or habitual tendencies.

original: gal te rtog pa'i snang ba blo dang mi mthun par snang ba blo'i bdag nyid du bden na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa'i snang ba blo dang mi mthun par snang ba blo'i bdag nyid du bden na /
translated: If the appearance of conceptualization, which appears contrary to the mind, were truly the nature of the mind,

original: sngar shes pa la snang ba bden na snang ba dang mthun pa nyid du bden la /
analyzed: sngar shes pa la snang ba bden na snang ba dang mthun pa nyid du bden la /
translated: then it would be truly existent in accordance with the appearance in the prior consciousness.

original: snang gzhan du snang ba la bden gzhan du bden pa ni mi 'thad do zhes pa la sogs pa bshad pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: snang gzhan du snang ba la bden gzhan du bden pa ni mi 'thad do zhes pa la sogs pa bshad pa dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: It is untenable that what appears as one thing is truly existent in another way.

original: skyon med de rnam par rtog pa la gzugs la sogs par snang ba dang / snag ba de nyid la phyi rol lam dngos po'i bdag nyid du zhen cing sgro btags pa ni mi 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: skyon med de rnam par rtog pa la gzugs la sogs par snang ba dang / snag ba de nyid la phyi rol lam dngos po'i bdag nyid du zhen cing sgro btags pa ni mi 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: This is not a fault, because the appearance of form and so on to conceptual consciousness and the attachment to and superimposition of that appearance as external or the nature of an entity are not similar.

original: ji ltar de 'dra ba'i snang ba phyi rol lam dngo po'i ngo bo don dam pas dben pa nyid du rtogs pa rnams yang /
analyzed: ji ltar de 'dra ba'i snang ba phyi rol lam dngo po'i ngo bo don dam pas dben pa nyid du rtogs pa rnams yang /
translated: How is it that those who have realized that such appearances are empty of external objects or of an ultimate nature

original: de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba mi 'gal te /
translated: do not contradict the appearance of such things?

original: dper na rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pas dben pa nyid du tshad mas rtogs pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: dper na rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pas dben pa nyid du tshad mas rtogs pa rnams la yang /
translated: For example, even though one has realized by means of valid cognition that things are empty of permanence, a self, and so forth,

original: de ltar brjod pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba mi 'gal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis de lta bu'i rnam par snang ba mi 'gal ba bzhin no //
translated: this does not contradict the appearance of such things due to the power of expressions and so forth.

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi'i rnam par snang pa ni de ltar snang ba'i rtog pa'i blo nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa'i spyi'i rnam par snang pa ni de ltar snang ba'i rtog pa'i blo nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of the general aspects of forms and so forth is the mind that conceives of them as such.

original: de las tha dad pa'i rtog pa ni gnas skabs der grub pa med cing /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i rtog pa ni gnas skabs der grub pa med cing /
translated: Apart from that, there is no conception that exists at that time.

original: rtog pa las tha dad pa'am dngos po med pa'i snang ba'ang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rtog pa las tha dad pa'am dngos po med pa'i snang ba'ang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also not tenable that an appearance that is different from or not different from a conception exists.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar gsal ba sems kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pas sems nyid yin la /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar gsal ba sems kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pas sems nyid yin la /
translated: As was explained earlier, since clarity is related to the characteristic of the mind, it is the mind itself.

original: rtog pa de nyid las gzhan pa'i sems su yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa de nyid las gzhan pa'i sems su yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that the mind is different from that conception.

original: @106a * // de'i phyir de ltar snang ba ni rtog pa'i sems dang mi mthun par snang ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: @106a * // de'i phyir de ltar snang ba ni rtog pa'i sems dang mi mthun par snang ba ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of that is not an appearance that is incompatible with the mind of conception.

original: rtog pa'i sems nyid du bden pa la 'gal ba med ces pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i sems nyid du bden pa la 'gal ba med ces pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in maintaining that the mind of conception is real.

original: yang gcig tu dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa nang nyid du nyams su myong ba'i blo dang / mi mthun par snang mod kyi de 'dra ba'i blo'i bdag nyid du bden par yang mi 'dod pas skyo na med do //
analyzed: yang gcig tu dga' ba dang yongs su gdung ba la sogs pa nang nyid du nyams su myong ba'i blo dang / mi mthun par snang mod kyi de 'dra ba'i blo'i bdag nyid du bden par yang mi 'dod pas skyo na med do //
translated: Moreover, although the mind that experiences pleasure, pain, and so on internally appears to be incompatible with the mind that conceives external objects, we do not assert that the mind that experiences pleasure, pain, and so on is real in the way that it conceives itself to be.üîΩTherefore, we are not vulnerable to the fault of contradiction.

original: rtog pa'i snang ba de nyid la phyi rol dang dngos po'i ngo bo yang dag par sgro btags pa ni de bzhin du bden pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rtog pa'i snang ba de nyid la phyi rol dang dngos po'i ngo bo yang dag par sgro btags pa ni de bzhin du bden pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The appearance of conception that is the superimposition of external objects and the nature of things is not real in that way.

original: de las gzhan shes pa'i dngos por kyang bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan shes pa'i dngos por kyang bden pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not real as a thing that is consciousness, which is different from that.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba ni kun du brtags pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba ni kun du brtags pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, such is said to be imaginary.

original: yang rnam rtog gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ni /
analyzed: yang rnam rtog gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba ni /
translated: Also, the appearance of the conceptualization in the aspect of form, etc.

original: rtog pa'i gzung ba yin pas kun brtags pa zhes kyang bya la //
analyzed: rtog pa'i gzung ba yin pas kun brtags pa zhes kyang bya la //
translated: is the apprehended object of the conceptualization and is therefore called the imagined.

original: sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs 'ga' zhig nas gzhan gyi dbang du yang 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar rnam grangs 'ga' zhig nas gzhan gyi dbang du yang 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: And, as previously explained, it is the dependent in some contexts.

original: / gzhan gyi dbang de nyid sgro btags pa'i ngo bos stong zhing myong ba ma 'gags pa'i bdag nyid rig pa dang stong ba zung du 'jug pa'i don ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs yul phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa zhes kyang bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du dngos su rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yang /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang de nyid sgro btags pa'i ngo bos stong zhing myong ba ma 'gags pa'i bdag nyid rig pa dang stong ba zung du 'jug pa'i don ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs yul phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa zhes kyang bya'o // de bzhin du dngos su rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba yang /
translated: That very dependent is empty of the nature of the superimposition and is the meaning of the union of awareness and emptiness, the nature of unceasing experience, and is also called the perfect, the unmistaken objective of purification.üîΩSimilarly, the appearance in the aspect of form, etc., in the consciousness that is actually without conceptualization,

original: de ltar snang ba nyid mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pas shes pa dang mi mthun par snang ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba nyid mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pas shes pa dang mi mthun par snang ba ma yin zhing //
translated: is the appearance as form, etc., in the consciousness that is actually without conceptualization, and is therefore not an appearance that is not in accord with consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa nyid du bden cing de yang sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid do /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa nyid du bden cing de yang sgyu ma lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid do /
translated: Therefore, consciousness itself is true, and it is also the illusion-like dependent.

original: 'dir rtog ba med pa'i 'khrul pa zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba'i yul kun du brtags pa 'am //
analyzed: 'dir rtog ba med pa'i 'khrul pa zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba'i yul kun du brtags pa 'am //
translated: Here, is the appearance of non-conceptual error, such as the appearance of two moons, an imagined object?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi dbang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi dbang yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it the dependent?

original: de la phyi rol gnyis kyi dngos por brtags pa ni mi bden pa'i don blo'i brtags pas kun du brtags pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: de la phyi rol gnyis kyi dngos por brtags pa ni mi bden pa'i don blo'i brtags pas kun du brtags pa zhes bya la /
translated: In that regard, the imagination of a real external thing is called the imagined because it is imagined by the mind that has an unreal object.

original: de 'dra ba'i khyad par gang du yang sgro btags pa med cing /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i khyad par gang du yang sgro btags pa med cing /
translated: There is no superimposition of such a distinction anywhere.

original: snang ba tsam ni blo nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pas gzhan gyi dbang zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam ni blo nyid kyi bdag nyid yin pas gzhan gyi dbang zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since the mere appearance is the nature of the mind itself, it is also called the dependent.

original: gzhan yang ma brtags pa'i snang ba cam la kun tu brtags zhas pa'i sgra'i don mi 'thad pas dngos su ni kun du brtags pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma brtags pa'i snang ba cam la kun tu brtags zhas pa'i sgra'i don mi 'thad pas dngos su ni kun du brtags pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since the mere appearance that is not examined is not tenable as the verbal meaning of imagined, it is not actually called imagined.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang gzhin @106b la mngon par zhen pa las byung zhes pa ni gzhan dbang stong par ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rang gzhin @106b la mngon par zhen pa las byung zhes pa ni gzhan dbang stong par ma rtogs shing /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarises from the attachment to the nature of the dependent‚Äù means that one has not realized the dependent nature to be empty.

original: dngos por zhen pas gsos btab nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: dngos por zhen pas gsos btab nas byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase arises from the attachment to the nature of the other-dependent means that it arises from the activation of the attachment to things because of not understanding the emptiness of the other-dependent.

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste zhes pa las sogs pas ni snga ma'i don nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste zhes pa las sogs pas ni snga ma'i don nyid rgyas par 'chad pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is like this, Mahamati, and so forth, explains the meaning of the above passage in greater detail.

original: mir ldan zhes pa ni mi'i rtsol ba dang po /
analyzed: mir ldan zhes pa ni mi'i rtsol ba dang po /
translated: The phrase endowed with a human body refers to human effort.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid rnam par rtog pa'i sems nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid rnam par rtog pa'i sems nyid yin zhing /
translated: The imagined nature is the mind itself, which is conceptual.

original: de nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyi rtog pa la snang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin gyi rtog pa la snang zhes pa'o //
translated: That itself appears to the conceptual consciousness that is the nature of the other-dependent.

original: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes par zad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: blo gros chen po chos nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pas chos kyi sku spros pa dang bral ba ni zhal dang tshems la sogs pa'i sgros su snang zhing ngag gi rig byed du snang ba'i sgo nas chos ston pa ni mi 'thad la 'on kyang de'i byin
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pas chos kyi sku spros pa dang bral ba ni zhal dang tshems la sogs pa'i sgros su snang zhing ngag gi rig byed du snang ba'i sgo nas chos ston pa ni mi 'thad la 'on kyang de'i byin
translated: The phrase the dharmata, Mahamati, and so forth, explains that the dharmakaya, which is free from elaborations, is not tenable as a teacher of the dharma that appears in the form of a face, teeth, and so on and that appears as the expression of speech.

original: gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de bzhin nyid kyi rtog pa 'char bar byed pa'i sgo nas ston zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de bzhin nyid kyi rtog pa 'char bar byed pa'i sgo nas ston zhes bya'o //
translated: The waves of suchness teach the bodhisattvas by causing the realization of suchness to arise.

original: blo gros chen po 'phrul bas sbrul zhes pa la sogs pa ni sbrul ba'i sku yis bshad pa'i tshul ston to //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'phrul bas sbrul zhes pa la sogs pa ni sbrul ba'i sku yis bshad pa'i tshul ston to //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the emanation body teaches by means of the way of teaching with emanation bodies.

original: de'i gdul bya ni sems can sna tshogs pa nyid yin pas theg pa sna chogs pa nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gdul bya ni sems can sna tshogs pa nyid yin pas theg pa sna chogs pa nyid ston pa ste /
translated: Since the disciples of that body are various kinds of sentient beings, it teaches various kinds of vehicles.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As will be shown below:

original: lha yi theg dang tshangs pa'i theg //üîΩces pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lha yi theg dang tshangs pa'i theg // ces pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: The vehicle of gods and the vehicle of BrahmƒÅ.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon ye shes dbal bzang pos rgyu dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas zhes pa sbrul ba'i sku nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon ye shes dbal bzang pos rgyu dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas zhes pa sbrul ba'i sku nyid de /
translated: For that very reason, the master J√±ƒÅnapƒÅda‚Äôs explanation that the Buddha is similar to the cause is the emanation body.

original: de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten pas rgyu de dang 'dra ba mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'o zhes 'chad pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la brten pas rgyu de dang 'dra ba mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba'o zhes 'chad pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: Since that body is based on the enjoyment body, it appears in the form of the major and minor marks that are similar to the cause is not correct.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas kyi bshad pa ni sngar bstan ba ltar gdul bya khyad par can la theg pa chen po'i don rang bzhin gsum gyi de kho na nyid yin par bstan la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas kyi bshad pa ni sngar bstan ba ltar gdul bya khyad par can la theg pa chen po'i don rang bzhin gsum gyi de kho na nyid yin par bstan la /
translated: The explanation of the Buddha as similar to the cause is as previously explained, that is, the meaning of the Great Vehicle is taught to special disciples as the reality of the three natures.

original: sbrul ba'i sku'i bshad pa ni theg pa sna tshogs pa nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbrul ba'i sku'i bshad pa ni theg pa sna tshogs pa nyid du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of the Buddha as the emanation body is because he teaches the variety of vehicles.

original: de la sbyin pa ni lus dang longs spyod la sogs pa gtong ba'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni lus dang longs spyod la sogs pa gtong ba'i sems pa'o //
translated: Generosity is the intention to give away one's body, possessions and so on.

original: bsam gtan ni dge ba rtse gcig pa ste dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni dge ba rtse gcig pa ste dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa yang yin no //
translated: Concentration is the one pointed virtuous mind, which is also mundane such as the first and second absorptions and so on.

original: tshul khrims ni sgo gsum gyi spyod pa ngan pa spong ba'i sems pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sgo gsum gyi spyod pa ngan pa spong ba'i sems pa'o //
translated: Ethical discipline is the intention to abandon negative action of the three doors.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /üîΩnyan thos la sogs @107a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin te / nyan thos la sogs @107a * //
translated: Meditative concentration is the concentration of the three doors of liberation and so on,

original: pa rnams dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: pa rnams dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: which is shared in common with sravakas and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa ni nang gzugs can gyi 'du shes kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni nang gzugs can gyi 'du shes kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Liberation is included in the eight aspects of the view of external forms with the internal ideation of a form and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
translated: The characteristics of the engagement of consciousness and so on are as previously explained.

original: mu stegs can gyi lta ba bas zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni zhi ba pa la sogs pas phyi'i don gzugs la sogs pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lta ba bas zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni zhi ba pa la sogs pas phyi'i don gzugs la sogs pa ni med kyi /
translated: The meaning of the tƒ´rthika view and so on is that the ≈örƒÅvakas and so on assert that external objects such as form do not exist.

original: bdag rig pa gnyis su med pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag rig pa gnyis su med pa yin la /
translated: The self is nondual awareness.

original: bdag de nyid thar bar bya ba'i don du gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nam /
analyzed: bdag de nyid thar bar bya ba'i don du gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nam /
translated: For the purpose of liberating that self, they cultivate the formless meditative absorptions or the meditative concentrations.

original: bsam gtan bsgom par 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par de dag gi don du bdag gam gang zag la sogs pa yod cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgom par 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun par de dag gi don du bdag gam gang zag la sogs pa yod cing /
translated: In accordance with their wishes, they assert the existence of a self, a person, and so on for their sake.

original: de rnams thar pa'i thabs bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa yang ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams thar pa'i thabs bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa yang ston zhes pa'o //
translated: They also teach the stages of the meditative concentrations and the formless meditative absorptions as the means of liberating them.

original: blo gros chen po chos nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pas chos kyi sku yis bstan pa'i tshul nyid gsal bar 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pas chos kyi sku yis bstan pa'i tshul nyid gsal bar 'chad pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the dharmatƒÅ buddha‚Äù clearly explains the mode of teaching of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i yul ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not an object of the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i yul las log pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i tshad ma'i yul las log pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the domain of conventional valid knowledge.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i don nyid nges pa'i don mthar thug pa nyid yin pas de la brtson par bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa'i don nyid nges pa'i don mthar thug pa nyid yin pas de la brtson par bya'o zhes gdams pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, moreover‚Äù teaches that since the meaning taught by the dharmatƒÅ buddha is the ultimate definitive meaning, one should strive in that.

original: 'di rnams kyang //üîΩsangs rgyas rnam pa du ru brjod //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang // sangs rgyas rnam pa du ru brjod //
translated: These [passages]

original: ces pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa'i lan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
