translated: are also to be applied as the answer to the question, ‚ÄúHow many kinds of buddhas are there?‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, moreover‚Äù

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa bshad pa'i tshul rnams par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa bshad pa'i tshul rnams par dbye ba ste /
translated: is the classification of the way of explaining the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle.

original: rang sangs rgyas la ni sde snod kyi tshul bshad pa de las tha dad pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la ni sde snod kyi tshul bshad pa de las tha dad pa med ces pa'o //
translated: It says that there is no difference in the way of explaining the pi·π≠akas for the pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di rnams kyi don yang 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa las skyo zhing yid 'byung bas de dag rnam par zad par 'gyur ba'i lam bsgoms pa'i dbang gis kun 'byung bzad pa dang sdug bsngal gyi skye ba
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi don yang 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa las skyo zhing yid 'byung bas de dag rnam par zad par 'gyur ba'i lam bsgoms pa'i dbang gis kun 'byung bzad pa dang sdug bsngal gyi skye ba
translated: The meaning of these is as follows.

original: med pa'i ye shes 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byas te /
analyzed: med pa'i ye shes 'gog pa'i bden pa mngon du byas te /
translated: Noble listeners and solitary realizers, through their disenchantment with and disillusionment with the truths of suffering and of the origin, by the power of their meditation on the path that brings about the exhaustion of those two, they put an end to the origin and they actualize the truth of cessation, the gnosis of the nonarising of suffering.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yun ring du gnas pa ni de'i so sor rang gis rig pa'i khyad par yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yun ring du gnas pa ni de'i so sor rang gis rig pa'i khyad par yin la /
translated: They remain for a long time in the uncontaminated expanse, the nonconceptual concentration, which is their specific individual gnosis.

original: gzhan yang lam gyis bsdus pa'i mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'gog @107b ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lam gyis bsdus pa'i mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'gog @107b ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: And the nonconceptual concentration included in the path and the absorption of cessation should be understood in the same way.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyi'i tshul du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyi'i tshul du shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, these should be understood in general by bodhisattvas.

original: ji lta bzhin du mngon du bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji lta bzhin du mngon du bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not actualized as they are.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:üîΩThe skilled bodhisattvas train in all the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas

original: byang chub sems mkhas nyan thos yon tan gang dag dang // de bzhin rang rgyal yon tan kun la slob byed cing //
analyzed: byang chub sems mkhas nyan thos yon tan gang dag dang // de bzhin rang rgyal yon tan kun la slob byed cing //
translated: and likewise in all the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag de la mi gnas 'dod pa mi skye ste //
analyzed: de dag de la mi gnas 'dod pa mi skye ste //
translated: They do not dwell in them and do not give rise to desire.

original: 'di ni bdag gi bslab bya yin snyam de phyir slob //üîΩces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi bslab bya yin snyam de phyir slob // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúThis is my training,‚Äù they train.

original: gzhan yang phung po la sogs pa'i chos dbang phyug la sogs pas ma byas shing /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po la sogs pa'i chos dbang phyug la sogs pas ma byas shing /
translated: Moreover, the dharmas of the aggregates and so on are not created by ƒ™≈õvara and so forth.

original: rang rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyis skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba ni rigs pa dang lung shin tu gsal ba'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rang gi rgyu dang rkyen gyis skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba ni rigs pa dang lung shin tu gsal ba'i sgo nas grub pa'i phyir /
translated: They arise from the succession of one instant to the next through their own causes and conditions. This is established through very clear reasoning and scripture.

original: dngos po'i ngo bor yod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bor yod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they exist as the nature of entities.

original: zhes chos kyi bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: zhes chos kyi bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: This is the clinging to the self of phenomena.

original: de ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: This is the clinging to the nature of the conception of entities by ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de ltar shes nas spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de ltar shes nas spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas, having understood this, should abandon it.üîΩHere, the meaning of the words is taught in terms of the truth of suffering:üîΩThere is no self that is the essence of a person,

original: 'dir tshig gi don ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te bdag gi pas ston pa dang / bdag rang gi ngo bor gyur pa med pa dang / skye ba dang rgas pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal brgyad dang 'brel ba 'am /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te bdag gi pas ston pa dang / bdag rang gi ngo bor gyur pa med pa dang / skye ba dang rgas pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal brgyad dang 'brel ba 'am /
translated: and it is related to the eight sufferings of birth, aging, and so on,

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i don gyis mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i don gyis mi rtag pa'o //
translated: or it is impermanent in the sense of being produced and disintegrating.

original: de 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The truth of origin is the cause of such suffering.

original: rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: It has the aspects of cause, origin, strong generation, and condition.

original: de 'dra ba'i bden pa gnyis la skyo ba dang yid 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bden pa gnyis la skyo ba dang yid 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: One should be disenchanted and weary of such a twofold truth.

original: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin rgyun chad pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa phyi rol pa rnam par 'jig pa med ces pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin rgyun chad pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa phyi rol pa rnam par 'jig pa med ces pa ste /
translated: destroyed by their general and specific characteristics.üîΩWhen the continuum of the object, which has the nature of arising andüîΩceasing in the non-equipoised state, is severed, one abides in the nature of

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul skye zhing 'jig pa'i bdag nyid rgyun chad nas zhi bar gnas pa'i 'gog pa'i rang bzhin mngon du byas nas gnas zhes pa'o //üîΩde nyid kyi dus na bsam gtan la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs kyi yul skye zhing 'jig pa'i bdag nyid rgyun chad nas zhi bar gnas pa'i 'gog pa'i rang bzhin mngon du byas nas gnas zhes pa'o // de nyid kyi dus na bsam gtan la sogs pa la /
translated: cessation, which is peace.üîΩAt that time, one is free from the conceptual elaborations of the

original: 'di ltar rnam par gzhag ces pa la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par gzhag ces pa la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'am /
translated: concentrations and so on, such as ‚ÄúI am abiding in this way.‚Äù

original: yang na mnyam par @108a * //
analyzed: yang na mnyam par @108a * //
translated: Or, one isüîΩequipoised in the concentration of the absence of conceptual elaboration.

original: bzhag pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa dang /
analyzed: bzhag pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa dang /
translated: They have attained the meditative concentrations, liberations, and meditative absorptions, and have realized the path of seeing and so forth. They have actualized the results of stream enterer and so forth, and have purified the meditative absorption of cessation and so forth.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: They are liberated from both aspects.

original: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
translated: They have eliminated the obscurations of affliction through wisdom and have eliminated the obscurations of meditative absorption through meditative concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa rgyan dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa rgyan dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are arhats who possess the qualities of supernormal powers and so forth, and who are adorned with these qualities.

original: bag chags bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsgyur ba'i 'chi 'pho ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: bag chags bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bsgyur ba'i 'chi 'pho ba dang bral ba /
translated: They are free from the transmigration of death and rebirth that is due to the inconceivable habitual tendencies.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i bde ba la gnas pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi be ba la gnas pa de srid du skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i bde ba la gnas pa lhag par rtogs par 'gyur zhes pa ni de 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi be ba la gnas pa de srid du skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba med pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the bliss of the noble individual intuitive awareness, one realizes the superior. This means that as long as one abides in that kind of samadhi, there is no birth and death.

original: yang na sems can gyi don du de 'dra ba ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la mnga' ba de lta bu ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can gyi don du de 'dra ba ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la mnga' ba de lta bu ma thob pa'o //
translated: Or else, for the sake of sentient beings, one manifests that kind of mastery of the tathagatas and bodhisattvas, but one has not attained it.

original: bag chags zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba'i bag chags rnam par 'gyur ba la bya'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bag chags dang bral ba ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: bag chags zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'chi 'pho ba'i bag chags rnam par 'gyur ba la bya'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bag chags dang bral ba ni ma yin zhing /
translated: The term habitual tendencies refers to the habitual tendencies of birth and death, which are transformations, but it does not mean being free of the habitual tendencies of the afflictions and so on.

original: 'dra ba'i 'chi 'pho ba dang yang gtan du bral ba ma yin te /üîΩnyon mongs bag chags rnams dang ldan //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i 'chi 'pho ba dang yang gtan du bral ba ma yin te / nyon mongs bag chags rnams dang ldan //
translated: And one is not completely free of similar death and rebirth.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: As it will be taught below, one possesses the habitual tendencies of the afflictions.

original: 'dir rnam pa gcig tu na de dag gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang sbyar nas de rnams dang bral zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa gcig tu na de dag gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang sbyar nas de rnams dang bral zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, in one sense, it is taught that they are free from the manifest pride of those.

original: bdag gi smon lam ni sems bskyed pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: bdag gi smon lam ni sems bskyed pa'i yul lo //
translated: My aspiration is the object of the generation of the thought.

original: rigs pa dang zhes pa ni bya ba byed pa dang / ltos pa dang chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa dang zhes pa ni bya ba byed pa dang / ltos pa dang chos nyid kyi rigs pa ste /
translated: Reasoning is the reasoning of performance of function, dependence, and reality.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang rang gi ngo bos bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang rang gi ngo bos bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the cause, effect, and nature of things.

original: lung ni bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: lung ni bden pa bzhi'i chos kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Scripture is the wheel of the Dharma of the four truths.

original: tshad ma ni 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ste /
translated: Valid cognition is the reasoning of proof of tenability.

original: phung po la sogs pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas ji lta ba bzhin du grub ces ba'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas ji lta ba bzhin du grub ces ba'o //
translated: It is the establishment by the valid cognitions of direct perception and inference of the aggregates and so forth just as they are.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba phyir bzlog ste zhes pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam du phung po la sogs pa'i chos su lta ba phyir bzlog ces ba'o /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du lta ba phyir bzlog ste zhes pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam du phung po la sogs pa'i chos su lta ba phyir bzlog ces ba'o /
translated: The view of the characteristic of the selflessness of the person is reversed means that the view of the aggregates and so forth as merely the selflessness of the person is reversed.

original: // / de ltar bshad pa 'jug pa'i @108b tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar bshad pa 'jug pa'i @108b tshul bstan nas /
translated: the reply to the questions

original: bdag dang 'jig rten cis med brjod //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten cis med brjod //
translated: What is the world? What is the self? What is said to be nonexistent?

original: rtag dang 'jig gtam ji lta bu //
analyzed: rtag dang 'jig gtam ji lta bu //
translated: What is the story of permanence and annihilation?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa dris pa'i lan du /
translated: and so forth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zab mo gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zab mo gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du ston te /
translated: teaches the profound and unique abode of the Tathagata.

original: de la dang po don gyi dri ba 'god pa ni /
analyzed: de la dang po don gyi dri ba 'god pa ni /
translated: Therein, first of all, the question is set forth:üîΩThen the Lord said to the Bodhisattva Paramarthasamudgata: Paramarthasamudgata, you should understand that the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly accomplished Buddha, for the sake of beings who are attached to the belief in a self, out of a desire to reveal to them the existence of a self in the imagined self, has said that there exists in the five grasping heaps a life-force that is nourished.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata has said that there exists a life-force that is nourished in the five grasping heaps.

original: rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad ces pa ni mdo 'di nyid dam gzhan las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa dang bdag dang / gtsang ba dang bde ba'i rang bzhin nyan thos la sogs pa'i bsam pa'i yul las 'das pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab par bshad ces pa ni mdo 'di nyid dam gzhan las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa dang bdag dang / gtsang ba dang bde ba'i rang bzhin nyan thos la sogs pa'i bsam pa'i yul las 'das pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement permanence is taught to be inconceivable means that in this very sutra or in other sutras, the Tathagata-garbha is taught to be permanent, to have the nature of self, purity, and bliss, and to transcend the domain of thought of sravakas and so forth.

original: de bzhin du mu stegs byed dag kyang rnam gyur thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par 'dod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du mu stegs byed dag kyang rnam gyur thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa gtso bo'i rang bzhin rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par 'dod de /
translated: Likewise, the tƒ´rthikas assert that the nature of the primal matter is permanent and inconceivable as the cause of all transformations.

original: yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin mchog //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin mchog //
translated: The supreme nature of the three qualities

original: mthong ba'i lam du 'gro ma yin //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam du 'gro ma yin //
translated: is not seen on the path of seeing.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught.üîΩMoreover, the self that is the cause of enjoying objects is asserted to be permanent and inconceivable.

original: gzhan yang yul longs spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa bdag shes pa ni rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du 'dod cing gzhan yang dbang phyug 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa gnyis med par smra ba rnams grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul longs spyod pa'i rgyur gyur pa bdag shes pa ni rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du 'dod cing gzhan yang dbang phyug 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa gnyis med par smra ba rnams grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: Moreover, ƒ™≈õvara is asserted to be the cause of all migrating beings, and the nondual ≈öiva and so on are asserted to be the cause of liberation.

original: bdag rig pa gnyis su med pa ni rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du 'dod ces pa ste /
analyzed: bdag rig pa gnyis su med pa ni rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du 'dod ces pa ste /
translated: The nondual self-awareness is asserted to be permanent and inconceivable.

original: mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mtshon pa tsam du zad do //
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: de rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zab mo bstan pa 'di la khyad par ci mchis zhes don gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas zab mo bstan pa 'di la khyad par ci mchis zhes don gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between this teaching of the profound abiding reality of the TathƒÅgata and those?‚Äù

original: len gyi don ni de dag gis ther zug pa'i rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dngos bo yang dag par khas len te /
analyzed: len gyi don ni de dag gis ther zug pa'i rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dngos bo yang dag par khas len te /
translated: The meaning of the answer is: ‚ÄúThey assert a permanent, eternal self and an inconceivable entity.

original: 'on kyang de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'grub par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'grub par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not established as having such a nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag rgyu dang rkyen gyi byed pas ma bsgrubs na /
analyzed: de dag rgyu dang rkyen gyi byed pas ma bsgrubs na /
translated: If they are not established by the activity of causes and conditions,

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i don byed pa yang mi 'thad pas de 'dra ba'i dngos por mi rigs ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i don byed pa yang mi 'thad pas de 'dra ba'i dngos por mi rigs ste /
translated: it is not tenable that they function to produce effects, so it is not logical that they are such entities.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the horns of a rabbit and so on.

original: 'di'i spros pa zhib tu ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i spros pa zhib tu ni rigs pa'i bstan bcos dag las shes par bya'o //
translated: The elaborations of this should be understood in detail from the treatises on reasoning.

original: gal te de dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa yin na yang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa yin na yang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If they are produced by causes and conditions, they would become impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin zhas pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin zhas pa'o //
translated: like a vase and so on.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po nga'i zhe pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i @109a * //üîΩphyogs la mi mtshungs pa nyid du ston te /üîΩrig pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa dang / tha snyad tsam du med pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa rig pa dang stong pa bzung du 'jug pa'i dbu ma'i don ni de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid snga ma snga ma rnams la byung bas /
analyzed: blo gros chen po nga'i zhe pa la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i @109a * // phyogs la mi mtshungs pa nyid du ston te / rig pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i dngos por yod pa dang / tha snyad tsam du med pa'i mtha' gnyis spangs pa rig pa dang stong pa bzung du 'jug pa'i dbu ma'i don ni de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu'i mtshan nyid snga ma snga ma rnams la byung bas /
translated: The words in my opinion, etc., show that the statement of the Tathagata is not the same as that of others.üîΩThe meaning of the middle way, which is to be understood as the avoidance of the two extremes, is as follows:üîΩThe ultimate reality, which is the nature of the illusory knowledge, exists as a conventional designation, and does not exist as an extreme.

original: rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not totally nonexistent, because it is the nature of the cause, which is the previous state of the characteristics.

original: rgyu dang ldan zhing de 'dra ba'i chos nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan zhing de 'dra ba'i chos nyid gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called permanent, because it is endowed with a cause and does not change into another such reality.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning of the inconceivable has been taught above.

original: kun rdzob tu rig pa skad cig ma nyid du khams len pas rgyu dang ldan pa nyid mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rig pa skad cig ma nyid du khams len pas rgyu dang ldan pa nyid mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory that it is endowed with a cause, because it is the momentary knowledge that takes on the elements in the conventional.

original: skabs kyi don 'di nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di nyid la brten nas /
translated: Based on this very meaning of the context,

original: slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis rang rig pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid du 'jog pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: slob dpon ye shes dpal gyis rang rig pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid du 'jog pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The master J√±ƒÅna≈õrƒ´‚Äôs positing reflexive awareness as a dependently arisen thing is mistaken,

original: 'dir don dam pa'i dngos po'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ces smos pa med pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gog pa'i tshad ma du ma 'di nyid las bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir don dam pa'i dngos po'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ces smos pa med pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gog pa'i tshad ma du ma 'di nyid las bstan pa'i phyir ro // mya ngan las 'das pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: because here the characteristic of a cause of an ultimate thing is not mentioned, and because many valid cognitions refuting cause and effect are taught in this very text.üîΩNirvƒÅ·πáa is the cessation that is an analytical cessation.

original: 'gag pa zhes pa so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa zhes pa so sor brtags min gyi 'gog pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúCessation‚Äù is a non-analytical cessation.

original: 'dus ma byas gsum po rtag pa nyid du gzhan la grag pa dper byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gsum po rtag pa nyid du gzhan la grag pa dper byed pa'o //
translated: The three unconditioned phenomena are taken as examples of what others imagine to be permanent.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i gnas zab mo khong du chud par bya ba nyid du gdams pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas de 'dra ba'i gnas zab mo khong du chud par bya ba nyid du gdams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, . . . ‚Äù and so on advises us to understand such a profound topic.

original: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi phyogs mi 'thad pa nyid du tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ston to //
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi phyogs mi 'thad pa nyid du tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, . . . ‚Äù and so on teaches by means of another method that the position of others is untenable.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi ngo bor gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the nature of pleasure, pain, and equanimity.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rang bzhin yon tan gsum nyid du pha rol pos 'dod pa rnams ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu rkyen snga ma las byung bas mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rang bzhin yon tan gsum nyid du pha rol pos 'dod pa rnams ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu rkyen snga ma las byung bas mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: The three qualities, which the opponent asserts to be the nature of attachment, anger, and confusion, are impermanent because they arise from previous causes and conditions that have the characteristics of impermanence.

original: de bzhin du bdag rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu rig pa snga ma la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis byung bas de ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag rig pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu rig pa snga ma la sogs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis byung bas de ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the self, which is asserted to be the nature of mere awareness, is impermanent because it arises from causes and conditions, such as previous awareness, that have the characteristics of impermanence.üîΩThe self is produced by itself.

original: yang bdag gis byas zhes pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyis 'o ma nyid zho'i bdag nyid yin pas de las zho skye ba ni bdag las skye ba'o zhes 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: yang bdag gis byas zhes pa ni grangs can pa rnams kyis 'o ma nyid zho'i bdag nyid yin pas de las zho skye ba ni bdag las skye ba'o zhes 'dod pa ste /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that since milk itself is the nature of yogurt, yogurt arises from it. Thus they assert that yogurt arises from itself.

original: de yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: That is also untenable.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid grub pa ni 'bras bu yang @109b grub zin pas skye bar 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid grub pa ni 'bras bu yang @109b grub zin pas skye bar 'gal lo //
translated: The self that is the nature of the cause is already established, so it is contradictory for it to arise again.

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid ma grub pa ni nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid ma grub pa ni nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir //
translated: The self that is not the nature of the cause is empty of all ability.

original: shin tu yang 'bras bu skyed par 'gal lo //
analyzed: shin tu yang 'bras bu skyed par 'gal lo //
translated: It is utterly contradictory for it to give rise to an effect.

original: des na bdag gis byas pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye bas zhes pa ni de ltar khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid la brten nas de rtag pa'i dngos po ma yin pa nyid du phye zhing gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: des na bdag gis byas pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye bas zhes pa ni de ltar khas len pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid la brten nas de rtag pa'i dngos po ma yin pa nyid du phye zhing gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the self is distinguished by the characteristic of being a cause that is self-produced, it is distinguished and clarified as not being a permanent thing.

original: gzhan yang bdag gi rang bzhin gcig nyid la 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bu'o zhes ma 'chol ba nyid du dbye ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag gi rang bzhin gcig nyid la 'ga' zhig ni 'bras bu'o zhes ma 'chol ba nyid du dbye ba mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, it is untenable to distinguish the self, which is a single nature, as some things being effects and some things not being effects.

original: phan tshun rgyu 'bras 'chol ba nyid du 'gyur te rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu 'bras 'chol ba nyid du 'gyur te rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It would follow that cause and effect would be confused, because the reason is the same.

original: blo gros chen po de ste zhes pa la sogs pas ni de dag gi rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni don dam par rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma byas shing /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ste zhes pa la sogs pas ni de dag gi rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni don dam par rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma byas shing /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, that is to say, ‚Äù and so on explain that their permanence and inconceivability are ultimately not created by causes and conditions.üîΩSince created things do not exist in reality, the unchanging nature of phenomena like that is seen to be permanent. The intellect that infers in that way realizes that.

original: byas pa'i dngos po yang dag par med pas de 'dra ba'i chos nyid 'gyur ba med pas rtag pa nyid du mthong nas rjes su dpog pa'i blo yis de ltar rtogs pa dag snga ma nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa'i dngos po yang dag par med pas de 'dra ba'i chos nyid 'gyur ba med pas rtag pa nyid du mthong nas rjes su dpog pa'i blo yis de ltar rtogs pa dag snga ma nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: The former is explained as follows.üîΩThose who assert that are similar to our position.

original: de ltar 'dod pa ni kho bo cag gi phyogs dang mtshungs zhes pa ste /üîΩshes par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa ni kho bo cag gi phyogs dang mtshungs zhes pa ste / shes par zad do //
translated: That is all there is to it.

original: yang blo gros chen po de ste zhes pa la sogs pas na de nyid don dam par rgyu dang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po gcig tu khas len na ni de 'dra ba tshad mas bkag pas de ltar 'jog pa ni tshig tsam la brten pa'i rnam
analyzed: yang blo gros chen po de ste zhes pa la sogs pas na de nyid don dam par rgyu dang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dngos po gcig tu khas len na ni de 'dra ba tshad mas bkag pas de ltar 'jog pa ni tshig tsam la brten pa'i rnam
translated: Again, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, that is to say, ‚Äù and so on. If one asserts that ultimate reality is a thing that has causes and characteristics, since that is refuted by valid knowledge, positing it in that way is a mere word.

original: par rtog pa'i snang ba la de ltar brtags pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: par rtog pa'i snang ba la de ltar brtags pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is a mere imputation in the appearances of the conceptual thoughts that depend on words.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni skabs kyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ni skabs kyi don bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase MahƒÅmati, and so forth, is the summary of the topic.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pas na rtag zhes pa'i don ni rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i chos nyid de las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag ces pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pas na rtag zhes pa'i don ni rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa'i chos nyid de las gzhan du mi 'gyur bas rtag ces pa'o //
translated: The meaning of permanent is the reality of the union of awareness and emptiness, which is called permanent because it does not change into anything else.

original: phyi rol gyi zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs ston te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhes pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs ston te /
translated: The phrase external things, and so forth, presents the opponent's position.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i lugs kyis bdag dam pa de nyid gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas mi rtag la /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa tsam du smra ba'i lugs kyis bdag dam pa de nyid gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba'i phyi rol gyi dngos po med pas mi rtag la /
translated: The system of the Proponents of Consciousness asserts that the self is not permanent because there are no external things that can be destroyed and conquered.

original: rtag pa las rjes su dpog pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa las rjes su dpog pa ste /
translated: It is inferred from permanence.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: It is inferred that it is inconceivable because of being permanent.

original: dpog pa'i phyir rtag pa min zhes pa ni pha rol bos tshul de ltar 'dod pa ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpog pa'i phyir rtag pa min zhes pa ni pha rol bos tshul de ltar 'dod pa ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase it is not permanent because it is inferred means that the opponent's position is not correct.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po @110a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po @110a * //
translated: External things are not permanent because they are inferred.

original: med kyang rtag pa ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: med kyang rtag pa ma yin pa 'am /
translated: Even if it does not exist, it is not permanent,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba la 'gal ba med de /
translated: or it would be impermanent. There is no contradiction.

original: khyab pa nyid ma grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid ma grub ces pa'o //
translated: [The opponent] has not established the pervasion.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ngag snga ma nyid kyi don rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas ngag snga ma nyid kyi don rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The phrase MahƒÅmati, and so on, explains the meaning of the previous statement in detail.

original: gang gi ba des ni zhes pa la snga ma de 'dra ba'i don khas len pa'i gang zag des ni /
analyzed: gang gi ba des ni zhes pa la snga ma de 'dra ba'i don khas len pa'i gang zag des ni /
translated: The phrase Whoever accepts that refers to the person who accepts the previous meaning.

original: rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas lugs ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas lugs ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs shing /
translated: That person has not realized the abiding reality of permanence and inconceivability as it is,

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pas gtam byar rung ba ma yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pas gtam byar rung ba ma yin zhes pa ste /
translated: and because of being mistaken, it is said that they are not suitable to be talked to.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sdig pa'i grogs po spang bar bya //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po spang bar bya //
translated: Abandon sinful friends.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de ltar gnas zab mo gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas zab mo gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the profound abiding reality to be uncommon,

original: rigs dang theg pa la sogs pa'i bye brag spyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rigs dang theg pa la sogs pa'i bye brag spyir bstan pa ni /
translated: the general teaching on the distinctions of lineage, vehicle, and so on is as follows.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase Moreover, MahƒÅmati, and so on, is the teaching on the distinctions of lineage.

original: de la re zhig nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can dngos po'i 'du shes can rnams //
analyzed: de la re zhig nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can dngos po'i 'du shes can rnams //
translated: First, those of the Sravaka lineage and so on, who have the notion of real entities,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba'i khyad par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba'i khyad par mi shes pa ste /
translated: do not know the difference between nirvana and cyclic existence.

original: rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khor ba nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khor ba nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: The nature of nirvana is the reality tathata of cyclic existence itself,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as stated in the following:üîΩExistence and peace are the same

original: srid dang zhi ba mnyam du nyid dang / zhes pa dang / 'khor ba spangs nas gzhan du ni //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba mnyam du nyid dang / zhes pa dang / 'khor ba spangs nas gzhan du ni //
translated: and also in the following passage from the Arya-ratnamegha:

original: mya ngan 'das pa rtogs mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa rtogs mi 'gyur /
translated: Nirvana is not realized elsewhere,üîΩhaving abandoned cyclic existence.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / don de nyid 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / don de nyid 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And this meaning is also stated in the Arya-ratnakuta.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa rtogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal don dam pa'i dngos por gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa rtogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal don dam pa'i dngos por gyur pa /
translated: Moreover, the nirvana that is realized by the vehicle of the result is the ultimate reality of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pas de bzhin nyid du brtags pas 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / de 'dra ba 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bdag nyid 'ba' zhig bde bar gnas pa lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa yongs su tshol te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pas de bzhin nyid du brtags pas 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / de 'dra ba 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bdag nyid 'ba' zhig bde bar gnas pa lhag ma dang bcas pa dang lhag ma med pa yongs su tshol te /
translated: They are afraid of the suchness that is imagined by their own thoughts, and they seek out nirvana, which is the cessation of that, and a state of happiness for themselves alone, with and without remainder.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas myos pa 'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi myos pas myos pa 'am /
translated: They are intoxicated by the intoxication of samadhi,

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa dang / de nyid kyi tshe dbang po rnams kyi yul ma 'ongs pa rgyun chad ces pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa dang / de nyid kyi tshe dbang po rnams kyi yul ma 'ongs pa rgyun chad ces pa ste /
translated: or they think that in the expanse of nirvana without remainder, all conceptual thoughts are absent, and at that time, the objects of the sense faculties are interrupted.

original: yul dang yul can 'du byed kyi 'jug pa thams cad rgyun chad pas so //
analyzed: yul dang yul can 'du byed kyi 'jug pa thams cad rgyun chad pas so //
translated: Because all the engagement of compounded phenomena, the meeting of objects and subjects, is interrupted.

original: mya ngan 'da' bar rnam par rtog /
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar rnam par rtog /
translated: They imagine nirvana.

original: ces pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa la de'i 'du shes @110b su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa la de'i 'du shes @110b su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They have the idea of nirvana where there is no nirvana.

original: zhib tu ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhib tu ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained in detail below.

original: de ltar phyin ci log tu rtog gi so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kun gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / rnam par smin pa'i cha thams cad gnas gyur pa sngon du song ba sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'ba' zhig mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes rtogs par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log tu rtog gi so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes kun gzhi zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang / rnam par smin pa'i cha thams cad gnas gyur pa sngon du song ba sangs rgyas kyi sas bsdus pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'ba' zhig mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes rtogs par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, they conceive of nirvana in a distorted way. They do not realize that the nirvana that is subsumed by the stage of a buddha is the great, nonabiding nirvana, which is preceded by the transformation of the foundation consciousness with its contaminated seeds and all its aspects of maturation.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu blun po de dag 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa ni byang chub gsum gyis bsdus pa so sor nges pa'i ngo bo rnam pa gsum yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu blun po de dag 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa ni byang chub gsum gyis bsdus pa so sor nges pa'i ngo bo rnam pa gsum yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, those foolish people say that the vehicle that is the nature of the result is the three kinds of enlightenment, which are subsumed by the three kinds of definite nature.

original: de rnams thob par byed pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang /
analyzed: de rnams thob par byed pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang /
translated: They also say that the vehicle that is the nature of the path that causes one to attain those is

original: so sor nges par tha dad pa gsum du smra ba'o //
analyzed: so sor nges par tha dad pa gsum du smra ba'o //
translated: three different kinds of definite nature.

original: theg pa de rnams kyi yul yang phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / der snang ba sems tsam gyi dngos po nyid du rtog gi /
analyzed: theg pa de rnams kyi yul yang phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po dang / der snang ba sems tsam gyi dngos po nyid du rtog gi /
translated: The objects of those vehicles are things such as the aggregates, and the appearance of those as things is the mind only.

original: don dam par sems kyi ngo bor nyid kyang dmigs pa med par mi smra'o //
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi ngo bor nyid kyang dmigs pa med par mi smra'o //
translated: But ultimately, the essence of the mind itself is not said to be non-apprehensible.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i nges pa'i don gzugs la sogs par snang ba kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i nges pa'i don gzugs la sogs par snang ba kun rdzob tu sems nyid yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, they do not understand that the definitive meaning taught by the Tathagatas of the three times is that the appearance of form and so forth is the mind itself in the conventional,

original: don dam par sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du mi shes te /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid du mi shes te /
translated: and that the nature of the mind is emptiness in the ultimate.

original: de rnams sems kyi spyod yul tha dad pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa dag /'khor ba'i 'gro ba'i 'khor lor rab tu 'khor //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams sems kyi spyod yul tha dad pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa dag /'khor ba'i 'gro ba'i 'khor lor rab tu 'khor // zhes pa ste /
translated: Those who are attached to the mind as having a different domain and so forth, will continue to revolve in the wheel of transmigration.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: dngos por mngon par zhen yod na //
analyzed: dngos por mngon par zhen yod na //
translated: When there is attachment to things,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang mi bzad 'byung //
translated: desire and hatred will arise.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sngar rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: And so forth. This has been taught extensively above.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i nges pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstan pa'i nges pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, what is the definitive meaning taught by the TathƒÅgatas?

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du ston pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du ston pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching that all phenomena are not produced.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam gyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyang don dam par mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam gyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyang don dam par mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: Even consciousness-only, which is the dependent nature, is not tenable ultimately.

original: gal te de ni nyams su myong ba'i tshad mas grub pa dang / gsung rab kyi phyogs gzhan las kyang gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de ni nyams su myong ba'i tshad mas grub pa dang / gsung rab kyi phyogs gzhan las kyang gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt that established by the valid cognition of experience and isn‚Äôt it taught in other parts of the scriptures?

original: ci'i phyir de ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar ston ce na /
translated: Why is it taught in that way?

original: 'di lta ste blo gros chen po rang gi sems snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste blo gros chen po rang gi sems snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang zhes pa la /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, it is the nonexistence of things that appear to one‚Äôs mind.‚Äù

original: de'i don ni sngar bshad pa ltar /
analyzed: de'i don ni sngar bshad pa ltar /
translated: The meaning of that is as explained above.

original: de ltar snang ba shes pa gcig dang du ma'i dngos por grub pa med pa dang / tshad ma gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang bkag pas /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba shes pa gcig dang du ma'i dngos por grub pa med pa dang / tshad ma gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang bkag pas /
translated: Thus, since the appearance is not established as a single or multiple entity and is also refuted by other valid means of knowledge,

original: skye rgyu'i @111a * //üîΩdngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye rgyu'i @111a * // dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: there is no produced entity.

original: don dam par ma skyes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ma skyes zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúultimately unproduced.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang yod pa dang med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa dang med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad ni ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, because things are not produced from existence or nonexistence, all things are unproduced.

original: de la dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba ni mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la dngos po rnams rgyu med pa las skye ba ni mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: In this regard, it is not tenable that things are produced causelessly,

original: med pa nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonexistence is empty of all abilities.

original: yod pa las skye ba'i phyogs kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa las skye ba'i phyogs kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The position that things are produced from existence also has two aspects:

original: 'bras bu rang gi rang bzhin du yod pa las skye ba dang / de las gzhan gyi dngos por yod pa las so //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang gi rang bzhin du yod pa las skye ba dang / de las gzhan gyi dngos por yod pa las so //
translated: production from an existent effect that is the same as its cause, and production from an existent effect that is different from its cause.

original: de la rang gi bdag nyid las skye ba ni grangs can rnams kyi 'dod pa ste sngar bkag go //
analyzed: de la rang gi bdag nyid las skye ba ni grangs can rnams kyi 'dod pa ste sngar bkag go //
translated: In this regard, production from itself is the assertion of the Samkhyas, and it was refuted earlier.

original: gzhan las skye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Production from another also has two aspects:

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las skye ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las skye ba'o //
translated: production from a permanent cause and production from an impermanent cause.

original: rtag pa las skye bar 'dod pa ni phyi rol pa kha cig gnas dang lus dang longs spyod kyis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba thams cad dbang phyug rtag pa mthu thogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin las skye bar 'dod do //
analyzed: rtag pa las skye bar 'dod pa ni phyi rol pa kha cig gnas dang lus dang longs spyod kyis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba thams cad dbang phyug rtag pa mthu thogs pa med pa'i rang bzhin las skye bar 'dod do //
translated: Some non-Buddhists assert that all beings included in the world of environment and inhabitants arise from the permanent self, which is the nature of an omnipotent God.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
analyzed: skye ba po 'di shes pa yod min te //
translated: This creator is not conscious,

original: bdag gi bde sdug bsngal la rang dbang med //
analyzed: bdag gi bde sdug bsngal la rang dbang med //
translated: and he has no control over his own happiness and suffering.

original: dbang phyug gis kyang yang na mtho ris sam //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis kyang yang na mtho ris sam //
translated: Whether he goes to heaven or

original: g-yang sa dag tu 'gro ba kho nar nges //
analyzed: g-yang sa dag tu 'gro ba kho nar nges //
translated: to the abyss, he is certain to go.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di yang mi 'thad de //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di yang mi 'thad de //
translated: This is also untenable.

original: de lta na rtag pa dang mthu thogs pa med pa ni rang gi bdag nyid la ma tshang ba med pa dang / 'bras bu skyed pa rkyen gzhan la ltos pa mi 'thad pas de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'gro ba thams cad gcig car grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rtag pa dang mthu thogs pa med pa ni rang gi bdag nyid la ma tshang ba med pa dang / 'bras bu skyed pa rkyen gzhan la ltos pa mi 'thad pas de'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'gro ba thams cad gcig car grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the permanent and omnipotent would be complete in itself, and it would be untenable that the production of the effect depends on other conditions, so all beings that are its effects would be established simultaneously.

original: gal te rkyen la ltos pa med par ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te rkyen la ltos pa med par ma grub ste /
translated: If it is said that it is not established without depending on conditions,üîΩthen it is not permanent.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi rang rang gi las la sogs pa'i rkyen 'ga' zhig la ltos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi rang rang gi las la sogs pa'i rkyen 'ga' zhig la ltos so zhe na /
translated: It is dependent on some conditions, such as the karma of the individual transmigrating beings.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rkyen gyis dbang phyug la rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i phan pa 'ba' zhig byed na ni /
analyzed: rkyen gyis dbang phyug la rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i phan pa 'ba' zhig byed na ni /
translated: If the conditions were to benefit I≈õvara in his own nature,

original: de sngar gyi gnas skabs las gzhan du 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid du thal la /
analyzed: de sngar gyi gnas skabs las gzhan du 'gyur bas mi rtag pa nyid du thal la /
translated: then he would change from his previous state, and it would follow that he would be impermanent.

original: de 'dra ba'i phan pa mi byed na yang ltos par 'gal te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i phan pa mi byed na yang ltos par 'gal te /
translated: If he did not benefit in that way, then it would contradict his being dependent,

original: thams cad thams cad la ltos pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la ltos pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything would be dependent on everything.

original: gzhan yang rkyen ma tshang ba'i dus na dbang phyug 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyed par 'dod kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rkyen ma tshang ba'i dus na dbang phyug 'bras bu 'ga' zhig skyed par 'dod kyang /
translated: Moreover, when the conditions are incomplete, even though I≈õvara desires to create some effect,

original: mi skye bas mthu thogs pa med pa'i rang dbang can nyid nyams so //
analyzed: mi skye bas mthu thogs pa med pa'i rang dbang can nyid nyams so //
translated: since it is not created, his unimpeded power is undermined.

original: yang rkyen gzhan po de nyid dbang phyug gis bskyed par bya ba @111b yin na ni rang gis skyed pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa nyid 'gal la /
analyzed: yang rkyen gzhan po de nyid dbang phyug gis bskyed par bya ba @111b yin na ni rang gis skyed pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa nyid 'gal la /
translated: Moreover, if the other conditions are to be created by I≈õvara, it would contradict his being independent, which is the creation of his own effect.

original: ma yin na yang thams cad dbang phyug gis bskyed par bya ba nyid nyams so //
analyzed: ma yin na yang thams cad dbang phyug gis bskyed par bya ba nyid nyams so //
translated: But if it does not, then the claim that everything is created by ƒ™≈õvara is undermined.

original: gal te 'di 'bras bu skyed pa na rkyen gzhan la ltos pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'bras bu skyed pa na rkyen gzhan la ltos pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Even though ƒ™≈õvara does not rely on other conditions in order to create the effect,

original: 'bras bu rim gyis skye ba ni de nyid kyi 'dod pa'i dbang gis ta /üîΩgang zhig da ltar skyed par 'dod pa'i 'dod pa yod pa ni da ltar nyid du skye la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rim gyis skye ba ni de nyid kyi 'dod pa'i dbang gis ta / gang zhig da ltar skyed par 'dod pa'i 'dod pa yod pa ni da ltar nyid du skye la /
translated: the effect arises in sequence because of ƒ™≈õvara‚Äôs desire.üîΩThat which he desires to create in the present is created in the present.üîΩThat which he desires to create in the future, such as the world, is created in the future.

original: de 'dra ba'i 'dod pa med par de'i rjes thogs la sogs par skyed par 'dod pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur bas so zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i 'dod pa med par de'i rjes thogs la sogs par skyed par 'dod pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur bas so zhe na /
translated: That which he desires to create in the immediate aftermath of something is created in the immediate aftermath of that.

original: de ci 'dod pa dang dbang phyug gcig gam tha dad ces brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ci 'dod pa dang dbang phyug gcig gam tha dad ces brtag par bya'o //
translated: We should examine whether desire and ƒ™≈õvara are the same or different.

original: gal te gcig pa nyid yin na ni dbang phyug rtag tu gnas pa ltar 'dod pa yang gnas pas 'dod pa med pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu 'ga' zhig da ltar mi skye ba 'gal lo //
analyzed: gal te gcig pa nyid yin na ni dbang phyug rtag tu gnas pa ltar 'dod pa yang gnas pas 'dod pa med pa'i dbang gis 'bras bu 'ga' zhig da ltar mi skye ba 'gal lo //
translated: If they are the same, then just as ƒ™≈õvara remains permanent, desire would also remain. Therefore it would be contradictory for any effect not to be created in the present due to the absence of desire.

original: tha dad na yang 'bras bu skye ba rang las gzhan du gyur pa'i 'dod pa la rag las pas rang dbang can mthu thogs pa med pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: tha dad na yang 'bras bu skye ba rang las gzhan du gyur pa'i 'dod pa la rag las pas rang dbang can mthu thogs pa med pa nyid nyams so //
translated: If they are different, then the effect, which is dependent on the desire of another, which is different from itself, is not autonomous and powerful.

original: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i 'dod pa dbang phyug gis skyed na yang /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i 'dod pa dbang phyug gis skyed na yang /
translated: Moreover, if the desire of such an ƒ™≈õvara generates the effect,

original: rang gis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu la ltos nas 'bras bu gzhan skyed pa 'gal la /
analyzed: rang gis bskyed pa'i 'bras bu la ltos nas 'bras bu gzhan skyed pa 'gal la /
translated: then it is contradictory for him to generate another effect in dependence on the effect that he himself has generated.

original: ma skyed na yang thams cad dbang phyug gis bskyed pa nyid nyams so //üîΩgzhan yang 'gro ba gang zhig dbang phyug mnyes pa'i las byed pa dang / de la gnod par 'gyur zhing ma dad pa'i las byed pa'i las de dag dbang phyug la rag las na ni /
analyzed: ma skyed na yang thams cad dbang phyug gis bskyed pa nyid nyams so // gzhan yang 'gro ba gang zhig dbang phyug mnyes pa'i las byed pa dang / de la gnod par 'gyur zhing ma dad pa'i las byed pa'i las de dag dbang phyug la rag las na ni /
translated: If he does not generate it, then the claim that everything is generated by ƒ™≈õvara is undermined.üîΩMoreover, if the karma of those who please ƒ™≈õvara and the karma of those who harm him and do not have faith in him are dependent on ƒ™≈õvara,

original: rang la gnod cing ma dad pa'i las byed du 'jug pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang la gnod cing ma dad pa'i las byed du 'jug pa mi 'thad do //
translated: then it is not tenable that he causes those who harm him and do not have faith in him to do such karma.

original: ji ltar shes bzhin du rang gis rang 'tshog pa mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar shes bzhin du rang gis rang 'tshog pa mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is untenable that one consciously commits suicide.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i las rang la gnod pa nyid du ma shes so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i las rang la gnod pa nyid du ma shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúI do not know that such actions are harmful to me,‚Äù

original: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyams so //
analyzed: de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du khas blangs pa nyams so //
translated: then you have undermined your claim that he is omniscient.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug la gnod pa'i las dbang phyug nyid kyis byas nas de'i 'bras bu ngan song gi sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'gro ba gzhan la smin pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug la gnod pa'i las dbang phyug nyid kyis byas nas de'i 'bras bu ngan song gi sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'gro ba gzhan la smin pa mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, it is untenable that ƒ™≈õvara himself creates harmful actions and that the result of those actions, such as suffering in the lower realms, ripens on other transmigrating beings.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis spod btang pa'i zas zos pas /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis spod btang pa'i zas zos pas /
translated: It is untenable that one eats food that another has prepared

original: gzhan skom pas 'chi ba mi 'thad pa bzhen no //
analyzed: gzhan skom pas 'chi ba mi 'thad pa bzhen no //
translated: and that another experiences the hunger and thirst.

original: gal te de 'dra ba'i las dbang phyug la rag las pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba'i las dbang phyug la rag las pa ma yin na /
translated: If such actions do not depend on ƒ™≈õvara,

original: thams cad dbang phyug gis byas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad dbang phyug gis byas pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the claim that everything is created by ƒ™≈õvara is undermined.

original: gal te dbang phyug la yang rag las mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la yang rag las mod kyi /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThey do depend on ƒ™≈õvara,

original: de 'dra ba'i las byed pa 'gro ba de rnams nyid kyi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen la @112a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i las byed pa 'gro ba de rnams nyid kyi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen la @112a * //
translated: but the creation of such actions depends on the conditions of the desire and so on of those transmigrating beings,‚Äù

original: ltos pas de dag gi 'bras bu 'gro ba rnams la yang smin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ltos pas de dag gi 'bras bu 'gro ba rnams la yang smin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the result of karma would be experienced by migrating beings.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: But even if that were so,

original: 'gro ba bzang ngan la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa la /
analyzed: 'gro ba bzang ngan la sogs pa'i 'bras bu med pa la /
translated: the result of good and bad migrating beings and so on would not exist.

original: dbang phyug mthu thogs pa med cing rang dbang can nyid nyams so //
analyzed: dbang phyug mthu thogs pa med cing rang dbang can nyid nyams so //
translated: And the power and independence of ƒ™≈õvara would be undermined.üîΩMoreover, the conditions of desire and so on of these migrating beings would be created by ƒ™≈õvara or not.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba da dag gi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen kyang dbang phyug gis byas sam ma byas zhes pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa mtshungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba da dag gi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen kyang dbang phyug gis byas sam ma byas zhes pa la sogs pa'i rtag pa mtshungs te /
translated: The same fault of permanence and so on would apply.

original: don go bar zad do //
analyzed: don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: gzhan yang tha snyad tsam du myu gu sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba dang / du ba la sogs pa me la sogs pa las skye bar mthong zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha snyad tsam du myu gu sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba dang / du ba la sogs pa me la sogs pa las skye bar mthong zhing /
translated: Moreover, it is seen that sprouts and so on arise from the assembly of seeds and so on and that smoke and so on arise from fire and so on.

original: mtho ris dang ngan 'gro'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang las kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig las skye bar sngar bstan pas /
analyzed: mtho ris dang ngan 'gro'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang las kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig las skye bar sngar bstan pas /
translated: And it was previously explained that the happiness and suffering of higher rebirth and lower rebirth arise from certain specific karmas.

original: de las gzhan dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa'i dngos po las skye ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de las gzhan dbang phyug la sogs pa rtag pa'i dngos po las skye ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that anything arises from a permanent thing, such as ƒ™≈õvara.

original: gzhan du gyur pa mi rtag pa las skye ba 'gog pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa mi rtag pa las skye ba 'gog pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The refutation of arising from a impermanent thing that is other is also threefold.

original: de la 'das pa zhig pa las skye ba dang / ma 'ongs pa las skye bar 'dod pa ni bye brag pa rnams kyi lugs te /
analyzed: de la 'das pa zhig pa las skye ba dang / ma 'ongs pa las skye bar 'dod pa ni bye brag pa rnams kyi lugs te /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas assert that arising occurs from a past thing that has disintegrated and from a future thing.

original: de ni dgag pa nyid du sla'o //
analyzed: de ni dgag pa nyid du sla'o //
translated: It is easy to refute that.

original: da ltar dus mnyam pa las skye ba yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: da ltar dus mnyam pa las skye ba yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Arising from a thing that is simultaneous with itself is also untenable.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa grub pa'i dus na 'bras bu yang grub zin pas skye bar mi 'thad la /üîΩrgyu ma grub pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas de las 'bras bu skye ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa grub pa'i dus na 'bras bu yang grub zin pas skye bar mi 'thad la / rgyu ma grub pa yang nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas de las 'bras bu skye ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: When the thing that is asserted to be the cause is established, the effect is also already established. Therefore, it is not tenable that it arises.

original: rang las skye ba dgag pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: rang las skye ba dgag pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: Also, a cause that is not established is empty of all ability. Therefore, it is not tenable that an effect arises from it, just like the refutation of arising from itself.

original: gzhan yang rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa ltar dus mnyam du grub pa'i dngos po gnyis la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rva g-yas pa dang g-yon pa ltar dus mnyam du grub pa'i dngos po gnyis la /
translated: Moreover, it is like the right and left horns of an ox. Two things that are established simultaneously

original: 'di ni rgyu la 'di ni 'bras bu zhes pa'i nges pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu la 'di ni 'bras bu zhes pa'i nges pa mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable to specify that this is the cause and that is the effect.

original: rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir phan tshun 'chol pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa'i phyir phan tshun 'chol pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the reason is similar, they would be mutually confused.

original: de'i phyir da ltar ba 'bras bu'i dus la ltos pa'i sngon rol de ma thag pa bar med pa las skye bar 'dod pa ni tha snyad kyi tshul la mkhas pa rnams kyi gtsug lag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar ba 'bras bu'i dus la ltos pa'i sngon rol de ma thag pa bar med pa las skye bar 'dod pa ni tha snyad kyi tshul la mkhas pa rnams kyi gtsug lag ste /
translated: Therefore, the assertion that the present is produced from the immediate prior, which is the prior time that is not separated from the time of the effect, is the tradition of those who are skilled in conventional reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las /üîΩrten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa s'a lu ljang pa'i mdo las / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Bhagavat also said in the Rice Seedling S≈´tra:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That which is called dependent arising is as follows:

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes pa'am /
translated: If this exists, that occurs.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes pa ste /
translated: Because this arises, that arises.

original: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'di ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba lta bu'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: For example, due to the condition of ignorance, formations occur.

original: 'di yang @112b dpyad na mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di yang @112b dpyad na mi 'thad de /
translated: This also is untenable when analyzed.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig gnyis bdag nyid thams cad nas bar ma chod de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig gnyis bdag nyid thams cad nas bar ma chod de /
translated: The two moments of cause and effect are not separated by any interval.

original: rgyu'i skad cig de nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig snga ma la nye zhing 'byor ba'i phyogs dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig gi rang gi 'bras bu la nye ba'i phyogs gnyis kyang ma chod na ni de dag dus mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig de nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig snga ma la nye zhing 'byor ba'i phyogs dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i skad cig gi rang gi 'bras bu la nye ba'i phyogs gnyis kyang ma chod na ni de dag dus mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If the two sides of the present moment of the cause, which is the prior moment that is the cause of that very moment, and the side of the result, which is the result of that very moment, are not blocked, they would be simultaneous.

original: gal te de dag ni bar du chod mod kyi rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig gi rang gi 'bras bu la nye ba'i phyogs dang / 'bras bu yang rang gi rgyu la nye ba'i phyogs gnyis bar ma chod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag ni bar du chod mod kyi rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig gi rang gi 'bras bu la nye ba'i phyogs dang / 'bras bu yang rang gi rgyu la nye ba'i phyogs gnyis bar ma chod pa'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúAlthough they are blocked, the side of the result of the moment that is the cause and the side of the cause of the result are not blocked,‚Äù

original: zhe na / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig re re yang chod pa dang ma chod pa'i cha dang bcas pas skad cig gcig nyid nyams so //
analyzed: zhe na / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig re re yang chod pa dang ma chod pa'i cha dang bcas pas skad cig gcig nyid nyams so //
translated: then the moment of the cause and the moment of the result would each have a blocked and an unblock side, and the assertion of a single moment would be undermined.

original: gal te rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu ma skyes nas med pa'i phyir med pa dang / phyogs gcig mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu ma skyes nas med pa'i phyir med pa dang / phyogs gcig mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug la /
translated: If the result does not arise at the time of the cause and does not exist, the analysis of whether it is partially or wholly blocked does not apply.

original: 'bras bu'i dus na yang rgyu 'gags nas med pa'i phyir med pa dang phyogs gcig dang mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na yang rgyu 'gags nas med pa'i phyir med pa dang phyogs gcig dang mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But at the time of the effect, since the cause has ceased and is nonexistent, the analyses of nonexistence, of one part, and of the whole do not apply.

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: khyad par mtha' dag spangs pa'i spyi mi 'thad de /
analyzed: khyad par mtha' dag spangs pa'i spyi mi 'thad de /
translated: A universal that is devoid of all particulars is not tenable,

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i dngos po mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i dngos po mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: just like a thing that is devoid of one or many is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir ma chod pa nyid du khas blangs na khyad par de dag las gang yang rung ba cig gis khyab la de dag la gcig tu nges pa med pa na 'di 'am 'di zhes ci'i phyir brtag pa mi 'jug zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma chod pa nyid du khas blangs na khyad par de dag las gang yang rung ba cig gis khyab la de dag la gcig tu nges pa med pa na 'di 'am 'di zhes ci'i phyir brtag pa mi 'jug zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if you accept that it is not obstructed, it is pervaded by any of those particulars. Since they are not ascertained as one, why do you not apply the analysis, ‚ÄúIs it this or is it that‚Äù?

original: gzhan du na rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu ma skyes nas med pas med pa dang gnyis bar du ma chod ces pa'i khyab bya brtag pa'i gzhi khas len pa yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan du na rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu ma skyes nas med pas med pa dang gnyis bar du ma chod ces pa'i khyab bya brtag pa'i gzhi khas len pa yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Otherwise, since the effect does not arise at the time of the cause and is nonexistent, it is not tenable to accept the basis of the pervasion, ‚ÄúIt is not obstructed by the two.‚Äù

original: gal te ma chod pa'i dngos po ni khas mi len mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te ma chod pa'i dngos po ni khas mi len mod kyi /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not accept an entity that is not obstructed,‚Äù

original: bar med pa tsam nyid la ma chod pa zhes brtags su zad do zhe na /
analyzed: bar med pa tsam nyid la ma chod pa zhes brtags su zad do zhe na /
translated: It is merely the absence of an interval that is imputed as ‚Äúuninterrupted.‚Äù

original: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas len pa yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de lta na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po khas len pa yang mi 'thad la /
translated: In that case, it is untenable to accept the reality of cause and effect.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid thams cad nas bar med dam phyogs kyi phyogs gcig nas bar med pa'i brtag pa yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid thams cad nas bar med dam phyogs kyi phyogs gcig nas bar med pa'i brtag pa yang mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, the analysis of whether there is an interval in all respects or an interval in one part is the same.

original: skabs kyi don 'di ni ji ltar nyin par dang mtshan mo'i dus gnyis bdag nyid thams cad nas bar du ma chod de /
analyzed: skabs kyi don 'di ni ji ltar nyin par dang mtshan mo'i dus gnyis bdag nyid thams cad nas bar du ma chod de /
translated: The point of this section is this: The two times, day and night, are not interrupted in all respects.

original: nyin bar gyi snga dro'i phyogs de nyid kyi sngon rol gyi mtshan mo'i dus dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyogs dang / mtshan mo'i rjes thogs phyis byung ba'i nyin par dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyogs gnyis kyang ma @113a * //
analyzed: nyin bar gyi snga dro'i phyogs de nyid kyi sngon rol gyi mtshan mo'i dus dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyogs dang / mtshan mo'i rjes thogs phyis byung ba'i nyin par dang nye bar gyur pa'i phyogs gnyis kyang ma @113a * //
translated: The part of the day, the morning, is not interrupted by the part of the night that precedes it, and the part of the night that follows it is not interrupted by the part of the day that follows it.

original: chod na nyin mtshan de dag dus mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: chod na nyin mtshan de dag dus mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If they are not interrupted, then day and night would be simultaneous.

original: gal te de dag ni bar du chod mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te de dag ni bar du chod mod kyi /
translated: But if they are interrupted,

original: nyin par gyi phyi dro dang / de dang nye bar gyur pa'i mtshan mo'i dus ni ma chod do zhe na /
analyzed: nyin par gyi phyi dro dang / de dang nye bar gyur pa'i mtshan mo'i dus ni ma chod do zhe na /
translated: The afternoon of the day and the night that is close to it are not obstructed.

original: nyin mtshan de dag so so re re yang chod pa dang mchod pa'i cha dang bcas par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyin mtshan de dag so so re re yang chod pa dang mchod pa'i cha dang bcas par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: But each of those days and nights has a part that is obstructed and a part that is not obstructed.

original: gzhan yang phyi'i don khas len pa rnams kyis shar dang nub kyi rdul bar du mchod cing 'byar bar khas blangs pa na bdag nyid thams cad nas mchod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi'i don khas len pa rnams kyis shar dang nub kyi rdul bar du mchod cing 'byar bar khas blangs pa na bdag nyid thams cad nas mchod de /
translated: Moreover, if you who assert external objects accept that the east and west particles are obstructed and attached, then all of their parts are attached.

original: shar gyi shar ngos dang nub kyi nu ba ngos kyang mchod na ni de dag yul gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: shar gyi shar ngos dang nub kyi nu ba ngos kyang mchod na ni de dag yul gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If the eastern side of the east and the western side of the west are attached, then they would be the same place.

original: de dag ni bar du chod mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni bar du chod mod kyi /
translated: They are obstructed.

original: shar gyi nub ngos dang nub kyi shar nges gnyis mchod do zhe na /
analyzed: shar gyi nub ngos dang nub kyi shar nges gnyis mchod do zhe na /
translated: But the eastern side of the west and the western side of the east are attached.

original: rdul de dag re re la yang chod pa dang mchod pa'i cha gnyis dang bcas pas rdul gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba dang yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: rdul de dag re re la yang chod pa dang mchod pa'i cha gnyis dang bcas pas rdul gcig pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ba dang yang mtshungs so //
translated: Then, since each of those particles has two parts, one obstructed and one not obstructed, the claim that they are single particles is undermined.

original: gzhan yang snga ma ltar gcig yod pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ltar gcig yod pa'i dus na /
translated: Furthermore, if it were as you say, then at the time of the existence of one,üîΩ

original: cig shos med pas phyogs gcag dang mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug na /
analyzed: cig shos med pas phyogs gcag dang mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug na /
translated: Moreover, if, as in the former case, when one exists the other does not, then the analysis of one part and the whole does not apply.

original: 'dir yang shar phyogs kyi rdul gyi yul na nub ngos kyi rdul med pas med pa dang phyogs gcig mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'dir yang shar phyogs kyi rdul gyi yul na nub ngos kyi rdul med pas med pa dang phyogs gcig mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'jug la /
