translated: Here, too, since the eastern particle does not exist in the location of the western particle, the analysis of nonexistence and one part does not apply.

original: nub gyi rdul gyi yul na yang shar phyogs kyi rdul med pas de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes cis te mi brtsad /üîΩgal te gcig gi yul na gcig med kyang dus mnyam du phan tshun 'dab 'byor pa nyid du yod pas de 'dra ba'i brtag pa 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: nub gyi rdul gyi yul na yang shar phyogs kyi rdul med pas de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes cis te mi brtsad / gal te gcig gi yul na gcig med kyang dus mnyam du phan tshun 'dab 'byor pa nyid du yod pas de 'dra ba'i brtag pa 'jug go zhe na /
translated: And since the western particle does not exist in the location of the eastern particle, the same analysis applies. Why do you not debate this?üîΩIf you say that although one does not exist in the location of the other, they exist simultaneously and are mutually contiguous, so that such an analysis does apply,

original: gcig gi dus na gcig med kyang yul gcig na dus 'dab 'byor pa nyid du yod pas snga ma ltar brtag pa 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig gi dus na gcig med kyang yul gcig na dus 'dab 'byor pa nyid du yod pas snga ma ltar brtag pa 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: then, although one does not exist at the time of the other, they exist in one location and are mutually contiguous, so that the former analysis does apply.

original: gzhan yang rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig la de nyid rang gi rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig dang / bdag nyid thams cad kyis bar du mchod na de nyid la thim par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig la de nyid rang gi rgyur gyur pa'i skad cig dang / bdag nyid thams cad kyis bar du mchod na de nyid la thim par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Moreover, if the instant that is the cause were to be obstructed by the instant that is its own cause, it would dissolve into that.

original: phyogs gcig nas ma chod na cha dang bcas pas skad cig pa nying nyams te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig nas ma chod na cha dang bcas pas skad cig pa nying nyams te /
translated: If it were not obstructed by one part, it would have parts and the moment would be undermined.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po skad cig gcig pa nyid du khas len cing bar du mchod pa nyid du yang 'dod na bskal pa yang skad cig gi tshad tsam nyid du 'gyur ba ni legs par bsams pas go bar zad de /üîΩji ltar nyin par gyi dus 'ga' zhig la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po skad cig gcig pa nyid du khas len cing bar du mchod pa nyid du yang 'dod na bskal pa yang skad cig gi tshad tsam nyid du 'gyur ba ni legs par bsams pas go bar zad de / ji ltar nyin par gyi dus 'ga' zhig la /
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that the entity of cause and effect is a single instant and also asserts that it is obstructed, then even an eon would be just the measure of an instant. This is easily understood through proper reflection.

original: de'i snga phyir gyur pa'i mtshan mo'i dus bdag nyid thams cad nas bar @113b du ma chod na /
analyzed: de'i snga phyir gyur pa'i mtshan mo'i dus bdag nyid thams cad nas bar @113b du ma chod na /
translated: For example, if the time of day is not obstructed by the time of night that precedes and follows it,

original: nyin par gyi dus de nyid la thim par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyin par gyi dus de nyid la thim par 'gyur zhing /
translated: then the time of day dissolves into that time of night.

original: de bzhin du de dag gi snga phyir gyur pa'i nyin mo'i dus kyang bdag nyid thams cad nas bar du ma chod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag gi snga phyir gyur pa'i nyin mo'i dus kyang bdag nyid thams cad nas bar du ma chod na /
translated: So too, the earlier and later times of the day would also dissolve into it if they were not obstructed by other times.

original: de la thim par 'gyur bas ri rab la sogs pa yang rdul phra rab kyi tshad tsam du 'gyur ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la thim par 'gyur bas ri rab la sogs pa yang rdul phra rab kyi tshad tsam du 'gyur ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore it would be similar to Meru and so on becoming the size of a mere atom.

original: 'dir gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig kyang cha dang bcas pa ste /üîΩdu ma nyi tshe'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig kyang cha dang bcas pa ste / du ma nyi tshe'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that even the moments of cause and effect have parts,üîΩthen they would be many and finite.

original: skad cig ces pa dus kyi mtha' nyid du yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: skad cig ces pa dus kyi mtha' nyid du yang mi 'thad la /
translated: It is untenable that a moment is the limit of time.

original: gzhan yang dus rgyas pa bskal pa'i dus la sogs pa ni dus thud du ma yin skad cig mang po mthud nas brtsams pa yin la /üîΩ'dir bskal pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus rgyas pa bskal pa'i dus la sogs pa ni dus thud du ma yin skad cig mang po mthud nas brtsams pa yin la / 'dir bskal pa /
translated: Moreover, extensive time such as the eon and so on is composed of many moments of time.

original: lta bu'i dus dang se gol gtogs pa'i dus lta bu la rtsom byed kyi dus kyi skad cig mang nyung med na ni des brtsams pa'i dus la ring thung med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: lta bu'i dus dang se gol gtogs pa'i dus lta bu la rtsom byed kyi dus kyi skad cig mang nyung med na ni des brtsams pa'i dus la ring thung med par 'gyur la /
translated: Here, if there is no difference in the number of moments of time that compose time such as an eon and time such as the time it takes to snap one‚Äôs fingers, then time composed of them would not differ in length.

original: 'on te yod na ni mang nyung tshad kyi mthar thug la /
analyzed: 'on te yod na ni mang nyung tshad kyi mthar thug la /
translated: But if they do, then there is a limit to the number of particles.

original: de'i mtha' yang gcig tu khas len dgos te /
analyzed: de'i mtha' yang gcig tu khas len dgos te /
translated: And the limit of that must be accepted as one.

original: sngar rdul phra rab kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar rdul phra rab kyi skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just as was demonstrated in the section on the most subtle particle.

original: gal te skad cig cha shas med pa la phyogs gcig dang mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig cha shas med pa la phyogs gcig dang mtha' dag gi brtag pa mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not tenable to investigate the part and the whole in the case of a partless instant,

original: rdul phra rab cha shas med pa la yang shar dang lho la sogs pa'i phyogs cha'i brtag pa mi 'thad pas //üîΩdrug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
analyzed: rdul phra rab cha shas med pa la yang shar dang lho la sogs pa'i phyogs cha'i brtag pa mi 'thad pas // drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
translated: then it is also not tenable to investigate the directional parts of the east, south, etc. in the case of a partless particle.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa las grol lo //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa las grol lo //
translated: Thus, you are free from the faults such as ‚ÄúWhen six are simultaneously joined‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te cha shas med par khas blangs zhes kyi /
analyzed: gal te cha shas med par khas blangs zhes kyi /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúWe accept partlessness,‚Äù

original: de tsam gyis de ltar grub pa ni ma yin la /üîΩgzhan yang de dag gis de 'dra ba'i rdul du ma 'dus pa las /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de ltar grub pa ni ma yin la / gzhan yang de dag gis de 'dra ba'i rdul du ma 'dus pa las /
translated: but that alone does not prove that such a thing exists.

original: gzugs rags pa rtsom pa nyid du khas blangs pa na /
analyzed: gzugs rags pa rtsom pa nyid du khas blangs pa na /
translated: Moreover, when you accept that coarse form is composed of many such particles,

original: rdul 'ga' zhig la 'dab chags su kun nas bskor ba nyid du khas len dgos pas de 'dra ba'i brtag pa 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: rdul 'ga' zhig la 'dab chags su kun nas bskor ba nyid du khas len dgos pas de 'dra ba'i brtag pa 'jug go zhe na /
translated: It is necessary to accept that some particles are surrounded by others on all sides, so such an analysis does apply.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig gcig pa'i dngos por khas blangs mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skad cig gcig pa'i dngos por khas blangs mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, although you accept that things exist in terms of momentary cause and effect,

original: de tsam gyis de ltar 'grub pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de ltar 'grub pa ni ma yin la /
translated: merely that does not establish it.

original: de 'dra pa'i skad cig mthud pa las dus ring por rtsom par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: de 'dra pa'i skad cig mthud pa las dus ring por rtsom par 'dod pa na /
translated: When you assert that a long period of time is composed of a series of such moments,

original: ci'i phyir de 'dra ba'i brtag pa mi 'jug ces bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de 'dra ba'i brtag pa mi 'jug ces bya ste /
translated: why do you not apply such an analysis?

original: gzu bor gnas shing don la 'jug pa'i blo yis bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gzu bor gnas shing don la 'jug pa'i blo yis bsam par bya'o //
translated: You should consider this with a mind that is unbiased and engaged with the facts.

original: don 'di rnams nyid lung bstan pa'i slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
analyzed: don 'di rnams nyid lung bstan pa'i slob dpon 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, who was prophesied by the Buddha, said of these points:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan la sa min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan la sa min //
translated: Not from self, not from other,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //
translated: not from both, not without cause.

original: dngos po gang dang gang na @114a * //
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang na @114a * //
translated: In whatever things

original: yang ; / skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: yang ; / skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: birth occurs, it never exists.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa stug po bkod pa'i rgyan las //
translated: And also in the Adornment of the Array of the Qualities of the TathƒÅgata, it says:

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: There is no arising and no disintegration.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: It is not from self and not from other.

original: rtag dang chad las rnam par grol //
analyzed: rtag dang chad las rnam par grol //
translated: It is free from permanence and annihilation.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: It is free from the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: 'jig rten gces pas byas ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten gces pas byas ma yin //
translated: It is not created by the cherished world.

original: rdul gyi rkyen las byung ba'ang med //
analyzed: rdul gyi rkyen las byung ba'ang med //
translated: It does not arise from the conditions of the elements.

original: rgyu med pas dang byas ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu med pas dang byas ma yin //
translated: It is not causeless and not created.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis byung ba'ang min //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis byung ba'ang min //
translated: It does not arise from its own essence.

original: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / gzhan yang /
translated: And also:üîΩThus, the houses of gandharvas

original: 'di ltar dri za'i khang pa dag / khang pa ma yin khang par snang /
analyzed: 'di ltar dri za'i khang pa dag / khang pa ma yin khang par snang /
translated: are not houses but appear as houses.

original: rgyu med par yang mi snang ste //üîΩbdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las //
analyzed: rgyu med par yang mi snang ste // bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las //
translated: They do not appear without a cause.üîΩHaving been imagined by the mind

original: rtog pas rnam par brtag byas na //
analyzed: rtog pas rnam par brtag byas na //
translated: from self, other, or both,

original: dngos nyid mi 'grub dngos rnams kyi //
analyzed: dngos nyid mi 'grub dngos rnams kyi //
translated: the nature of things is not established.

original: rang bzhin kun du brtag pa'o //üîΩrgyu las dngos po mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin kun du brtag pa'o // rgyu las dngos po mi 'byung ste /
translated: The nature of things is a complete fabrication.üîΩThings do not arise from causes.

original: rgyu med las kyang ma yin no //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med las kyang ma yin no //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: They do not arise without causes.

original: de ltar skye ba rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i sgo nas dngos po'i ngo bo don dam pa ba 'gog ste /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba rnam pa bzhi dang bral ba'i sgo nas dngos po'i ngo bo don dam pa ba 'gog ste /
translated: Thus, by way of freedom from the four kinds of production, the ultimate nature of entities is refuted.

original: 'dir chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos can dang dgag bya la sogs pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the subject, the object of refutation, and so forth should be understood as previously explained.

original: gal te skye ba med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang mtshungs na mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang mtshungs na mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is the same as the non-produced rabbit‚Äôs horns and so forth, then it will contradict direct perception and so forth, the valid cognitions.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,‚Äù and so forth.

original: ji ltar byis pas phyi rol dang / yang dag pa'i dngos por brtags pa bzhin du ma skyes pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas phyi rol dang / yang dag pa'i dngos por brtags pa bzhin du ma skyes pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: Just as the childish conceive external things to be real, the non-produced is the same as the rabbit‚Äôs horns and so forth.

original: gzhan du na mtshan nyid yongs su chad pa'i kun brtags kyang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mtshan nyid yongs su chad pa'i kun brtags kyang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the imagined, which is completely characterized, would also become the dependent.

original: sngar rnam grangs kyis na kun du brtags pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur zhes pa ni rnam grangs sam ltos pa'i kun brtags yin pas 'gal ba med do //üîΩrnam par brtags pa'i phyir zhes pa la 'dir phyir zhes pa'i don ni rnam par brtags pa'i tshul de ltar /
analyzed: sngar rnam grangs kyis na kun du brtags pa yang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du 'gyur zhes pa ni rnam grangs sam ltos pa'i kun brtags yin pas 'gal ba med do // rnam par brtags pa'i phyir zhes pa la 'dir phyir zhes pa'i don ni rnam par brtags pa'i tshul de ltar /
translated: Previously, it was said that the imaginary would become the dependent if it were categorized, but that is not contradictory because that is the categorized or dependent imaginary.

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of being imagined‚Äù means that all things are unproduced in the manner of being imagined.

original: gtan tshigs sam ched du bya ba'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs sam ched du bya ba'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is not a reason or purpose.

original: des na skye ba la sogs pa tshad mas grub pa ni 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid sgyu ma lta bur skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na skye ba la sogs pa tshad mas grub pa ni 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul sems nyid rig pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid sgyu ma lta bur skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, production and so on that are established by valid knowledge are produced like illusions that are the dependent nature that is the object of the wisdom of the individual self-cognizing gnosis of the ƒÅryas.

original: byis pa rnams kyi gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi dngos po yang dag par rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi sgo nas ni skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi dngos po yang dag par rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi sgo nas ni skye ba ma yin te /
translated: They are not produced from the perspective of the objects of activity of the correct conception of the entities of the dualism of apprehended and apprehender of foolish beings.

original: de ni @114b yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni @114b yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is not tenable even as a correct convention.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log spang ba'i don du gdams pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas phyin ci log spang ba'i don du gdams pa ste /
translated: The phrase O Mahamathi and so forth are advice for the purpose of abandoning error.

original: gnas kyi rnam par snang ba'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gnas kyi rnam par snang ba'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid de /
translated: The nature of the appearance of the place is the characteristic.

original: gzhi mthun par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi mthun par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are in common.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du 'jug pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du 'jug pa ni sngar bstan pa ltar ro //
translated: The engagement in the characteristic of apprehended object and apprehending subject is as was previously explained.

original: gnyis su ltung zhes pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa de nyid la /
analyzed: gnyis su ltung zhes pa ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pa de nyid la /
translated: Falling into duality is that very possession of the three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi dngos por lta ba'i phyogs su ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin gnyis kyi dngos por lta ba'i phyogs su ltung ba'o //
translated: It is falling into the position of viewing the entity of the two, apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'di la khyod kyis brtson par bya //
analyzed: 'di la khyod kyis brtson par bya //
translated: Here, you should strive.

original: zhes pa ni phyin ci log gi lta ba 'ching ba'i rgyu yin pas de 'dra ba spang ba'i don du brtson par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyin ci log gi lta ba 'ching ba'i rgyu yin pas de 'dra ba spang ba'i don du brtson par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that since the cause of the bondage of erroneous views is like that, one should strive for the purpose of abandoning it.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni lam gyi theg pas sbyang bar bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu rigs kyi rnam par dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pas ni lam gyi theg pas sbyang bar bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu rigs kyi rnam par dbye ba ston te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúMoreover, MahƒÅmati‚Äù teaches the classification of the lineage, which is the cause for attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa, the object of purification by the path of the vehicle.

original: de la rigs med pa la mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de la rigs med pa la mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: In this regard, one might ask, ‚ÄúHow can one speak of a lineage that is not a lineage but is a lineage that will come to be realized?‚Äù

original: de yang lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs yin pas /
analyzed: de yang lha dang tshangs pa'i theg pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rigs yin pas /
translated: This is because it is a lineage that will come to be realized by the vehicle of gods and BrahmƒÅ.

original: de ltar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: That is how it is taught.

original: rigs med ces pa ni thar pa'i rigs med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs med ces pa ni thar pa'i rigs med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a lineage‚Äù means without a lineage for liberation.

original: theg pa mngon par rtogs zhes pa yang /
analyzed: theg pa mngon par rtogs zhes pa yang /
translated: ‚ÄúRealized by the vehicle‚Äù

original: lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa so so rang rig pa'i tshul du rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa so so rang rig pa'i tshul du rtogs pa ste /
translated: means realized in the manner of being individually cognized by the path and the fruition vehicles.

original: thob par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It will come to be attained.

original: de la nyan thos kyi rigs ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag gi bdag gis stong bar shes pa dang / de nyid kyis myur du rang nyid srid pa'i sdug bsngal las thar pa nyid du bstan pa na /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi rigs ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gang zag gi bdag gis stong bar shes pa dang / de nyid kyis myur du rang nyid srid pa'i sdug bsngal las thar pa nyid du bstan pa na /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka type is taught by the teaching that the aggregates and so on are empty of the self of the person, and that by that very [teaching] one quickly liberates oneself from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de la mos pa'i sgo nas lus kyi spu ldang zhing /
analyzed: de la mos pa'i sgo nas lus kyi spu ldang zhing /
translated: When that is taught, one has faith in it and one's body hair stands on end.

original: de'i blo phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zag gi bdag gis stong pa'i don la 'dris shing goms par bya ba'i shes pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i blo phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang zag gi bdag gis stong pa'i don la 'dris shing goms par bya ba'i shes pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: One engages in the cognition that is familiar with and habituated to the meaning of the aggregates and so on being empty of the self of the person.

original: sgrub pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i bye brag go //
translated: That is the specific practice.

original: de las gzhan rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo'i don dang / thams cad sems su gcig cing de yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la mos pa dang sgrub pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo'i don dang / thams cad sems su gcig cing de yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid la mos pa dang sgrub pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: Other than that, one does not have faith in and practice the profound meaning of dependent arising and the characteristic that everything is one in mind and that also is one taste in emptiness.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i bye brag ni de lta bu'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i lta bas sa drug dang lnga dag tu kun nas ldang ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i bye brag ni de lta bu'i theg pa mngon par rtogs pa'i lta bas sa drug dang lnga dag tu kun nas ldang ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The specific result of that is that the view of realizing that vehicle completely abandons the afflicted states that are to be abandoned on the six or five stages, and so on.

original: sa lnga'am drug ni de dag gi rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa dang / mthong @115a * //üîΩba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ste rnam pa lnga 'am /
analyzed: sa lnga'am drug ni de dag gi rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa dang / mthong @115a * // ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ste rnam pa lnga 'am /
translated: The five or six stages are the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of seeing, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from desire, and the stage of realizing what is to be done.üîΩOr, alternatively, the five or six stages are the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of seeing, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from desire, and the stage of realizing what is to be done.

original: gzhan yang byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang drug gi bar dag tu ci rigs par mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba rnams spangs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang drug gi bar dag tu ci rigs par mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba rnams spangs zhes pa'o //
translated: On these five or six stages, the afflicted states that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation are completely abandoned, as is appropriate.

original: drug po de rnams kyang go rims bzhin du nyan thos kyi rigs su nges pa ste /
analyzed: drug po de rnams kyang go rims bzhin du nyan thos kyi rigs su nges pa ste /
translated: These six stages are, in order, the definite lineage of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, the definite lineage of the pratyekabuddha, and the definite lineage of the buddha.

original: bzod pa chen po yan chad dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu de la gnas pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa dgra bcom pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po yan chad dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu de la gnas pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes thob pa dgra bcom pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: It should be applied to those from the stage of great patience onward, to those engaged in the result of stream enterer, to those abiding in that result, to once returners, to nonreturners free of attachment to the desire realm, to arhats who have obtained the transcendent wisdom of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as explained in the commentary to the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir bzod pa chen po yan chad nas de'i rigs su nges pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir bzod pa chen po yan chad nas de'i rigs su nges pa ni /
translated: Here, from the stage of great patience onward, those of definite lineage are

original: gnyis slob rigs las log nas ni //
analyzed: gnyis slob rigs las log nas ni //
translated: those who turn away from the two learner lineages.üîΩThe other three

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur gzhan gsum yang /
translated: may become buddhas.

original: zhes gsungs pas nges 'byed gsum pa bzod pa 'bring po yan chad du yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis rang gi rigs las bzlog nas rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur srid pas de'i rigs su ma nges zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas nges 'byed gsum pa bzod pa 'bring po yan chad du yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis rang gi rigs las bzlog nas rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur srid pas de'i rigs su ma nges zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is possible that from the stage of medium patience onward in the three realizations, they may turn away from their lineage through conditions such as a spiritual guide and become pratyekabuddhas, they are not of definite lineage.

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba zad pa dang / de nyid kyis srid par skye ba'i phung po'i lhag ma ni 'di nyid tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes pa ni kun 'byung ba zad pa dang / de nyid kyis srid par skye ba'i phung po'i lhag ma ni 'di nyid tsam yin gyi /
translated: The line I have exhausted my births refers to the exhaustion of the origin of suffering.

original: gzhan len pa med pas zad pa'o zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan len pa med pas zad pa'o zhes shes pa'o //
translated: By that very fact, I know that this is the remainder of the aggregates that will be born into existence, and there will be no other to take up after that.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas zhes pa ni nyes skyon dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas zhes pa ni nyes skyon dang bral ba ste /
translated: The line I abide in pure conduct refers to being free from faults.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa'i tshangs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa'i tshangs par spyod pa ste /
translated: Pure conduct has four qualities:

original: ma 'dres pa /üîΩyongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: It is unadulterated,üîΩcomplete,üîΩpure,

original: yongs su dag pa /üîΩyongs su byang ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa / yongs su byang ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and cleansed.

original: de la ma 'dres pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa de nyid mu stegs dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma 'dres pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa de nyid mu stegs dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: Among them, unadulterated means that the vehicle of the hearers is unadulterated with the tƒ´rthikas.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Complete means that it is the complete antidote to the afflictions of the three realms.

original: yongs su dag pa ni de'i sems ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni de'i sems ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas zag pa med pa'o //
translated: Pure means that, from the perspective of the purity of its nature, it is free from defilements.

original: yongs su byang ba ni dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnam par dag pas zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su byang ba ni dgra bcom pa'i gnas skabs na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma rnam par dag pas zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: Purified means that at the time of the Arhat, the defilement of the impurities is completely purified, and the outflows are exhausted.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩNot in common with others, endowed,üîΩcompleting the abandonment of the defilements of the three realms,

original: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin ldan pa dang // khams gsum nyon mongs rnam spang rdzogs byed dang / ngo bo nyid @115b dag dri ma dag pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin ldan pa dang // khams gsum nyon mongs rnam spang rdzogs byed dang / ngo bo nyid @115b dag dri ma dag pa ste //
translated: pure by nature, pure of defilements,

original: tshangs spyod yon tan bzhi ldan yin par 'dod /üîΩces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs spyod yon tan bzhi ldan yin par 'dod / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the pure life is considered to have four qualities.

original: bya ba byas so zhes pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas pa dang / lam bsgom pa rnams byas zin pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes pa ni sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / 'gog pa mngon du byas pa dang / lam bsgom pa rnams byas zin pa ste /
translated: Having done what had to be done means that the knowledge of suffering, the abandonment of the origin, the realization of cessation, and the cultivation of the path have been completed.

original: der phyin chad shes par byar med cing spang du med la mngon du byar med cing bsgom du med ces pa'o //
analyzed: der phyin chad shes par byar med cing spang du med la mngon du byar med cing bsgom du med ces pa'o //
translated: It is said that from there on, there is nothing more to be known, nothing more to be abandoned, nothing more to be realized, and nothing more to be cultivated.

original: seng ge'i sgra ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i sgra ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The lion's roar is fearless.

original: de la sogs pa tha ba bcom pa dang kun du sbyor ba spangs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa tha ba bcom pa dang kun du sbyor ba spangs zhes pa'o //
translated: Having destroyed the thorns and abandoned the fetters and so on.

original: blor 'gyur zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa ma yin pa la /
analyzed: blor 'gyur zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa ma yin pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind turns‚Äù means that it does not turn away from nirvana.

original: de'i blor 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i blor 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is the mind turning.

original: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas thar pa'i rigs med pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po zhes pa la sogs pas thar pa'i rigs med pa nyid ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúGreat intelligence‚Äù and so forth teaches the absence of a lineage for liberation.

original: las sog cing rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i gang zag gis bdag yod par khong du chud pas de nyid sdug bsngal las thar pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i don du 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhing /
analyzed: las sog cing rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i gang zag gis bdag yod par khong du chud pas de nyid sdug bsngal las thar pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i don du 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhing /
translated: The person who accumulates karma and experiences its ripening understands that the self exists. For the sake of attaining nirvana, liberation from suffering, he cultivates mundane concentration and the formless concentrations and

original: me lnga bsten pa la sogs pa log pa'i brtul zhugs spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me lnga bsten pa la sogs pa log pa'i brtul zhugs spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: practices false austerities, such as the five fires.

original: de la gso ba ni bdag de nyid kham du byas pa'i zas kyis rgyas par byed pas so //
analyzed: de la gso ba ni bdag de nyid kham du byas pa'i zas kyis rgyas par byed pas so //
translated: There, ‚Äúnourishment‚Äù is the self, which is nourished by food that is chewed.

original: skyes bu ni de nyid lus la brten pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu ni de nyid lus la brten pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúPerson‚Äù is the self, which is based on the body.

original: gang zag ni de nyid dge mi dge'i chos kyis gang zhig khams gsum du skye bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang zag ni de nyid dge mi dge'i chos kyis gang zhig khams gsum du skye bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIndividual‚Äù is the self, which is born in the three realms by means of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: dngos po thams cad rgyu la rag las zhes pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dngos po bzang po dang / ngan par gyur pa thams cad dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu la rag lus par mthong nas de la srog gi mchod sbyin la sogs pas mnyes par byas pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rgyu la rag las zhes pa ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dngos po bzang po dang / ngan par gyur pa thams cad dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu la rag lus par mthong nas de la srog gi mchod sbyin la sogs pas mnyes par byas pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: All things depend on causes. Seeing that all good and bad things in the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment depend on causes such as God, they seek to attain nirvana by pleasing him through the sacrifice of their life and so on.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa de dag gis thar pa mi 'thad pa ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid ma rtogs pa de dag gis thar pa mi 'thad pa ni sngar rgyas par bstan no //
translated: We have already explained in detail how liberation is not tenable for those who do not understand the reality of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: blo gros chen po de la zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni rang nyid gcig pu thar par bya ba'i don du rten 'brel zab mo'i don mngon par rtogs pa bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pa 'du 'dzi'i rkyen med par dben pa la gnas pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par shes pa tsam gyi dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul du sgrub pa ste de @116a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni rang nyid gcig pu thar par bya ba'i don du rten 'brel zab mo'i don mngon par rtogs pa bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas dang nyan thos la sogs pa 'du 'dzi'i rkyen med par dben pa la gnas pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par shes pa tsam gyi dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i tshul du sgrub pa ste de @116a * //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, in that regard‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth is that the teaching of the realization of the meaning of profound dependent arising is for the sake of liberation for oneself alone, and that the buddhas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so on, by abiding in solitude without the conditions of busyness, establish dependent arising in the manner of being fixated on things that are mere consciousness.

original: las gzhan gyi phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i rten 'brel la ni dngos por zhen pa med de /
analyzed: las gzhan gyi phyi rol gyi ngo bor gyur pa'i rten 'brel la ni dngos por zhen pa med de /
translated: Other than that, they are not fixated on things that are external dependent arising.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said,üîΩBecause of the degeneration of the conception of apprehended objects,

original: gzung bar rtog pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa nyams phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //
translated: and because of not abandoning the apprehender,

original: rten gyis bse ru lta bu'i lam //
analyzed: rten gyis bse ru lta bu'i lam //
translated: the path of the rhinoceros-like

original: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is known to be subsumed in the correct.

original: lam dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na grong du bsod snyoms la gshegs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs na grong du bsod snyoms la gshegs pa'i tshe /
translated: At the time of the path and the result, when he went to the village for alms,

original: su dag gis mgus pa'i spyod pa byas pa na dus de nyid kyi tshe'am phyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas skabs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: su dag gis mgus pa'i spyod pa byas pa na dus de nyid kyi tshe'am phyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i gnas skabs kyang rung ste /
translated: if anyone performed a deed of devotion, at that very time or later, even at the time of passing into nirvana,

original: de dag gi nyes pa bshags par bya ba'i don du mdun gyi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas rang gi lus las me'i khams phyung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nyes pa bshags par bya ba'i don du mdun gyi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags nas rang gi lus las me'i khams phyung ste /
translated: in order to confess their faults, he rose up into the sky in front of them and,üîΩhaving emitted the fire element from his body, he demonstrated passing into nirvana and the result of the miracle of the pair, such as the appearance of contradictory aspects, such as the burning of fire and the flowing of water.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa dang / zung gi cho 'phrul te me 'bar ba dang chu 'brub pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i rnam pa ston pa'i 'bras bu 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes bshad pa na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa dang / zung gi cho 'phrul te me 'bar ba dang chu 'brub pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i rnam pa ston pa'i 'bras bu 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes bshad pa na /
translated: When this is explained,

original: thog mar mos pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thog mar mos pa nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: first, they become devoted.

original: de'i rjes su snga ma ltar 'du 'dzi med pa'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su snga ma ltar 'du 'dzi med pa'i rkyen gyis sgrub pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs can no //
translated: After that, like before, the condition of being free from busyness is the practice of those of the ≈õrƒÅvaka type.

original: theg pa chen po'i rigs ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de nyid rang gi rang bzhin don dam pa bas stong pa'i chos kyi dbyings mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i rigs ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid so so rang gis rig pa'i ye shes mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de nyid rang gi rang bzhin don dam pa bas stong pa'i chos kyi dbyings mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: It is realized as the expanse of reality, which is empty of the ultimate nature of that gnosis itself.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams phun sum tshogs par snang zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams phun sum tshogs par snang zhing /
translated: It is realized as the perfect appearance of the buddhafields.

original: der bdag nyid mchan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ba mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: der bdag nyid mchan dang dpe byad kyis brgyan pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ba mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: And it is realized as the appearance of the sambhogakaya, adorned with the major and minor marks of buddhahood.

original: de la sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid las tha dad pa rdul phra rab 'dus pa las grub pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de la sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyi rnam par snang ba ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid las tha dad pa rdul phra rab 'dus pa las grub pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The body that appears in the form of the major and minor marks is not something composed of a collection of particles, something separate from the essence of gnosis.

original: ye shes nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: ye shes nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: It is the essence of gnosis itself.

original: de yang chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid las gzhan ma yin te de ltar na de gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin so so rang rig pa'i tshul gyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur pa ste thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid las gzhan ma yin te de ltar na de gsum dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin so so rang rig pa'i tshul gyis mngon par rtogs par 'gyur pa ste thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is not other than the emptiness of the expanse of reality. Thus, one realizes, that is, attains, the nature of the inseparability of those three by the method of individual self-knowing.

original: de 'dra ba'i rigs mtshon pa'i rtags kyang de gsum las gang yang rung ba gcig bstan pa dang / sngar bstan pa ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa'i tshul kun rdzob pa dang / de'i de bzhin nyid bstan pa na mi 'jigs mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rigs mtshon pa'i rtags kyang de gsum las gang yang rung ba gcig bstan pa dang / sngar bstan pa ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa'i tshul kun rdzob pa dang / de'i de bzhin nyid bstan pa na mi 'jigs mi skrag skrag par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The sign that illustrates such a potential is the teaching of any one of those three, and as previously explained, the conventional method of the engagement of the foundation consciousness and the teaching of its suchness, without fear, without terror, without trembling.

original: thog @116b mar sems spa gong ba dang / de'i rjes la skrag pa dang yun ring du skrag par ma 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thog @116b mar sems spa gong ba dang / de'i rjes la skrag pa dang yun ring du skrag par ma 'gyur zhing /
translated: One does not first become excited, and then later become terrified, and for a long time remain terrified.

original: de la mos par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: One becomes devoted to that and likewise practices it.

original: 'dir tshig gi don bshad pa la /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don bshad pa la /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words is explained.

original: rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin med ces pa ni rang rang gi rang bzhin bden pa bas stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rang bzhin med ces pa ni rang rang gi rang bzhin bden pa bas stong pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally devoid of intrinsic nature‚Äù means that each one is empty of true intrinsic nature.

original: khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù is the wisdom that has become the nature of realization.

original: phyi rol spangs pa zhes pa ni phyi rol lta bur snang ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing khams so //
analyzed: phyi rol spangs pa zhes pa ni phyi rol lta bur snang ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i zhing khams so //
translated: ‚ÄúAbandoning the external‚Äù means the external-like appearance of the enjoyment body‚Äôs buddha field.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin pas thob par bya ba'i don sku gnyis las tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni gdul bya 'ba' zhig gi snang ba yin pas thob par bya ba'i don sku gnyis las tha dad pa med do //
translated: Since the emanation body is the appearance only for those to be tamed, it is not separate from the two bodies that are the objects to be attained.

original: yang gdul bya la de ltar ston pa'i nus pa ni ye shes nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang gdul bya la de ltar ston pa'i nus pa ni ye shes nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, the ability to teach in that way to those to be tamed is wisdom itself.

original: gzhan yang 'dir de 'dra ba'i rigs kyi rtags ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir de 'dra ba'i rigs kyi rtags ni /
translated: Furthermore, here the signs of that type are as follows.üîΩCompassion, interest, patience, and

original: sbyor ba'i sngon du snying rje dang // mos pa dang ni bzod pa dang // dge ba yang dag spyod pa ni //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sngon du snying rje dang // mos pa dang ni bzod pa dang // dge ba yang dag spyod pa ni //
translated: the practice of virtue

original: rigs kyi rtags tu nges par bshad //
analyzed: rigs kyi rtags tu nges par bshad //
translated: are explained as the signs of the type.

original: ces kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: ces kyang gsungs te /
translated: And also:

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa las snying rje la sogs pa'i phan yon thos pa med par dang po nyid nas snying rje dang ldan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa bzod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa las snying rje la sogs pa'i phan yon thos pa med par dang po nyid nas snying rje dang ldan pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa bzod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par spyod pa'o //
translated: Without having heard from spiritual masters and so on about the benefits of compassion and so on, they are compassionate from the very beginning, they are devoted to the teachings of the Great Vehicle, they are patient in enduring hardships, and they practice the roots of virtue that consist of the transcendences.

original: gzhan yang sngar gyi rigs so so ba yod par rtogs pa'i rtags kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar gyi rigs so so ba yod par rtogs pa'i rtags kyang /
translated: Moreover, the existence of the different types of spiritual gene is indicated byüîΩthe differences in the constituents,üîΩin aspiration,üîΩin the stages of development,

original: khams rnams dang ni mos pa dang // sa ba pa tha dad dbye ba dang // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khams rnams dang ni mos pa dang // sa ba pa tha dad dbye ba dang // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and in the results.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin gzhung dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin gzhung dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: As explained above, this verse should be applied to the text.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs can ni theg pa gsum gyi yon tan so sor bstan pa ni /üîΩji ltar bstan pa de la mos par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs can ni theg pa gsum gyi yon tan so sor bstan pa ni / ji ltar bstan pa de la mos par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those of indefinite spiritual gene are taught the virtues of each of the three vehicles.üîΩThey become devoted to the teachings as they are presented,

original: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: and they practice accordingly.

original: de yang yon tan gsum char thos par 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang yon tan gsum char thos par 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when one hears about all three of the excellences,

original: gang la dga' ba shas che ba de las rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la dga' ba shas che ba de las rjes su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should apply oneself to the one that one likes best.

original: de la rigs zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs gnyis char la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de la rigs zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs gnyis char la 'jug ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúfamily‚Äù is used in both the causal and resultant states,

original: ji ltar rgyal po'i rigs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po'i rigs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as in the case of the family of the king, and so on.

original: spyir de ltar yin mod kyi /
analyzed: spyir de ltar yin mod kyi /
translated: Although this is generally the case,

original: 'dir rigs rnam par dgod par byas pa ni yongs su sbyang ba'i sa ste /
analyzed: 'dir rigs rnam par dgod par byas pa ni yongs su sbyang ba'i sa ste /
translated: here the family is presented as the stage of action in faith,

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i sa bon gya bye brag ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs sems can gyi rgyud kyis bsdus pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i sa bon gya bye brag ste /
translated: which is the causal state, the seed existing in the consciousness that is the basis of all, included in the life-stream of a sentient being.

original: de yang rgyud nas snang ba med pa'i sa ste /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i sa @117a * //
analyzed: de yang rgyud nas snang ba med pa'i sa ste / byang chub sems dpa'i sa @117a * //
translated: Moreover, that seed is not manifest in the life-stream,

original: dang bo'am brgyad pa yan chad la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rnam par dgod pa'o //
analyzed: dang bo'am brgyad pa yan chad la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rnam par dgod pa'o //
translated: but is presented in order to enter the first stage of the bodhisattva or the eighth stage and so on.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: Again, in one sense,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rang rang gi snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rang rang gi snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should also be applied to the meditative stabilization of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on that is free from their own appearances.

original: bshad pa snga ma ltar na rim gyis so so rang rang gi kun gzhi la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dag nas chos la bdag med pa mthong zhing des shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa snga ma ltar na rim gyis so so rang rang gi kun gzhi la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dag nas chos la bdag med pa mthong zhing des shes bya'i sgrib pa yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: According to the former explanation, after the afflictive predispositions in their individual ƒÅleyas are gradually purified, they see the selflessness of phenomena, and through that, they also abandon the obscurations to omniscience.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa thob nas de las langs te byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas sems can gyi don du srid par skye ba blangs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la gnas pa thob nas de las langs te byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas sems can gyi don du srid par skye ba blangs te /
translated: After they attain the bliss of meditative stabilization, they rise from that, generate the supreme thought of awakening, and take birth in existence for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: tshogs gnyis su kha bskang nas nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams kyang rgyal ba'i sku nyid rab tu thob par 'gyur ra //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis su kha bskang nas nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams kyang rgyal ba'i sku nyid rab tu thob par 'gyur ra //
translated: After they have completed the two accumulations, even ≈õrƒÅvaka arhats will attain the very body of the Victor.

original: de ltar na 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ni sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mthar thug pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ni sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mthar thug pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, here the lineage of the TathƒÅgata is the reality of mind, free from conceptual elaborations and radiant. It is the ultimate of the store consciousness.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /üîΩsgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las / sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom it is said:üîΩThe support of the practice

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dang // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: is the nature of the realm of reality.

original: de ni da bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de ni da bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the essence of the TathƒÅgata

original: chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i rgyu mthun pas so //
translated: because it is the cause of the Dharma body.

original: chos kyi sku'i nye bar len pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i nye bar len pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the appropriation of the Dharma bodyüîΩbecause it is the basis of the Dharma body.

original: de nyid dri ma sna tshogs dang bcas pa'i dus na sems can gyi khams yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid dri ma sna tshogs dang bcas pa'i dus na sems can gyi khams yin zhing /
translated: When it is associated with various defilements, it is the realm of sentient beings.

original: dri ma phyogs 'ga' dang bral ba'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya la /
analyzed: dri ma phyogs 'ga' dang bral ba'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya la /
translated: When it is free from some of the defilements, it is called a bodhisattva.

original: mtha' dag bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i dus na chos kyi sku nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i dus na chos kyi sku nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is completely free from all the defilements and their imprints, it is the Dharma body.

original: de'i don ni da ltar gyi sems kyi rang bzhin spros bral 'od gsal 'di nyid kyi rgyun rgyud dri ma mtha' dag bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i dus na chos kyi sku yin gyi gzhan nas thob pa ma yin pas rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rgyuüîΩyin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni da ltar gyi sems kyi rang bzhin spros bral 'od gsal 'di nyid kyi rgyun rgyud dri ma mtha' dag bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i dus na chos kyi sku yin gyi gzhan nas thob pa ma yin pas rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i rgyu yin zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: At the time when the continuum of this very clear light, the nature of the present mind free from elaborations, has abandoned all stains together with their imprints, it is the dharmakƒÅya. Since it is not obtained from elsewhere, it is the cause that is included in one‚Äôs continuum.

original: de ltar ni de ni khams dang sa bon zhes kyang sa bcu'i mgon pos bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar ni de ni khams dang sa bon zhes kyang sa bcu'i mgon pos bshad de /
translated: Thus the lords of the tenth stage explain that it is the element and the seed.

original: rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included in the synonyms.

original: gal te sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa yi ni rten gyur pa //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs it the support of practice?‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin zhes spyir bstan pa las /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin zhes spyir bstan pa las /
translated: In general, it is taught that it is the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin la rigs sam de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la sogs par bstan pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin la rigs sam de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la sogs par bstan pa med do zhe na /
translated: It is said that the nature of the mind is not taught to be a gotra, the essence of a tathƒÅgata, and so on.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sems las ma gtogs pa'i chos med pa dang / gzhan yang chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gi ldog pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par @117b bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs pa'i chos med pa dang / gzhan yang chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gi ldog pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par @117b bral ba'i phyir /
translated: There are no phenomena that are not included within mind, and moreover, the ultimate expanse, which is only emptiness, is devoid of any distinction between cause and effect.

original: rigs nyid du mi 'thad pas chos can gyi rnam par 'gyur ba dang / chos nyid zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid de nyid rigs la sogs par 'thad do //
analyzed: rigs nyid du mi 'thad pas chos can gyi rnam par 'gyur ba dang / chos nyid zung du 'jug pa sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid de nyid rigs la sogs par 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable as a lineage. Thus, it is tenable that the illusory reality of the union of the bases of emptiness and their emptiness is the lineage and so on.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: ƒÄrya Vimuktisena explains:

original: rang bzhin gtso bor gyur pa ni rigs yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gtso bor gyur pa ni rigs yin la /
translated: The principal nature is the lineage.

original: rnam 'gyur gtso bor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam 'gyur gtso bor gyur pa ni dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The principal transformations are the focal objects.

original: 'on kyang gnyi gar gnyi ga khas len dgos so zhes 'phags pa rnam grol sdes bshad do //üîΩde'i phyir sems las ma gtogs pa bems po'i chos can 'ga' zhig kun rdzob tu yod kyang de dang de'i chos nyid zung du 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyi gar gnyi ga khas len dgos so zhes 'phags pa rnam grol sdes bshad do // de'i phyir sems las ma gtogs pa bems po'i chos can 'ga' zhig kun rdzob tu yod kyang de dang de'i chos nyid zung du 'jug pa ni /
translated: However, both must be accepted as both.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, although some insentient bases of emptiness that are not included within mind exist conventionally, the union of those and their emptiness is not the lineage of the buddhas.

original: mtshan nyid shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan nyid shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because their characteristics are mutually contradictory.

original: rta ba lang gi rigs ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rta ba lang gi rigs ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: A horse is not the type of ox.

original: de yang sems can thams cad la yod de /
analyzed: de yang sems can thams cad la yod de /
translated: Moreover, it exists in all sentient beings.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa las /
translated: As it says in the noble Nirvana Sutra:

original: don de lta bas na ngas rtag tu sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pas na log sred can gyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don de lta bas na ngas rtag tu sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pas na log sred can gyi bar du sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, because all sentient beings have the buddha-nature, I always say that even those with wrong views have the buddha-nature.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang log sred can la sogs pa la dge ba'i chos rnams med kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang log sred can la sogs pa la dge ba'i chos rnams med kyang /
translated: Moreover, although those with wrong views and so on do not have virtuous qualities,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nyid dge ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nyid dge ba ste /
translated: the buddha-nature itself is virtuous,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because it will exist in the future.

original: gzhan yang log sred can la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang log sred can la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do //
translated: Moreover, those with wrong views and so on have the buddha-nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: log sred can dag gdon mi zar bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log sred can dag gdon mi zar bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no doubt that those who have wrong desires will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu dper na mi 'ga' zhig gi khyim na 'o ma dang zho yod pa las /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dper na mi 'ga' zhig gi khyim na 'o ma dang zho yod pa las /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this: Suppose there is a person who has milk and curd in their house.

original: yang mi zhig gis khyod la mar yod dam zhes dris pas /
analyzed: yang mi zhig gis khyod la mar yod dam zhes dris pas /
translated: Then another person asks them, ‚ÄúDo you have butter?‚Äù

original: des smras pa bdag la mar yod do zhes smras kyang /
analyzed: des smras pa bdag la mar yod do zhes smras kyang /
translated: Even though they say, ‚ÄúI have butter,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zho ni yang dag par mar ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar zho ni yang dag par mar ma yin mod kyi /
translated: it is not really butter.

original: thabs la mkhas pas gdon mi za bar thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir mar yod do zhes smras so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas gdon mi za bar thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir mar yod do zhes smras so //
translated: But because of skillful means, there is no doubt that they will obtain it, so they say, ‚ÄúI have butter.‚Äù

original: sems can dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Sentient beings are like that.

original: kun la sems yod do //
analyzed: kun la sems yod do //
translated: All of them have minds.

original: gang sems yod pa ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang sems yod pa ni gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Those who have minds will without doubt obtain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: don de lta bas na ngas rtag tu sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes gsungs so zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu de bzhin @118a * //
analyzed: don de lta bas na ngas rtag tu sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes gsungs so zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang rigs kyi bu de bzhin @118a * //
translated: For this reason, I always teach that all sentient beings have buddha nature.

original: gshegs pa'i snying po ni sems can thams cad la yod pa mthong bar mi nus pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gshegs pa'i snying po ni sems can thams cad la yod pa mthong bar mi nus pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Son of noble family, the essence of the thus-gone ones is present in all sentient beings, but they are unable to see it.

original: bud med dbul mo de nyid la gter yod pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bud med dbul mo de nyid la gter yod pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the poor woman who has a treasure in her house.

original: rigs kyi bu ngas sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod do zhes yang dag par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ngas sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod do zhes yang dag par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Son of noble family, I teach that all sentient beings have the essence of the thus-gone ones.

original: ji ltar dbul mo des gter chen po yod par bstan kyang mi shes pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar dbul mo des gter chen po yod par bstan kyang mi shes pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the poor woman does not know about the great treasure in her house,

original: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pas sems can rnams kyis mi shes shing ma mthong nas de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yod pa yang nyon mongs pa'i rnam pas bsgribs pas sems can rnams kyis mi shes shing ma mthong nas de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas bstan te /
translated: all sentient beings do not know or see that they have the essence of the thus-gone ones because it is obscured by the afflictions. The thus-gone ones teach this to them.

original: de dag mgu nas de bzhin gshegs pa la skyabs su 'gro'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag mgu nas de bzhin gshegs pa la skyabs su 'gro'o zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: They are pleased and say, We go for refuge to the Tathagata.

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: The noble Samadhiraja says,

original: 'gro ba 'di dag ma lus sangs rgyas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag ma lus sangs rgyas 'gyur //
translated: All these beings without exception will become Buddhas.

original: 'di na snod min sems can gang yang med //
analyzed: 'di na snod min sems can gang yang med //
translated: There are no beings whatsoever who are not vessels.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa las kyang //üîΩji ltar dri ngas smad pa'i gos dag gi //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bstan pa las kyang // ji ltar dri ngas smad pa'i gos dag gi //
translated: The Tathagatagarbha Sutra says,üîΩJust as a statue of the Sugata,

original: yongs su dkris pa bde bar gshegs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: yongs su dkris pa bde bar gshegs pa'i gzugs //
translated: wrapped in foul-smelling rags,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas dper na gos rul gyis dkris pa'i rgyal ba'i sku gzugs mi mthong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas dper na gos rul gyis dkris pa'i rgyal ba'i sku gzugs mi mthong ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, a statue of the Victor is not seen because it is wrapped in rags.

original: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod mod kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri mas dkris pas mthong par mi nus la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod mod kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri mas dkris pas mthong par mi nus la /
translated: Likewise, although the Buddha-nature exists in all sentient beings, it cannot be seen because it is wrapped in the defilements.

original: de nyid bsal na mthong bar 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas kyi ming 'thob po zhes don 'di nyid rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bsal na mthong bar 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas kyi ming 'thob po zhes don 'di nyid rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: This very meaning is stated extensively.

original: de la sogs pa drang srong gi gtsug lag gi gzhung du ma snang mod kyi tshig mangs su dogs pas mi spro'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa drang srong gi gtsug lag gi gzhung du ma snang mod kyi tshig mangs su dogs pas mi spro'o //
translated: Although this and so forth appear in many scriptures of the sages, I will not elaborate for fear of being long-winded.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad rim gyis brgyud nas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bas 'bras bu mthar thug pa yang gcig yin zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad rim gyis brgyud nas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bas 'bras bu mthar thug pa yang gcig yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, since all sentient beings gradually become buddhas, the ultimate result is also one.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam dang / lam gyis sbyang bar bya ba'i rigs kyang mthar thug gi dbang du byas na gcig nyid de /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam dang / lam gyis sbyang bar bya ba'i rigs kyang mthar thug gi dbang du byas na gcig nyid de /
translated: The path that causes that attainment and the type to be purified by the path are also one from the perspective of the ultimate.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
translated: It is the buddha lineage.

original: 'on kyang gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na /
translated: However, from the perspective of the stage,

original: ji srid pa'i sdug bsngal ngal so ba'i bsti gnas nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa du ma yod cing de thob par byed pa'i lam dang / lam gyis sbyang bar bya ba'i rigs kyi gnas skabs tha dad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid pa'i sdug bsngal ngal so ba'i bsti gnas nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa du ma yod cing de thob par byed pa'i lam dang / lam gyis sbyang bar bya ba'i rigs kyi gnas skabs tha dad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And there are different paths for attaining these kinds of nirvana, and different stages of the path for purifying the different kinds of beings.

original: gal te de lta na 'phags pa mya ngan @118b las 'das pa'i mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'phags pa mya ngan @118b las 'das pa'i mdo de nyid las /
translated: If this is so, then why does the Arya Mahaparinirvana Sutra say:

original: dper na rdo rje rin po che gzi brjid chen po ni cis kyang bcag par mi nus la /
analyzed: dper na rdo rje rin po che gzi brjid chen po ni cis kyang bcag par mi nus la /
translated: For example, a diamond, which has great luster, cannot be destroyed by anything.

original: rnam grangs gzhan thams cad ni des chom par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan thams cad ni des chom par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: All other things can destroy it,

original: lug gi rva ni mi chod do //
analyzed: lug gi rva ni mi chod do //
translated: but it cannot destroy a sheep‚Äôs horn.

original: de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo chen po 'dis kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo chen po 'dis kyang /
translated: In the same way, this great sutra, the Mahaparinirva·πáa,

original: shin du sdig pa'i las byed pa 'dod chen po ni byang chub tu gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: shin du sdig pa'i las byed pa 'dod chen po ni byang chub tu gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: cannot establish in enlightenment those who have great desire and who have committed very negative actions.üîΩBecause they have no cause, just as a diamond cannot destroy a sheep‚Äôs horn.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir rdo rjes lug gi rva la mi tshugs pa bzhin no zhes rigs chad kyi gang zag kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir rdo rjes lug gi rva la mi tshugs pa bzhin no zhes rigs chad kyi gang zag kyang gsungs la /
translated: This sutra also speaks of people who are of an inferior spiritual lineage.

original: gzhan yang theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las kyang /
translated: Moreover, it would contradict the Mahayana sutra Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras, which states:

original: dkar po dman pa yod pa rgyu dang bral //
analyzed: dkar po dman pa yod pa rgyu dang bral //
translated: Those with inferior virtue are devoid of the cause.

original: zhes rgyu dang bral ba gtan du ba'i rigs chad gsungs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde du ma las theg pa gsum gyi rigs tha dad par gsungs pa dang / de sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa gsum du bstan pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes rgyu dang bral ba gtan du ba'i rigs chad gsungs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde du ma las theg pa gsum gyi rigs tha dad par gsungs pa dang / de sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa gsum du bstan pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also contradict the statement that those devoid of the cause are eternally cut off from the lineage, as well as the many sutras such as the perfection of wisdom sutras that state that there are three different lineages of the three vehicles and the teachings on the three vehicles that are the paths and results that purify those lineages.

original: gzhan yang ba ru ra'i phung po'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang ba ru ra'i phung po'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, it would contradict the Heap of Barley Sutra, which states:

original: dge slong dag rgya dang rngams su dpag tshad tsam yod pa'i ba ru ra'i phung po las lo brgya brgya zhing re re phyung na zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong dag rgya dang rngams su dpag tshad tsam yod pa'i ba ru ra'i phung po las lo brgya brgya zhing re re phyung na zad par 'gyur la /
translated: Bhik·π£hus, if you were to remove one grain of barley from this heap of barley each hundred years, bhik·π£us, that heap of barley would be exhausted.üîΩBut the realms of sentient beings are inexhaustible.

original: sems can rnams kyi khams ni mi zad pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / ji ltar na 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi khams ni mi zad pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / ji ltar na 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could this not be contradictory?

original: de'i phyir rigs kyi ngo bo ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i zad pa med pa'i chos kyis bon dngos por gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs kyi ngo bo ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yod pa'i zad pa med pa'i chos kyis bon dngos por gyur la /
translated: Therefore, the nature of potential is the seed of inexhaustible dharmas that exists in the foundation consciousness.

original: thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa 'am /
analyzed: thog ma med pa nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa 'am /
translated: It has been transmitted from one life to another since beginningless time,

original: glo bur du thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis bsgos pa 'ga' zhig yin la /
analyzed: glo bur du thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis bsgos pa 'ga' zhig yin la /
translated: or it is a seed that is suddenly infused by the conditions of hearing, reflection and so on.

original: de yang khyad par du nyan thos kyi zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon ni nyan thos kyi rigs nyid du nges shing /
analyzed: de yang khyad par du nyan thos kyi zag pa med pa'i chos kyi sa bon ni nyan thos kyi rigs nyid du nges shing /
translated: In particular, the seed of the uncontaminated dharma of sravakas is definitely the sravaka potential,

original: de las nyan thos kyi byang chub kho na 'byung gi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las nyan thos kyi byang chub kho na 'byung gi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: and only sravaka enlightenment arises from it, not anything else.

original: de bzhin du rigs kyi khyad par gzhan rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs kyi khyad par gzhan rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The other specific potentials should be understood in the same way.

original: de ltar na rigs so sor nges pa dang / de sbyang bar byed pa'i lam gyis bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang tha dad pa gsum du nges shing /
analyzed: de ltar na rigs so sor nges pa dang / de sbyang bar byed pa'i lam gyis bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang tha dad pa gsum du nges shing /
translated: Thus the individual certainties of potential and the vehicle of one's own nature that purifies it are definitely three.

original: des sbyangs pa'i 'bras bu mthar thug pa yang byang chub tha dad pa gsum du nges te /
analyzed: des sbyangs pa'i 'bras bu mthar thug pa yang byang chub tha dad pa gsum du nges te /
translated: The ultimate result of training in that is definitely the three different enlightenments.

original: byang chub dman pa rnams las 'das nas mthar thug par sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: byang chub dman pa rnams las 'das nas mthar thug par sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: They assert that it is not that one transcends the lower enlightenments and finally becomes a buddha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rigs dang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa ni dgongs @119a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rigs dang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa ni dgongs @119a * //
translated: Therefore the teaching of the single potential and vehicle is provisional

original: pa can yin te /
analyzed: pa can yin te /
translated: because it is for the sake of disciples.üîΩAs this sutra itself teaches later and as the great protector of the tenth stage

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba dang / sa bcu'i mgon po chen pos kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid las 'og nas ston par 'gyur ba dang / sa bcu'i mgon po chen pos kyang //
translated: says:üîΩBecause of similarity in liberation of persons and phenomena,

original: chos dang gang zag grol ba dag / mtshungs phyir rigs ni tha dad phyir //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag grol ba dag / mtshungs phyir rigs ni tha dad phyir //
translated: because of different potentials,

original: bsam gnyis thob phyir sprul pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsam gnyis thob phyir sprul pa'i phyir //
translated: because of attaining the two aspirations,üîΩbecause of emanation,

original: mthar thug phyir na theg gcig nyid ;
analyzed: mthar thug phyir na theg gcig nyid ;
translated: and because of the ultimate,üîΩthere is a single vehicle.

original: / ces pa la sogs pas theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig nyid de /
analyzed: / ces pa la sogs pas theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings mtshungs pa'i phyir theg pa gcig nyid de /
translated: The teaching of a single vehicle is for the sake of disciples because the dharmadhatu of sravakas and so on is the same.

original: de yang bgrod bar bya bas na theg pa chen po'o zhes pa dang / gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams gang zag gi bdag med par mtshungs pas theg pa gcig pa nyid du bstan te /
