analyzed: de yang bgrod bar bya bas na theg pa chen po'o zhes pa dang / gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams gang zag gi bdag med par mtshungs pas theg pa gcig pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Furthermore, it is taught that there is a single vehicle because the persons of the sravaka and so on are the same in lacking a self of persons.

original: de yang 'gro ba po yin pas theg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba po yin pas theg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called a vehicle because it is what carries.

original: zhes pa la sogs pas rigs dang theg pa gcig pa ni dgongs pa can nyid du bstan pa dang 'gal zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas rigs dang theg pa gcig pa ni dgongs pa can nyid du bstan pa dang 'gal zhes pa'o //
translated: This contradicts the teaching that the single lineage and the single vehicle are provisional,

original: 'di ni mi 'thad de sa bon don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pa ni phung rang rigs pha du ma'i sgo nas bkag la /
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'thad de sa bon don dam pa'i dngos por 'dod pa ni phung rang rigs pha du ma'i sgo nas bkag la /
translated: This is untenable because the seed is asserted to be an ultimate thing, and it is refuted from the perspective of the aggregates, the self, the lineage, and the many.

original: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i dngos por bstan pa ni kun rdzob pa la dgongs shing dngos por zhen pa'i byis pa rnams drang ba'i don du gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang de 'dra ba'i dngos por bstan pa ni kun rdzob pa la dgongs shing dngos por zhen pa'i byis pa rnams drang ba'i don du gsungs pa'o /
translated: Moreover, the teaching of such a thing is from the perspective of the conventional and is stated for the purpose of guiding the childish who are attached to things.

original: dbye ba tha dad pa so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yang gnas skabs tha dad pa la dgongs shing /
analyzed: dbye ba tha dad pa so sor nges pa nyid du bstan pa yang gnas skabs tha dad pa la dgongs shing /
translated: The teaching of the different divisions as being definite individually is from the perspective of different states.

original: de ltar bstan pas 'dul pa'i sems can gyi don du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas 'dul pa'i sems can gyi don du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The teachings were given for the sake of sentient beings to be guided in that way.

original: de'i don ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na sngar bstan pa ltar srid pa'i sdug bsngal dbugs phyung ba'i bsti gnas nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa tha dad cing /
analyzed: de'i don ni gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas na sngar bstan pa ltar srid pa'i sdug bsngal dbugs phyung ba'i bsti gnas nyan thos kyi byang chub la sogs pa tha dad cing /
translated: In terms of the situation, the listeners' enlightenment and so forth are different resting places that offer relief from the sufferings of existence, as explained above.

original: de rnams thob par byed pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyang tha dad pa dang / lam dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i yon tan gyi bye brag tha dad pa'i rten du gyur pa'i sgo nas sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa nyid du 'jog ste /
analyzed: de rnams thob par byed pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs kyang tha dad pa dang / lam dang 'bras bus bsdus pa'i yon tan gyi bye brag tha dad pa'i rten du gyur pa'i sgo nas sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa nyid du 'jog ste /
translated: The situation of the path that brings about the attainment of those states is also different, and the nature of mind, free of elaborations and luminous, is posited as the basis for the different types of listeners and so forth, in terms of the different specific qualities that are included within the path and the result.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas rang nyid thar pa thob par 'dod cing /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas rang nyid thar pa thob par 'dod cing /
translated: It is said that they wish to attain their own liberation in dependence on the words of another.

original: gang zag gi bdag med pa tsam du rtogs par nus pa'i shes rab kyi yon tan brten pa'i cha nas nyan thos kyi rigs nyid du rnam par 'jog pa de las gzhan du gzhan gyis bstan pa la mi ltos par rang nyid thar pa thob par 'dod pa
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med pa tsam du rtogs par nus pa'i shes rab kyi yon tan brten pa'i cha nas nyan thos kyi rigs nyid du rnam par 'jog pa de las gzhan du gzhan gyis bstan pa la mi ltos par rang nyid thar pa thob par 'dod pa
translated: The spiritual potential for the sravaka is defined in terms of the quality of the wisdom that is capable of realizing the individual no self.

original: dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / gzung ba rang bzhin med @119b par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi yon tan brten pa'i cha nas rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nyid du 'jog cing /
analyzed: dang / gang zag gi bdag med pa dang / gzung ba rang bzhin med @119b par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi yon tan brten pa'i cha nas rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs nyid du 'jog cing /
translated: The spiritual potential for the pratyekabuddha is defined in terms of the quality of the wisdom that is capable of realizing the individual no self and the absence of an intrinsic nature in the apprehended.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa dang / bdag med gnyis kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par nus pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa dang / bdag med gnyis kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par nus pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The spiritual potential for the bodhisattva is defined in terms of the wish to attain perfect buddhahood for the sake of all sentient beings and the wisdom that is capable of realizing the thatness of the two kinds of no self.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i rten du 'dug pa'i sgo nas sems kyi chos nyid de la sangs rgyas kyi rigs zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i rten du 'dug pa'i sgo nas sems kyi chos nyid de la sangs rgyas kyi rigs zhes rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: The spiritual potential for the buddha is defined in terms of the mind's reality, which is the basis for the perfect qualities of both method and wisdom.

original: gzhan yang sems kyi chos nyid de nyid sngar bstan pa'i mos pa dang bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rtags kyi yon tan de rnams dang 'brel pas kyang rigs tha dad pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems kyi chos nyid de nyid sngar bstan pa'i mos pa dang bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rtags kyi yon tan de rnams dang 'brel pas kyang rigs tha dad pa nyid du rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the reality of mind is differentiated by the qualities of the signs of the occasion of faith, practice, and so on, as previously explained.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //
translated: Because the ultimate realm is undifferentiated,

original: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: the potential is not differentiated.

original: zhes brtsad pa'i len du //
analyzed: zhes brtsad pa'i len du //
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: rten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis //üîΩde yis dbye ba yongs su brjod //
analyzed: rten pa'i chos kyi dbye ba yis // de yis dbye ba yongs su brjod //
translated: By the differentiation of the phenomena that are based on it,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: its differentiation is fully expressed.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dam pa'i chos pad ma dkar po las //üîΩji ltar kham snod rdza mkhan gyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dam pa'i chos pad ma dkar po las // ji ltar kham snod rdza mkhan gyis //
translated: Moreover, in the noble Lotus of the True Dharma,üîΩit says:üîΩJust as a potter makes clay

original: 'jim pa mtshungs pa las byas pa //
analyzed: 'jim pa mtshungs pa las byas pa //
translated: pots from clay of the same kind,

original: de las snod du gyur pa ni //
analyzed: de las snod du gyur pa ni //
translated: from that, the pots become

original: bu ram 'o ma mar dang chu //
analyzed: bu ram 'o ma mar dang chu //
translated: sugar cane, milk, butter, and water,üîΩor some are vessels for filth,

original: yang na la la mi gtsang dang // kha cig zho yi snod du gyur //
analyzed: yang na la la mi gtsang dang // kha cig zho yi snod du gyur //
translated: and some are vessels for yogurt.

original: kham pa sna gcig de blangs te //
analyzed: kham pa sna gcig de blangs te //
translated: Taking up that single clay

original: rdzas kyis kyang ni snod du byas //
analyzed: rdzas kyis kyang ni snod du byas //
translated: And by substance, it is made into a vessel.

original: ji ltar dngos po bcug pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po bcug pa bzhin //
translated: Just as the thing is put in,

original: de ni snod kyang so sor rtogs //
analyzed: de ni snod kyang so sor rtogs //
translated: So it is that the vessel is individually discerned.

original: de bzhin sems can bye brag med //
analyzed: de bzhin sems can bye brag med //
translated: So it is with sentient beings, without distinction.

original: tha dad mos pas de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: tha dad mos pas de bzhin gshegs //
translated: With different aspirations, the Tathagatas

original: theg pa tha dad rab ston kyang //üîΩtheg pa sangs rgyas theg par nges //
analyzed: theg pa tha dad rab ston kyang // theg pa sangs rgyas theg par nges //
translated: Teach different vehicles,

original: zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te //
translated: But the vehicle is certain to be the Buddha-vehicle.

original: de dag gi don yang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rang bzhin spros pa dang bral zhing rig pa gsal ba tsam du mtshungs pas thams cad theg pa chen po'i rigs can gcig nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi don yang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rang bzhin spros pa dang bral zhing rig pa gsal ba tsam du mtshungs pas thams cad theg pa chen po'i rigs can gcig nyid yin zhing /
translated: The meaning of these [verses] is as follows: Since the nature of the mind of all sentient beings is the same, being free from conceptual elaborations and merely clear awareness, all of them are of the single MahƒÅyƒÅna family.

original: de nyid kyis na lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa yang gcig nyid yin mod kyi //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na lam dang 'bras bu'i theg pa yang gcig nyid yin mod kyi //
translated: Therefore, the path and the fruition vehicles are also of one single nature.

original: ji ltar rdza mkhan gcig gis 'jim pa mtshungs pa cig las snod rnam pa mtshungs pa du ma byas pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar rdza mkhan gcig gis 'jim pa mtshungs pa cig las snod rnam pa mtshungs pa du ma byas pa na //
translated: When a single potter makes many similar vessels from a single lump of clay,

original: de rnams la rnam pa 'am rang bzhin gyis dbye ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: de rnams la rnam pa 'am rang bzhin gyis dbye ba med mod kyi /
translated: there is no difference in their nature or substance.

original: de rnams kyi nang du sbrang rtsi dang li khar la sogs pa so sor blugs pa na //üîΩyon tan de rnams kyi dbye bas 'ga' zhig ni sbrang rtsi'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du sbrang rtsi dang li khar la sogs pa so sor blugs pa na // yon tan de rnams kyi dbye bas 'ga' zhig ni sbrang rtsi'i bum pa'o //
translated: When honey, lac, etc. are put into them,üîΩthey are distinguished by their qualities and are called, respectively, a pot of honey,

original: 'di ni li kha ra'i bum pa'o zhes so sor 'jog pa @120a * //
analyzed: 'di ni li kha ra'i bum pa'o zhes so sor 'jog pa @120a * //
translated: a pot of lac, etc.

original: de bzhin du //
analyzed: de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way,

original: sems can kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi rigs la dbye ba med kyang sngar bstan pa ltar gnas skabs kyi yon tan de rnams kyang so sor 'brel bas rigs tha dad bar 'jog cing //
analyzed: sems can kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi rigs la dbye ba med kyang sngar bstan pa ltar gnas skabs kyi yon tan de rnams kyang so sor 'brel bas rigs tha dad bar 'jog cing //
translated: although there is no distinction in the natural family of the mind of sentient beings, the family is distinguished by the qualities mentioned above, which are related to it in a certain way.

original: de sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang tha dang par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de sbyong bar byed pa'i lam dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa yang tha dang par bstan pa'o //
translated: And the path which purifies it and the vehicle which is the result of purification are also distinguished.üîΩThe teaching of the severance of the family is also like this.

original: rigs chad pa bstan pa yang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la 'di dag ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i mdo dang 'dul ba ma yin no zhes skur ba btab pas //
analyzed: rigs chad pa bstan pa yang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod theg pa chen po'i mdo sde la 'di dag ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i mdo dang 'dul ba ma yin no zhes skur ba btab pas //
translated: In the Bodhisattva Canon, the scriptures of the Great Vehicle, it is said that some are not in accord with liberation, and so they are disparaged.

original: sngar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi 'bras bu 'byin mi nus par byas pa'i sgo nas bcom pa ste //
analyzed: sngar bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi 'bras bu 'byin mi nus par byas pa'i sgo nas bcom pa ste //
translated: It is destroyed in the sense that it is unable to produce the fruit of all the roots of virtue previously accumulated.

original: de 'dra ba'i log par lta ba dang bcas pa'i rigs la thar pa thob mi nus pa la dgongs shing /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i log par lta ba dang bcas pa'i rigs la thar pa thob mi nus pa la dgongs shing /
translated: The thought is that one cannot attain liberation in a family that possesses such wrong views.

original: sems can rnams de 'dra ba'i lta ba skyes pa spang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems can rnams de 'dra ba'i lta ba skyes pa spang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: It was taught in order to abandon the arising of such views in sentient beings,

original: ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa ste /
translated: and in order to prevent the arising of those that have not yet arisen.

original: gzhan du na mdo sde 'di nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa las bstan pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mdo sde 'di nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa las bstan pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the teaching of this very s≈´tra and the teaching of the MahƒÅparinirvƒÅ·πáa S≈´tra.

original: gzhan yang theg pa gcig tu bstan pa dgongs pa can nyid du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa gcig tu bstan pa dgongs pa can nyid du gsungs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, it is said that the teaching of a single vehicle is provisional

original: gnas skabs dang mthar thug pa dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba la ma ltos par gcig pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin pas de ltar bstan pa'am /
analyzed: gnas skabs dang mthar thug pa dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye ba la ma ltos par gcig pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin pas de ltar bstan pa'am /
translated: because the teaching that there is only one vehicle without distinguishing the temporary, ultimate, conventional, and ultimate is provisional.

original: gzhan yang gnas skabs tha dad pa la dgongs shing de ltar bstan pas 'dul ba'i sems can gyi don du gsungs pa yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas skabs tha dad pa la dgongs shing de ltar bstan pas 'dul ba'i sems can gyi don du gsungs pa yin pas skyon med do //
translated: Moreover, since the Buddha taught the three vehicles with the intention of the different situations of disciples, and for the sake of those disciples who are to be guided, there is no fault.

original: yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs kyi rtags rnams kyang gang zag gi rgyud rnams la rtag tu ldan par nges pa med do //
analyzed: yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs kyi rtags rnams kyang gang zag gi rgyud rnams la rtag tu ldan par nges pa med do //
translated: Moreover, the signs of the family that were taught earlier are not definitely always present in the mindstreams of individuals.

original: ji ltar snying rje med cing rang nyid 'ba' zhig grol bar 'dod pa dang / phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyang theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje med cing rang nyid 'ba' zhig grol bar 'dod pa dang / phung po la sogs pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyang theg pa chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'am /
translated: For example, those who are without compassion and who desire liberation for themselves alone and those who are attached to the general and specific characteristics of the aggregates and so on appear to have the potential for the MahƒÅyƒÅna,

original: rkyen nges pa med pa gang yang rung ba la brten nas /
analyzed: rkyen nges pa med pa gang yang rung ba la brten nas /
translated: due to encountering a MahƒÅyƒÅna spiritual friend or some other uncertain condition.

original: snying rje dang ldan zhing bdag med pa gnyis kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin la mos ba lta bur snang la /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan zhing bdag med pa gnyis kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa dang / de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin la mos ba lta bur snang la /
translated: They come to possess compassion, realize the suchness of the two kinds of no-self, and aspire to such a nature.

original: yang snying rje dang ldan zhing sems can gyi don byed pa'i dka' ba'i spyod pa bzod pa rnams kyang rkyen gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig la brten nas de las bzlog pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid du myong ba'i tshad mas @120b grub pa dang /
analyzed: yang snying rje dang ldan zhing sems can gyi don byed pa'i dka' ba'i spyod pa bzod pa rnams kyang rkyen gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig la brten nas de las bzlog pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid du myong ba'i tshad mas @120b grub pa dang /
translated: Moreover, those who are compassionate and endure the difficult deeds that benefit sentient beings are established by valid knowledge to experience the opposite of that based on some condition.

original: bstan bcos dbu ma'i snang ba las kyang de ltar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbu ma'i snang ba las kyang de ltar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, it is explained in that way in the treatise Illumination of the Middle Way.

original: gzhan yang gsung rab dag las phyogs du mas gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsung rab dag las phyogs du mas gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, although it is taught in many ways in the scriptures,

original: mthar thug la rigs gcig nyid yin par tshad ma'i stobs kyis kyang gzhag par nus te /
analyzed: mthar thug la rigs gcig nyid yin par tshad ma'i stobs kyis kyang gzhag par nus te /
translated: it can be established by the power of valid knowledge that ultimately there is only one lineage.

original: sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing rig pa gsal ba tsam gyi rang bzhin ni sngar bstan pa ltar sangs rgyas nyid kyi rigs yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid spros pa dang bral zhing rig pa gsal ba tsam gyi rang bzhin ni sngar bstan pa ltar sangs rgyas nyid kyi rigs yin la /
translated: The nature of the reality of the mind, which is free from elaborations and merely clear awareness, is the lineage of buddhahood, as was previously explained.

original: de yang sems can thams cad la yod pa nyid du sgrub ste /
analyzed: de yang sems can thams cad la yod pa nyid du sgrub ste /
translated: That is also established as existing in all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ming shes pa rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams res 'ga' ba nyid du dmigs pas kun rdzob tsam du yang sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / gzung 'dzin gyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ming shes pa rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams res 'ga' ba nyid du dmigs pas kun rdzob tsam du yang sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Since afflictions such as attachment, non-afflicted names such as the concepts of apprehended and apprehender, and virtuous mental factors such as faith are observed to be intermittent, they are not the nature of the mind even in terms of the relative.

original: myong zhing rig pa tsam ni rtag tu sems la rjes su 'brang ba nyid du grub pas kun rdzob tu sems kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: myong zhing rig pa tsam ni rtag tu sems la rjes su 'brang ba nyid du grub pas kun rdzob tu sems kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Since mere experience and awareness are always found to accompany the mind, they are the nature of the mind in terms of the relative.

original: mel tsha ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mel tsha ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like the watchman.

original: don dam par stong pa nyid ni rigs pa'i stobs kyis sngar bstan pa ltar grub ste /
analyzed: don dam par stong pa nyid ni rigs pa'i stobs kyis sngar bstan pa ltar grub ste /
translated: As for emptiness in the ultimate sense, it is established by the power of reasoning, as explained above.

original: rig pa dang stong pa de dag kyang phan tshun zung du 'jug pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: rig pa dang stong pa de dag kyang phan tshun zung du 'jug pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Both awareness and emptiness are by nature indivisible and united.

original: de ltar na dri ma rnams glo bur ba phyin ci log gi yul can yin pas de dang 'gal ba yang dag pa'i yul can gyi ye shes sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnyen po goms shing mngon du byas pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na dri ma rnams glo bur ba phyin ci log gi yul can yin pas de dang 'gal ba yang dag pa'i yul can gyi ye shes sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnyen po goms shing mngon du byas pa na /
translated: Thus, since the stains are adventitious and have mistaken objects, when the antidote, which is the opposite of that and has correct objects, is cultivated and actualized, it is the wisdom that is the nature of the mind.üîΩ

original: sa bon dang bcas te spangs par nus la /
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas te spangs par nus la /
translated: Thus, since the stains are adventitious and have mistaken objects, when the antidote, which is the opposite of that and has correct objects, is cultivated and actualized, it is able to eliminate the stains together with their seeds.

original: de dag spangs pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin mngon du byas pa ni chos kyi sku zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag spangs pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin mngon du byas pa ni chos kyi sku zhes bya ste /
translated: The actualization of the nature of the mind, which is the elimination of those stains, is called the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa nyid du bdag nyid so so la grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i sa bon dang ldan pa nyid du bdag nyid so so la grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the possession of such seeds is established for each individual.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang kun rdzob tu myong ba rig pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin yang kun rdzob tu myong ba rig pa tsam yin te /
translated: Likewise, the nature of all sentient beings is also mere awareness that is experienced conventionally.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid kyi myong ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig mdun du byas nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid kyi myong ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig mdun du byas nas /
translated: Having brought to the fore some particular experience of one‚Äôs own,

original: sems nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa na /
analyzed: sems nyid du tha snyad 'dogs pa na /
translated: when one imputes the convention ‚Äúmind,‚Äù

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khyad par gang yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khyad par gang yin yang bla ste /
translated: it is fine whether it is a particular experience of pleasure or pain.

original: spyir myong rig tsam gyi ldog pa mdun du byas nas sems su tha snyad btags par myong ba'i tshad ma nyid kyis grub ste /
analyzed: spyir myong rig tsam gyi ldog pa mdun du byas nas sems su tha snyad btags par myong ba'i tshad ma nyid kyis grub ste /
translated: In general, the mere aspect of mere experience is taken as the basis. The mind is established by the valid knowledge of experience that is designated by the term ‚Äúmind.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sems can gzhan gyi sems rgyud kyang gal te sems nyid yin na myong rig gi rang bzhin yin la /üîΩde lta ma yin na sems su gdags @121a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can gzhan gyi sems rgyud kyang gal te sems nyid yin na myong rig gi rang bzhin yin la / de lta ma yin na sems su gdags @121a * //
translated: Therefore, if the mind streams of other sentient beings are mind, they are the nature of experience.üîΩIf they are not like that, there is no point in designating them as mind.

original: pa'i don med pas sems nyid ma yin par zad do /
analyzed: pa'i don med pas sems nyid ma yin par zad do /
translated: Therefore, they are not mind.

original: 'di ni so sor nges pa'i dngos po la brten nas mtshan nyid spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa tshad ma gcig gi byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni so sor nges pa'i dngos po la brten nas mtshan nyid spyi'i tshul du rtogs pa tshad ma gcig gi byed pa ste /
translated: This is the activity of one valid knowledge that realizes a general characteristic based on a specific thing.

original: gtan tshigs thams cad kyi khyab pa sgrub pa'i tshul yang 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad kyi khyab pa sgrub pa'i tshul yang 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is also the way to establish the pervasion of all reasons.

original: de yang dper na mdun du byas pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la mer tha snyad byed pas na gsal zhing 'bar ba 'am /
analyzed: de yang dper na mdun du byas pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig la mer tha snyad byed pas na gsal zhing 'bar ba 'am /
translated: For example, if one uses the term ‚Äúfire‚Äù in relation to a thing that is taken as the basis, it is clear and blazing.

original: chen po la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ldog pa 'ga' zhig mdun du byas nas mer tha snyad byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ldog pa 'ga' zhig mdun du byas nas mer tha snyad byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the term ‚Äúfire‚Äù is applied after having made some particular instance of fire, such as a big fire, manifest.

original: 'on kyang khyad par de rnams gang yin yang bla ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par de rnams gang yin yang bla ste /
translated: It is not necessary to make any particular instance of fire manifest.

original: spyir tsha zhing sreg pa tsam gyi ldog pa de nyid mdun du byas nas mer tha snyad btags pa nyid du nyams su myong ba'i tshad ma nyid kyis grub la /
analyzed: spyir tsha zhing sreg pa tsam gyi ldog pa de nyid mdun du byas nas mer tha snyad btags pa nyid du nyams su myong ba'i tshad ma nyid kyis grub la /
translated: The valid cognition of experience establishes that the term ‚Äúfire‚Äù is applied after having made manifest the mere general property of being hot and burning.

original: de nyid kyis ma mthong ba'i yul gzhan na yod pa'i me thams cad kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ma mthong ba'i yul gzhan na yod pa'i me thams cad kyang /
translated: By that very valid cognition, one understands that all the fire that exists in other places that are not seen is also fire.

original: gal te me yin na tsha zhing sreg pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gal te me yin na tsha zhing sreg pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: If it is fire, it must have the nature of being hot and burning.üîΩIf it is not, then there is no point in calling it ‚Äúfire.‚Äù

original: da lta yin na mer tha snyad gdags pa'i don med pas ma yin no zhes sngar so sor nges pa'i dngos po la brten nas zhugs pa'i tshad ma de nyid kyis rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: da lta yin na mer tha snyad gdags pa'i don med pas ma yin no zhes sngar so sor nges pa'i dngos po la brten nas zhugs pa'i tshad ma de nyid kyis rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is understood by the valid cognition that engages in the object by relying on the particular entity that was seen before.

original: don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa ni sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The ultimate nature of emptiness should be understood by following the reasoning taught above.

original: de ltar na rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de 'dra ba ni sems can thams cad la yod pa nyid du grub pas thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rigs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rig pa dang stong pa zung du 'jug pa spros pa dang bral zhing 'od gsal ba de 'dra ba ni sems can thams cad la yod pa nyid du grub pas thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rigs can zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is established that the union of awareness and emptiness, which is free from conceptual elaborations and is luminous, exists in all sentient beings. Therefore, all are said to be of the buddha lineage.

original: de skad du yang 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa las /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa las /
translated: As it says in the Display of Manjushri:

original: khye'u byang chub sems dpas rang gi sems rtogs par bya ba las ma rtogs pa khong du chud par bya ba las gzhan ci yang med do //
analyzed: khye'u byang chub sems dpas rang gi sems rtogs par bya ba las ma rtogs pa khong du chud par bya ba las gzhan ci yang med do //
translated: The young man said, ‚ÄúThere is nothing other than the bodhisattva‚Äôs own mind to be realized and to be understood.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems can thams cad kyi sems rtogs pa yin no rang gi sems dpen pas sems can thams cad kyi sems dpen no //
analyzed: rang gi sems rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid sems can thams cad kyi sems rtogs pa yin no rang gi sems dpen pas sems can thams cad kyi sems dpen no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe realization of one‚Äôs own mind is the realization of the minds of all sentient beings. The mind of all sentient beings is isolated, just like one‚Äôs own mind.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin gyis sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin gyis sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of one‚Äôs own mind is the nature of all sentient beings.

original: rang gi sems rnam par dag pas sems can thams cad kyi sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi sems rnam par dag pas sems can thams cad kyi sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The purity of one‚Äôs own mind is the purity of the minds of all sentient beings.

original: gal te dri ma dang bral ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin re zhig mngon du byas pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te dri ma dang bral ba'i sems kyi rang bzhin re zhig mngon du byas pa de lta na yang /
translated: One might say, ‚ÄúEven if one has realized the nature of mind free from stains,

original: phyis de las nyams par 'gyur bas de ni chos kyi sku'i ye shes ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyis de las nyams par 'gyur bas de ni chos kyi sku'i ye shes ma yin no zhe na /
translated: later one will fall away from that, so that is not the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya.‚Äù

original: @121b ma yin te /
analyzed: @121b ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: spyir ye shes rgyun chad pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur la /
analyzed: spyir ye shes rgyun chad pa nyid mi 'thad pa ni 'og nas ston par 'gyur la /
translated: In general, it is untenable that the continuum of wisdom is severed, as will be shown below.

original: dri ma rnams kyang 'byung ba yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dri ma rnams kyang 'byung ba yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also untenable that stains arise again.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i gnyen po goms shing mthar thug pas de rnams kyi rtsa bar 'gyur ba bdag tu 'dzin pa sa bon dang bcas nas spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i gnyen po goms shing mthar thug pas de rnams kyi rtsa bar 'gyur ba bdag tu 'dzin pa sa bon dang bcas nas spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the root of those stains, the apprehension of a self, is abandoned along with its seeds through the cultivation and culmination of the antidotes that are incompatible with them.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: bdag lta'i sa bon spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag lta'i sa bon spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the seeds of the view of a self,

original: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: slar mi gshegs pa nyid yin no //
translated: It will not return.

original: gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang //
analyzed: gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang //
translated: And also:

original: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
translated: Nonviolence and the true meaning

original: rang bzhin las ni phyir log na //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni phyir log na //
translated: Turn back from their nature,

original: 'bad du zin kyang mi zlogs te //
analyzed: 'bad du zin kyang mi zlogs te //
translated: Even if you try, you cannot stop them,

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because your mind is fixed on that.

original: de'i don yang bdag med par rtogs pa so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes mthar thug de 'dra ba ni yang dag pa'i yul can yin pa dang // sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas phyin ci log gis tshur la gzhom mi nus shing /
analyzed: de'i don yang bdag med par rtogs pa so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes mthar thug de 'dra ba ni yang dag pa'i yul can yin pa dang // sems kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pas phyin ci log gis tshur la gzhom mi nus shing /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The ultimate, individually cognized pristine wisdom that understands selflessness is the subject of the true nature, and because it is the nature of the mind, it cannot be overcome by error.

original: yang sdug bsngal gyi 'tshe ba dang / phyin ci log dang skyo ba'i 'tshe ba med pa sa ched du'i gnyen po gzhan bsgom pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa yang mi 'thad ces pa'o //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal gyi 'tshe ba dang / phyin ci log dang skyo ba'i 'tshe ba med pa sa ched du'i gnyen po gzhan bsgom pa'i sgo nas bzlog pa yang mi 'thad ces pa'o //
translated: And since it is free from the violence of suffering, the violence of error, and the violence of weariness, it is not right to say that it is overcome by the antidote of deliberately cultivating another mind.

original: de bzhin du theg pa gcig nyid kyang rigs pa'i stobs kyis grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du theg pa gcig nyid kyang rigs pa'i stobs kyis grub pa nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the oneness of the vehicles is also established by the power of reasoning.

original: 'dir de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab lam gyi gtso bo yin par sngar bsgrubs la /
analyzed: 'dir de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i shes rab lam gyi gtso bo yin par sngar bsgrubs la /
translated: Here, it has been established that the wisdom that realizes thatness is the principal path.

original: de kho na nyid kyang 'gal ba du ma mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang 'gal ba du ma mi 'thad de /

original: gcig nyid yin pas de rtogs pa'i shes rab kyang gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pas de rtogs pa'i shes rab kyang gcig nyid yin te /

original: des na lam mthar thug pa ni gcig nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: des na lam mthar thug pa ni gcig nyid yin zhing /

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu mthar thug pa yang gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu mthar thug pa yang gcig nyid do //

analyzed: gal te mthar thug pa gcig nyid yin zhes kyi de tsam gyis theg pa gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /

analyzed: ji ltar rigs mthar thug pa rgyal po'i rigs gcig nyid yin mod kyi /

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /

original: 'dir gang zag gi bdag med pa tsam rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'dir gang zag gi bdag med pa tsam rtogs shing /

analyzed: rang nyid thar pa thob par bya ba'i don du de ltar bsgoms pa de nyid rim gyis bdag med pa gnyis rtogs shing ;

analyzed: byang chub mchog tu sems bskyed nas tshogs gnyis rdzogs par byas te sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bas /

original: dman pa'i lam de dag kyang theg pa chen po'i lam gyi rgyun gcig gi thog ma de nyid kyi yan lag yin pas mthar thug la theg pa chen po'i lam gcig nyid yin zhes pa ste /üîΩji @122a * //

analyzed: ltar tshul khrims dang bag yod kyi yan lag la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i lam gyi yan lag yin pas de nyid du 'dus pa bzhin no //

analyzed: mi rnams kyi rigs so sor nges shing dmangs rigs las rim gyis rgyal po nyid du 'gro ba ma yin pas tha dad pa nyid du nges pa'o //

original: de skad du yang //
analyzed: de skad du yang //

analyzed: de nyid tshol la thog mar ni //

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: de skad du yang /

analyzed: rdul bral byang chub khyad par can reg nas // gal te nga yis theg pa dman pa la //

analyzed: nga la ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnam par 'jog pa med do //

translated: The meaning of the verse is that the ≈õrƒÅvaka stream enterer‚Äôs abandonment of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing together with their seeds, and so on up to the knowledge of the elimination and the knowledge of nonarising of the arhat, as previously explained, are

translated: Blessed One, the inconceivable transference of the Blessed Ones is that of the Arhats, the Solitary Buddhas, and the Bodhisattva-MahƒÅsattvas who have attained mastery, and those with mental bodies.

translated: The knowledge of the Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas arises thinking, ‚ÄúI have done what had to be done,‚Äù based on the abandonment of the afflictions of all ordinary beings, gods, humans, and so on, and the seven learners, which had not been previously abandoned.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dgra bcom pa rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang /
translated: they say, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, it is because the Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ma spangs pa dang / skye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su ma 'tshal ba yang mchis pa'i slad du'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: sems kyi skad cig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyis thog ma mchis pa'i dus nas mchis pa ni sems dang mi ldan pa lags so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnas kyis bzhi po 'di dag gi nang na stobs che ba gang lags pa de ni /

analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnas kyis stobs che ba'i grangs sam /

translated: Blessed One, in this way, the abode of ignorance is the most powerful.

analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang / kha dog dang / gzi brjid dang / stobs dang / 'khor dang / dbang phyug gis gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams zil gyis gnon to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa srid pa'i 'dod chags la gnas pa'i gnas kyi sa zhes bgyi bas kyang /

analyzed: gnas kyi sa bzhi po 'di dag zil gyis gnon to //

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma las 'das pa snyed kyi rten du gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa bzhi dang yang yun ring po nas lhan cig gnas pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes pas mi brdzi pa dang /

translated: It is the support for the secondary afflictions that are more numerous than the sands of the Ganges river, it is the long-term companion of the four afflictions, and it is not overcome by the knowledge of the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyis gzhom pa lags te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyis gzhom pa lags te /
translated: It is only destroyed by the wisdom of the enlightenment of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa ni stobs che ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa ni stobs che ba lags so //
translated: Blessed One, the ground of the abode of ignorance is powerful.

original: bcom ldan 'das dper na len pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i srid pa gsum pa 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dper na len pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i srid pa gsum pa 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Blessed One, for example, just as the three existences arise from the causes of contaminated actions, which are conditioned by grasping,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyi rkyen gyis zag pa ma mchis pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang // byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob pa rnams kyi yid kyi lus gsum 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyi rkyen gyis zag pa ma mchis pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang // byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob pa rnams kyi yid kyi lus gsum 'byung ba ste /
translated: Bhagavatƒ´, the three mental bodies of the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained power arise from the cause of uncontaminated karma, the condition of the abode of ignorance.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyis ni sa gsum po 'di dag tu yid kyi lus gsum po 'di dag 'byung ba dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i las mngon par 'grub pa'i rten lags so zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i gnas kyis ni sa gsum po 'di dag tu yid kyi lus gsum po 'di dag 'byung ba dang / zag pa ma mchis pa'i las mngon par 'grub pa'i rten lags so zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs nas /
translated: Bhagavatƒ´, the abode of ignorance is the support for the arising of these three mental bodies in these three grounds and for the accomplishment of uncontaminated karma.

original: gzhan yang de dag gi dbugs phyung ba bzhi po lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag gi dbugs phyung ba bzhi po lhag ma dang bcas pa nyid du gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said that they have a remainder of four exhalations.

original: bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal yongs su 'tshal ba lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sdug bsngal yongs su 'tshal ba lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: Bhagavatƒ´, the knowledge of suffering has a remainder.

original: kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: The origin that is to be abandoned has a remainder.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa mngon du bgyis pa lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa mngon du bgyis pa lhag ma dang bcas pa lags so //
translated: The realization of the cessation of suffering is incomplete.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam bsgoms pa lhag ma dang bcas pa @125b lags so zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam bsgoms pa lhag ma dang bcas pa @125b lags so zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cultivation of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering is incomplete.

original: de ltar na nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa bstan pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa bstan pa ci zhe na /
translated: Thus, why is the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., taught?

original: byis pa blo zhen rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byis pa blo zhen rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚ÄúFor the childish who are attached to the mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: don ni sngar bstan no //
analyzed: don ni sngar bstan no //
translated: The meaning is as previously explained.

original: theg pa'ang zhes pa ni du ma nyid kyang bstan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa'ang zhes pa ni du ma nyid kyang bstan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Vehicle‚Äù also means ‚Äútaught as manifold.‚Äù

original: theg pa med pa su la ston zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa med pa su la ston zhe na /
translated: To whom is the non-vehicle taught?

original: 'phags pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚ÄúFor the noble ones,‚Äù and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa don dam par stong pa nyid ni dam pa'i don te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang rig pa don dam par stong pa nyid ni dam pa'i don te /
translated: Non-dual self-awareness is ultimate emptiness.

original: chos kyi sku'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i sgo 'am thabs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i sgo 'am thabs zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the door or method for entering the wisdom of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: yang na dam pa'i don ni mthar thug pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i don ni mthar thug pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid yin la /
translated: Alternatively, the ultimate is the final ultimate expanse itself.

original: snga ma ni de'i sgo 'am thabs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni de'i sgo 'am thabs zhes pa'o //
translated: The former is called its door or means.

original: des na gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don la /
analyzed: des na gnyis su snang ba la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba 'phags pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don la /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the noble one's individual self-realization, which is free from the elaborations of dualistic appearances and so forth,

original: theg pa gsum la sogs pa med ces pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la sogs pa med ces pa'o //
translated: is that the three vehicles and so on do not exist.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi khyad par dang / de dag gi 'bras bur gyur ba'i theg pa'i bye brag rnams kyang rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma don dam pa'i de kho na nyid la yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi khyad par dang / de dag gi 'bras bur gyur ba'i theg pa'i bye brag rnams kyang rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbu ma don dam pa'i de kho na nyid la yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the distinctions of the path such as the concentrations and immeasurables, and the distinctions of vehicles that are the results of those, do not exist in the middle way of mere representation, the ultimate suchness.

original: blo gros chen po de la 'dod chen pa rnams kyi zhes pa'i don ni gang dag srid pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi bde ba la mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la 'dod chen pa rnams kyi zhes pa'i don ni gang dag srid pa'i longs spyod 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi bde ba la mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: With regard to therein, the worldlings, the meaning is those who are attached to the pleasures of the enjoyments of existence, the qualities of desire.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bin da'i gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
analyzed: bin da'i gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
translated: The place of Bindu is delightful,

original: wa nyid gyur kyang mchog yin gyi //
analyzed: wa nyid gyur kyang mchog yin gyi //
translated: even if one becomes a fox, it is supreme,

original: go tam yul rnams spangs pa yi //
analyzed: go tam yul rnams spangs pa yi //
translated: but for Gautama, abandoning the objects,

original: thar pa nam yang mi 'tshal lo //üîΩzhes zer ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: thar pa nam yang mi 'tshal lo // zhes zer ba lta bu'am /
translated: I will never seek liberation.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi srid pa'i bde ba tsam mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan dang gzugs med kyi srid pa'i bde ba tsam mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Or else, they only desire the happiness of existence in the absorptions and formless states.

original: de dag gi don du bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas pa yang /
analyzed: de dag gi don du bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas pa yang /
translated: For their sake, they accumulate merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la skur pa btab pas spangs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la skur pa btab pas spangs pa ste /
translated: But they are rejected by the Bodhisattvapitaka,

original: 'bras bu 'byin par mi nus pa nyid du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin par mi nus pa nyid du byas pa'o //
translated: because they are unable to produce results.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chen pa ni spyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba'i tshul rnam pa bzhi ste ji skad du //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dod chen pa ni spyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba'i tshul rnam pa bzhi ste ji skad du //
translated: The bodhisattva of great desire generally has four ways of being born as a bodhisattva, as it is said:
